title: Canadiens' Carey Price enters NHL/NHLPA's player assistance program
excerpt: Coach Dominique Ducharme told reporters Wednesday that Price is "not doing well right now" as he recovers from a non-COVID-19 illness. Price also had offseason surgery to repair a torn meniscus.
summary:
Canadiens goaltender Carey Price will be 'away from the team while voluntarily taking part in the NHL/NHLPA player assistance program," the NHL and NHLPA announced Thursday.

Coach Dominique Ducharme told reporters Wednesday that Price is "not doing well right now" as he recovers from a non-COVID-19 illness. Price also had offseason surgery to repair a torn meniscus.

Price, 34, went 12-7-5, registering a 2.64 goals-against average and .901 save percentage, with one shutout last season.

This is a developing story.
label: sport

title: Finland, Czech Republic, Sweden name 3 players for 2022 Olympic hockey rosters
excerpt: Hurricanes center Sebastian Aho, Lightning defenseman Victor Hedman and Bruins winger David Pastrnak are among the players chosen by their countries to preliminary Beijing Olympic hockey rosters.
summary: Finland, the Czech Republic and Sweden have each named the first three players to their preliminary men's hockey roster for the 2022 Olympics. Hurricanes center Sebastian Aho, Panthers captain and center Aleksander Barkov and Avalanche winger Mikko Rantanen were named to Finland's initial roster, marking the first Olympic Games for all three.Rangers center Mika Zibanejad, Lightning defenseman Victor Hedman and Avalance winger Gabriel Landeskog are the first three players to be named to Sweden's hockey team.
label: sport

title: 2022 four-star decommits from Michigan football
excerpt: Bummer, but onto the next.
summary:
It was big news for Michigan football when it had started to reel in prospects over the summer. In a one-month stretch between June 19 and July 12, the Wolverines managed to get nine commits, with perhaps the most lauded being Tampa (Fla.) Gaither four-star EDGE Mario Eugenio.

Eugenio made his pledge to the Wolverines on July 5, and immediately started to recruit for his new team quite vocally. Rated the No. 268 prospect nationally by the 247Sports Composite, his commitment appeared to spurn another, with his Gaither teammate, three-star linebacker Micah Pollard, being the last of the nine to commit to Michigan.
label: sport

title: Baker Mayfield Playing Through Serious Injury
excerpt: The Cleveland Browns star quarterback may be struggling through a significant injury.
summary: (Photo by Norm Hall/Getty Images)CLEVELAND — Cleveland Browns quarterback Baker Mayfield is playing through a significant injury. According to ESPN, Mayfield suffered a partially torn labrum in his left shoulder in mid-September. News of the injury emerged after the quarterback had his worst game of the season against the Minnesota Vikings on Sunday, completing fewer than 50 percent of his passes. Mayfield is a right-handed quarterback, so the injury is in his non-throwing arm. Live in Cleveland? Click here to subscribe to our free breaking news alerts delivered to your inbox and mobile devices.
label: sport

title: Hoyer: Pitching Will Be Cubs' Top Priority
excerpt: Cubs president Jed Hoyer says pitching is his top offseason need but doesn't sound like he'll be very aggressive. Read more at MLB Trade Rumors.
summary: As the Cubs (and most other teams around the game) shift their focus to the offseason, president of baseball operations Jed Hoyer told reporters this week that improving and deepening his pitching staff will be his 'No. 1 priority' this winter (links via Russell Dorsey of the Chicago Sun-Times and Gordon Wittenmyer of NBC Sports Chicago). That said, Hoyer also preached the importance of utilizing the team's considerable financial flexibility 'in an intelligent way' and pointed to Rays and Giants as examples of teams who made under-the-radar moves to bring themselves into the postseason.
label: sport

title: Lights, cameras, action: The White Sox prepare for their spotlight. How long will it last? – The Athletic
excerpt: Are the White Sox up to the task of taking down the Astros in the ALDS? We're about to find out.
summary: HOUSTON — As the White Sox filed out of the visiting clubhouse onto the field Wednesday afternoon, an unfamiliar crowd was waiting for them: a phalanx of TV cameras set up to record their workout.The playoffs, even the division series, are a spectacle.'You got cameras now!' White Sox shortstop Tim Anderson yelled to no one in particular. 'Don't get nervous!'Not long before that, Anderson was in the interview room, telling everyone how nervous he wasn't.'These are the moments you want to be in,' he said.
label: sport

title: Queen Elizabeth launches baton relay for Commonwealth Games
excerpt: LONDON (AP) — Queen Elizabeth II held her first major engagement at Buckingham Palace...
summary:
LONDON (AP) — Queen Elizabeth II held her first major engagement at Buckingham Palace since the onset of the coronavirus pandemic a year and a half ago, as she presided Thursday over the launch of the baton relay for next year's Commonwealth Games in the central England city of Birmingham.

British Paralympic gold medalist Kadeena Cox, fresh from winning another two events in Tokyo, had the honor of taking the baton from the queen on the first leg of its 90,000-mile (145,000 kilometer) journey.

The relay will go through 72 nations and territories of the Commonwealth over 294 days and will return to Birmingham for the opening ceremony on July 28.
label: sport

title: Despite his recent knee problems and struggles vs. the Astros, Lance Lynn will take the ball in Game 1 of the ALDS. – The Athletic
excerpt: Despite his recent knee problems and struggles vs. the Astros, Lance Lynn will take the ball in Game 1 of the ALDS.
summary: HOUSTON — The White Sox traded away six years of Dane Dunning and cashed out on prospect Avery Weems' standout instructional league showing, all on the basis that Lance Lynn was the guy to head up their rotation — on the field and in the clubhouse — as they pushed toward a World Series.Surely, they even envisioned last December that they were acquiring the man they would give the ball to for Game 1 of the American League Division Series. After an arguably career-best season at age 34, enabled in part by the stability and focus brought by landing on a contender happy to center its rotation around him, it's certainly what Lynn threw throughout the 2020 shutdown and prepared his body for 'You miss it,' Lynn told The Athletic.
label: sport

title: US skier Shiffrin plans more speed races in new season
excerpt: Mikaela Shiffrin is planning a return to speed racing in the alpine skiing World Cup...
summary: Mikaela Shiffrin is planning a return to speed racing in the alpine skiing World Cup season, after reducing her schedule almost exclusively to slalom and giant slalom last year.The American two-time Olympic champion said on Thursday she was eyeing a start at the first speed races of the season: Two downhills and a super-G in Lake Louise, Alberta, in early December. 'For my whole career my focus will always be tech, but I love speed, and I love Lake Louise especially, so that is in the plan right now,' Shiffrin said.
label: sport

title: With Holly Holm out, Aspen Ladd steps in to face Norma Dumont in UFC Vegas 40 main event
excerpt: Aspen Ladd will replace Holly Holm on short notice to face Norma Dumont in a featherweight main event at UFC Vegas 40.
summary:
An injury to former UFC champion Holly Holm has led to a switch to next weekend's main event.
Multiple people with knowledge of the promotion's plans confirmed to MMA Fighting that a knee injury has knocked Holm out of her featherweight bout with Norma Dumont at UFC Vegas 40 on Oct. 16 and that Aspen Ladd will step in as a replacement. The 145-pound matchup will still serve as the event's headliner. MMA journalist Ariel Helwani was first to report Holm's scratch, while ESPN was first to report the new booking.
label: sport

title: Trocação Franca: Mackenzie Dern on endless accent debate, choosing to represent Brazil over U.S., Marina Rodriguez and more
excerpt: Jiu-jitsu legend and rising UFC strawweight contender Mackenzie Dern goes deep on her Brazilian roots, the endless debate over her accent and more ahead of her UFC main event against Marina Rodriguez.
summary:
Mackenzie Dern is after all the marbles.
The jiu-jitsu legend and rising UFC strawweight star stops by MMA Fighting's Portuguese-language podcast Trocação Franca to discuss everything ahead of her first UFC main event at UFC Vegas 39 opposite Marina Rodriguez this Saturday, from the non-stop annoying debate around her accent, to whether or not she's seen as a true Brazilian, how motherhood changed her life and career, how beauty affects one's career, potentially fighting for UFC gold with a win over Rodriguez, and more.
label: sport

title: Coastal Carolina vs. Arkansas State
excerpt: One of the suprisingly rising programs in the country look for another victory Thursday night when they take on Arkansas State
summary: Whether people realize it or not, the Coastal Carolinia Chanticleers are a force to be reckoned with, even though not many people know who they are. They burst onto the scene last scene, playing anyone who'd be willing to play them. Now, they are searching for respect, and a conference title. They look to continue their winning ways on Thursday night when they meet the Arkansas State Red Wolves.Outside of a three-point win oer Buffalo three weeks ago, the Chanticleers have been dominant in the early going of the 2021 season.
label: sport

title: Fred Couples says he'd like to serve as Ryder Cup captain, but he may be too late
excerpt: "Would I like to be Ryder Cup captain? Of course."
summary: It was the right time, of that Jim Furyk was certain. Left for him to decide was whether he was in the right place or the wrong place when the Ryder Cup ended. Furyk, an assistant captain to Steve Stricker, was standing on the 16th tee with both captains on the final day at Whistling Straits when word arrived that Collin Morikawa had birdied the 17th hole and was assured the half-point the Americans needed to win.Phil Mickelson said he was happy contributing to Team USA's 19-9 win differently than he's used to.
label: sport

title: Zhang Weili: Rose Namajunas' anti-communism remark ‘crossed the line,' turned fans against me
excerpt: Zhang Weili thinks Rose Namajunas' controversial political comments ahead of their first fight turned UFC fans against her.
summary: Holly Holm has suffered a knee injury and won't fight Norma Dumont in the UFC Fight Night 195 main event next week.Seth Gilliam tells Insider that unlike his "TWD" counterpart, he doesn't think he'd want to fight in a post-apocalyptic world.South Carolina drivers might want to read this before paying their next auto insurance bill.Dern knows full well the importance of a win. And so she'll rely heavily on her jiu-jitsu skills Saturday to get her to where she wants to be.Tampa Bay Times, St. Petersburg, Fla.
label: sport

title: Three things we've learned about the Utah Jazz through the preseason
excerpt: How are things going with the games that don't count? For the Jazz this preseason, there has been plenty of experimentation.
summary: It seems a little surreal that the Utah Jazz are now less than two weeks away from opening their regular season against the Oklahoma City Thunder The preseason goes a little faster than it did a few years ago. The eight-game marathon is quite literally a thing of the past, replaced by a four-game sprint that doesn't provide a lot of time to get your proverbial ducks in a row.Halfway to their preseason finish line, we don't know much about what the Jazz are going to be once the regular season starts.
label: sport

title: Eric Stokes' growth, AJ Dillon's burst and near-blocked kicks: Packers film review
excerpt: The Packers will rely on Stokes even more as the No. 1 outside cornerback if All-Pro Jaire Alexander is out for any significant time.
summary: Welcome back to another Packers film review, your favorite time of the week!This time, we're cutting down the number of plays/themes/players we're focusing on and instead expanding more on a fewer number of them. I also figured out how to draw circles and arrows by hand on the screenshots!This week, we pinpoint two plays that showed how rookie first-round cornerback Eric Stokes is playing, at times, like a veteran, and what that means going forward if the Packers are without All-Pro cornerback Jaire Alexander We'll examine how AJ Dillon being more than just a power back who plows people over can boost the Packers' running game.
label: sport

title: ‘You should see him play baseball': The many talents of Washington receiver Jalen McMillan
excerpt: Jalen McMillan averaged more than 100 receiving yards and a touchdown per game for his career at San Joaquin Memorial High in Fresno.
summary: SEATTLE — There was an Excel spreadsheet and a list of criteria and, essentially, a top three. Jalen McMillan , a star receiver from Fresno (Calif.) San Joaquin Memorial, would likely attend either USC, Oklahoma or Washington.Except he already had decided, and nobody else knew.During an unofficial visit to UW in June 2019, McMillan wandered from the recruiting lobby into coach Chris Petersen's office. He emerged with a 'gigantic grin' on his face, said his mother, Belinda McMillan Haener, and Petersen announced to the gathered visitors: 'We've got a Dawg!''We got it on video,' McMillan Haener said.
label: sport

title: Here's why I didn't rank Kobe Bryant among the top 10 NBA players of all-time
excerpt: Kobe Bryant was a great scorer, but not a top-10 player, says columnist Nancy Armour as part of USA TODAY's NBA's 75 all-time greatest players.
summary:
There's being a great shooter, and there's being a great player.

Kobe Bryant is unquestionably the former. He is fourth on the NBA's career scoring list, and third in field goal attempts. He led the Los Angeles Lakers in scoring when they won the NBA title in 2009 and 2010.

But Bryant prioritized himself above his team offensively, and those gaudy stats are partly a reflection of that. It's why, if you look through my list of the NBA's 75 all-time greatest players, you won't find him in the top five or even the top 10.
label: sport

title: What went wrong for the 2021 Mets on the field and how can they fix it?
excerpt: We examine their lack of hitting for power, their defensive regression and more.
summary: 'The first thing that comes to mind,' Luis Rojas said on Sunday, one day before he was relieved of his duties as Mets manager, 'is the disappointment. We didn't get to where we wanted to.'New York's offseason to-do list is a piling tower that rivals the skyscrapers under construction around Central Park, though hopefully with more substance and fewer skipped steps. The Mets need to hire a head of baseball operations, who needs to hire a general manager, who needs to reconstruct the roster and help hire a manager, who needs to execute a cultural shift for a clubhouse core that has come up too short in recent years.
label: sport

title: Temple names Texas administrator Arthur Johnson next AD
excerpt: PHILADELPHIA (AP) — Temple named Arthur Johnson, a veteran administrator at Texas, as...
summary: PHILADELPHIA (AP) — Temple named Arthur Johnson, a veteran administrator at Texas, as the Owls' new athletic director.Retired Temple basketball coach Fran Dunphy held the job on an interim basis since Pat Kraft left in 2020 to become AD at Boston College. Johnson, in his role of senior associate athletic director for administration and operations at Texas since 2014, has been responsible for the internal management of the Longhorns' athletic department. "During a remarkable 25-year career, he's been instrumental in raising the competitive profiles of three storied athletic programs — the University of Texas, the University of Georgia and Arizona State University — and he's uniquely prepared to lead and elevate Temple to a similar championship status,' Temple President Jason Wingard said Wednesday in a statement.
label: sport

summary: PHILADELPHIA (AP) — Temple named Arthur Johnson, a veteran administrator at Texas, as the Owls' new athletic director.Retired Temple basketball coach Fran Dunphy held the job on an interim basis since Pat Kraft left in 2020 to become AD at Boston College. Johnson, in his role of senior associate athletic director for administration and operations at Texas since 2014, has been responsible for the internal management of the Longhorns' athletic department. "During a remarkable 25-year career, he's been instrumental in raising the competitive profiles of three storied athletic programs — the University of Texas, the University of Georgia and Arizona State University — and he's uniquely prepared to lead and elevate Temple to a similar championship status,' Temple President Jason Wingard said Wednesday in a statement.

title: 'What makes him special is his curiosity': At age 72, the Dusty Baker story is still being written
excerpt: Dusty Baker's legacy is set in gold regardless of what happens next, however, a WS win as a manager would be a nice cherry on top.
summary: 'Daffy?' Dusty Baker slips into an almost imperceptible Southern drawl, the sort that comes out when many a friend of Satchel Paige's lovingly imitate the beloved Negro Leagues legend.'Daffy!''Now you know my name is Dusty!' Baker recalls replying with mock indignation on more than one occasion. 'How could a man whose fishing rods I carried around never get my name right? Goodness!''‘I know what your name is … Daffy!'' Baker says, again quoting Paige, the long-ago whimsical retort that to this day still makes the veteran manager laugh.
label: sport

title: Ten quick thoughts about the Giants and Dodgers meeting in the postseason
excerpt: It didn't have to happen, but a Giants/Dodgers playoff series is happening and we should appreciate it, anxiety-inducing though it may be.
summary: 1. It had to be like this.2. You're also justified in punching anybody who tells you that it had to be like this.It most certainly did not have to be like this. The Cardinals could have won, and that would have been much less stressful. Anything other than this could have happened. Nolan Arenado and Paul Goldschmidt could have retired on Friday afternoon to open a restaurant that specializes in vegan soups because dreams are meant to be followed. The Pirates could have squeaked into the NLDS with an 81-81 record, and even if they advanced to the NLCS over the Giants , you would have been a little happy for them.

excerpt: After adding receiver Josh Gordon to the 53-man roster, the Chiefs seem set to play him in Sunday's game against the Bills. While head coach Andy Reid said earlier this week that he didn't want to put…
summary: If he plays in Week 5, it will be Gordon's first NFL game since 2019.MEXICO CITY/SAO PAULO (Reuters) -Automotive production in Brazil and Mexico, Latin America's two largest economies, plummeted in September, dragged down by an industry-wide semiconductor chip shortage and railroad blockades in Mexico, data showed on Wednesday. Brazilian auto production was down 21.3% to 173,287 units in September from the same month in 2020, when the industry was scrambling to resume production from a coronavirus-induced shutdown, Brazilian automakers association Anfavea said.

title: Clippers regulars take another step towards clarity in preseason
excerpt: As the Clippers inch closer to the start of the regular season, coach Tyronn Lue is seeing progress within his regular units.
summary: LOS ANGELES — Every team has different priorities going into preseason games.For the LA Clippers , the priorities entering Wednesday night against the Sacramento Kings were twofold: create good habits and get the regulars ready for the regular season.'Continue to play the right way,' Clippers coach Tyronn Lue said pregame when asked what the goal for the night was based on Monday's opener against the Nuggets . 'I thought our starters started the game offensively, did a pretty good job. But defensively, we gotta be better.

title: Sachin Gupta tries to steady Timberwolves after tumultuous start to training camp
excerpt: "I've already started to build a relationship with Sachin, and he's quite a talent," Timberwolves minority owner Marc Lore said.
summary: Sachin Gupta had a lot on his plate when he headed into Timberwolves headquarters on Sept. 23. He had just returned from an extended honeymoon overseas with his wife, a trip that had been delayed a year by the pandemic, and was preparing for an important face-to-face meeting with Wolves president of basketball operations Gersson Rosas after a summer of tension between the two of them.The two top members of the Wolves front office had not seen eye-to-eye for some time, and the meeting presented an opportunity to get on the same page less than a week before training camp started.

title: High school football RPI rankings: Who leads in race for playoffs in Week 7?
excerpt: See where local teams rank in this week's state RPI rankings.
summary: After a 2020 season where all eligible teams earned a spot in the state series, Florida's high school football playoffs have returned to the ratings percentage index (RPI) system that began in 2019. In Classes 8A-5A, district winners will earn one of the four top seeds, while the four non-district winners with the highest RPI in the region will receive at-large bids. In Classes 4A-1A, the top six teams in each region will earn playoff spots based purely on their RPI. The standings released by the FHSAA are based on RPI only, so they are certain to fluctuate throughout the remainder of the season.

title: Los Angeles Rams at Seattle Seahawks odds, picks and prediction
excerpt: Los Angeles Rams at Seattle Seahawks odds, picks and prediction
summary: The Los Angeles Rams (3-1) and Seattle Seahawks (2-2) kick off Week 5 with Thursday Night Football when they square off at Lumen Field in Seattle. This NFC West showdown is set for 8:20 p.m. ET. Below, we look at the Rams vs. Seahawks odds and lines, and make our best NFL picks, predictions and bets.The Rams were just blown out 37-20 by the Arizona Cardinals Sunday. The game wasn't even as close as the score indicates, either, as it was completely lopsided in favor of the Cardinals. The Rams are still sixth in scoring, however, and have QB Matthew Stafford playing at a high level in his first season with the team.

title: Cowboys vague on LB Jaylon Smith's release as players move forward
excerpt: The Dallas Cowboys are moving on from linebacker Jaylon Smith without getting into the specifics of the decision to release their leading returning tackler four games into 2021.
summary: FRISCO, Texas – Jaylon Smith's murky future with the Dallas Cowboys was most evident when he played just 16 snaps in the opener after averaging 95% of the plays over the previous three seasons.Now that the roster is looking more like it did in that 31-29 loss to defending Super Bowl champion Tampa Bay, the Cowboys are moving on from the linebacker who recovered from a severe knee injury in his final college game to become one of their most durable players.Coach Mike McCarthy wouldn't get into specifics for the factors in a release that became official Wednesday, but another one was the looming $9.

title: 'Little Wheels': In a miserable year, Daulton Varsho was a dynamic bright spot for the Diamondbacks
excerpt: He's progressed at catcher. He's spent equal time in the outfield, where he rates well by advanced metrics. Most exciting of all, he rakes.
summary: The nickname was first applied in Double A.It was 2019 and Daulton Varsho was in the midst of a breakout season. He'd finish the year with 18 home runs and an .899 OPS. He caught 76 games behind the plate but, by the end of the season, he was playing center field. Despite his short and stocky stature — his listed height of 5-foot-10 is generous by a couple of inches — he also stole 21 bases, tied for seventh most in the Southern League. He was the world's fastest fire hydrant.That's when he first heard it, a sobriquet whose origin can be traced to the wives of Varsho's Double-A teammates.

title: Chairman Watmore leaves ECB role
excerpt: Chairman Ian Watmore leaves the England and Wales Cricket Board only 13 months into a five-year term.
summary: Ian Watmore (left) presented Warwickshire captain Will Rhodes, CEO Stuart Cain and chairman Mark McCafferty with the County Championship trophy last monthChairman Ian Watmore has left the England and Wales Cricket Board.The 63-year-old, who took over from Colin Graves in September 2020, departs after serving only 13 months of a five-year term.The ECB said he had reached a "mutual agreement" to stand down at the end of the domestic season.Watmore said: "It is with regret that I step down as chair of the ECB, but I do so in mindfulness of my own wellbeing and that of the game which I love.

title: MMA Pound-for-Pound Rankings, October Update: Valentina Shevchenko vs. Amanda Nunes debate heats up

summary:
Welcome to the latest update to the MMA Fighting pound-for-pound rankings, where every month our esteemed panel of experts sort through the noise to answer one question: Who are the best overall male and female mixed martial arts fighters in the world?
With September in the rear-view mirror and an intriguing October slate ahead, it's time to look back at how the last rankings cycle affected the global pound-for-pound landscape in MMA.
(And don't forget to check out the latest edition of the MMA Fighting Rankings Show!) Let's refresh on some ground rules before we dive in.

title: Andorra v England: All-female team of officials to take charge of World Cup qualifier
excerpt: An all-female team of on-field officials is to take charge of Saturday's World Cup qualifier between Andorra and England.
summary:
Last updated on .From the section England

Kateryna Monzul took charge of the women's semi-final between the USA and Canada at the 2020 Tokyo Olympic Games

An all-female team of on-field officials will take charge of Saturday's World Cup qualifier between Andorra and England.

Ukraine's Kateryna Monzul will be the referee while compatriots Maryna Striletska and Svitlana Grushko have been named her assistants.

In addition, Stephanie Frappart of France is the video assistant referee.

It will be the first time a senior England men's international match has had all women officials.

title: Bill Russo, Lafayette's all-time winningest football coach, dies at 74
excerpt: Russo won 103 games with the Leopards.
summary: Bill Russo, the all-time winningest coach in Lafayette College football history, died suddenly from cardiac arrest last week at the age of 74.Russo won three league championships and amassed a record of 103-98-4 while leading the Leopards from 1981-99.After attending high school in Connecticut, Russo became an all-league linebacker at Brown University, where he was later inducted into the school's Athletic Hall of Fame. His first head coaching position was at Wagner College (1978-80).He experienced instant success at Lafayette and received the Eddie Robinson Award, given to the top coach in Division I-AA, in 1988 after helping the Leopards to a Colonial League title.

The Irish weren't at their best against Cincinnati, but still played quality football. Notre Dame's defense held the Bearcats 19 points below their season average but still lost by 11 points.

excerpt: TORONTO — With a strong core anchored by some of the game's top young players, Blue Jays general manager Ross Atkins is feeling bullish about the team's possibilities entering the off-season.A . . .
summary:
TORONTO — With a strong core anchored by some of the game's top young players, Blue Jays general manager Ross Atkins is feeling bullish about the team's possibilities entering the off-season.
A September surge nearly put Toronto in the post-season this year. Atkins is hopeful the club can build on that for the 2022 campaign. "Obviously we're not where we want to be yet," Atkins said. "We need to be playing deep into the playoffs to take that next step. But we do feel like the organization has continued to get better and improve.

 Seattle Seahawks quarterback Russell Wilson looks downfield against the San Francisco 49ers.

title: Kelly: Here's what Miami Dolphins have to do to beat the Tampa Bay Buccaneers
excerpt: Five things the Miami Dolphins need to do to pull off an upset against the defending Super Bowl champion Tampa Bay Buccaneers on the road in Week 5.
summary: Skip to content Five things the Miami Dolphins need to do to pull off an upset against the defending Super Bowl champion Tampa Bay Buccaneers on the road in Week 5: Harass Bucs QB Tom Brady with pressure up the middle There isn't a single scheme, front, blitz, or exotic look that a defense can throw at Brady to catch him off guard. He's seen everything every defensive coordinator could possibly come up with, and has answers for it he's accumulated over two decades as an NFL starter. But the one thing history shows that Brady can't beat is pressure in his face.
label: sport

title: Spain's new star Gavi, 17, lights up Nations League on debut as Italy's amazing record run ends
excerpt: Spain's Nations League win over Italy was momentous for many reasons, not least for the grand arrival of Gavi, 17, on to the international stage.
summary: playSpain ends Italy's historic run in Nations League semis (1:31)Ferran Torres scores twice as Spain ends Italy's 37-match unbeaten run to reach the Nations League final. (1:31)8:00 AM ETSpain went galloping into the UEFA Nations League final on Wednesday after beating Italy 2-1 in Milan on a night in which teenager Gavi announced his arrival on the international stage at the San Siro (stream the replay on ESPN+ in the U.S.).The result ended the Azzurri's 37-game unbeaten streak -- a world-record in men's internationals -- as Luis Enrique's spirited side emerged victorious over the reigning European champions.

title: Safe standing: Six Premier League and Championship clubs to take part in trial
excerpt: Six clubs from the Premier League and Championship have applied to take part in a safe standing trial which is due to start on January 1.The pilot scheme is...
summary: Six clubs from the Premier League and Championship have applied to take part in a safe standing trial which is due to start on January 1.The pilot scheme is scheduled to run until the end of the season and, if successful, will enable clubs to offer a licensed safe standing area.An SGSA spokesperson said: 'Applications to become early adopters of licensed standing in seated areas for the 2021-22 season are now closed.'The SGSA is now reviewing the applications and will provide advice and recommendations to the Department for Digital, Culture, Media and Sport (DCMS) for a final decision.
label: sport

title: Top English cricket official quits after a year in role
excerpt: The top official in English cricket quit on Thursday, saying the decision was taken for...
summary: The top official in English cricket quit on Thursday, saying the decision was taken for his wellbeing because the COVID-19 demands of the job have 'taken a personal toll on me.'Ian Watmore has stepped down as chairman of the England and Wales Cricket Board after serving barely a year in the role. It comes a day before England is to announce whether its players will travel to Australia for the Ashes series scheduled for December and January, and just weeks after the ECB withdrew its men's and women's teams from a tour of Pakistan in a decision that has created a schism in world cricket.

title: Top English cricket official quits after a turbulent year
excerpt: The top official in English cricket quit on Thursday, saying the decision was taken for his wellbeing because the COVID-19 demands of the job have 'taken a personal toll on me.'
summary: The top official in English cricket quit on Thursday, saying the decision was taken for his wellbeing because the demands of the job during the coronavirus pandemic have 'taken a personal toll on me.'Ian Watmore has stepped down as chairman of the England and Wales Cricket Board after serving barely a year in a role in which he was appointed to work two days per week.It proved to be a turbulent period for the ECB, though, mainly because of the effects of the pandemic, which has hit the sport's finances hard and led to major structural and logistical changes in the game.
label: sport

title: What does Brian Kelly's quarterback development track record really say about him? Notre Dame mailbag
excerpt: If there's a complaint about Notre Dame's QBs under Kelly, it's a question of recruiting evaluation, not a question of development.
summary: SOUTH BEND, Ind. — You've got questions. Enough for me to do four mailbags.It's like that after the first loss of the season, which was sobering but maybe shouldn't have been such a bartender-turns-off-the-music-and-turns-on-the-lights moment. You knew Notre Dame was an imperfect team. You just didn't think the imperfections would be so severe for so long. And so you're angry, my friends, like an old man trying to send back soup in a deli.You've come here for answers and I've got them, even if I don't have the answers for some of your biggest questions.
label: sport

title: Timo Werner Rubbishes Chelsea Departure Rumours Amid Bayern Munich & Atletico Madrid Interest
excerpt: Chelsea's Timo Werner has rubbished rumours regarding his Chelsea exit, speaking whilst on international duty.
summary: Chelsea's Timo Werner has rubbished rumours regarding his Chelsea exit, speaking whilst on international duty.The forward has been in fine form for the Blues recently, bagging against Southampton and Aston Villa in recent matches.Speaking to Express.de via Sport Witness, Werner denied the rumours surrounding his future.(Photo by PA Images/Sipa USA)Recent reports have stated that the forward was set to 'reassess' his Chelsea future, if he could not get into Thomas Tuchel's starting XI.Speaking on the rumours, Werner said: 'I don't know anything about the deadline.
label: sport

title: Why Is Taiwan Calm in the Face of Unprecedented Military Pressure from China
excerpt: Many Taiwanese see the Chinese military display as more of a show than a preparation for an all-out invasion.
summary:
China has been flying a record number of military aircrafts into Taiwan's 'air defence identification zone' in recent days, heightening regional concerns about the risk of military escalation or even an outright war.

Taiwanese people are largely alert, but not alarmed. So, why are the Taiwanese not losing their minds over what seems to be intensifying ' drums of war '?

It comes down to familiarity with China's pattern of military pressure tactics, as well as a general alarm fatigue from decades of exposure.
label: sport

title: ‘Jirafas,' ‘My Best Half,' ‘The Fury,' ‘The White Room' Sweep Prizes at Guadalajara's Co-Production Meetings
excerpt: Before a crowd of filmmakers and journalists, Mexico's Guadalajara Festival reached an industry crescendo on Tuesday with the presentation of prizes for its Co-Production Meetings which brought producers and directors face to face with potential partners as well as giving opportunities to filmmakers to pitch their projects to industry service companies sponsoring in-kind awards. It […]
summary:
Before a crowd of filmmakers and journalists, Mexico's Guadalajara Festival reached an industry crescendo on Tuesday with the presentation of prizes for its Co-Production Meetings which brought producers and directors face to face with potential partners as well as giving opportunities to filmmakers to pitch their projects to industry service companies sponsoring in-kind awards.

It was difficult to discern any strong trends among favored projects as prize winners ranged from documentaries to features, though fatherless or deteriorating families seemed to be at the core of many of the titles.
label: sport

title: Mary Beard ‘over the moon' at Cambridge classics teaching post
excerpt: The 66-year-old broadcaster and historian is a classics fellow at Newnham College.
summary:
Professor Dame Mary Beard has said she is 'over the moon' that a new fully funded classics teaching post has been established at her Cambridge University college, continuing her legacy.

The 66-year-old broadcaster and historian, who is a classics fellow at Newnham College, is to retire at the end of 2022 after almost 40 years of teaching at Cambridge.

The new post, known as the Onassis Classics Fellowship, secures a permanent position for the teaching of classical studies at the 150-year-old women's college.
label: sport

title: Rainy Manchester ponders fighting climate change with solar farm
excerpt: A ‘feasibility study' has concluded nowhere in the city is suitable.
summary:
Politicians are considering buying a solar farm in Manchester in the fight against climate change.

Councillors in the northern city, famed for its cloud and rain, say it will cost up to £30m but as a renewable source of energy will help to reduce carbon emissions.

However, local politicians were informed that a feasibility study had concluded nowhere in Manchester was suitable for a solar farm.

The study and an 'options appraisal' carried out by the public sector advice body Local Partnerships say a solar photovoltaic (PV) facility, also known as a solar or sun farm, would last up to 40 years and represent a good return on investment for Manchester City Council.
label: sport

title: Cloud, rain and fog threaten views of Draconid meteor shower
excerpt: The shower is expected to peak on the evening of Friday into Saturday.
summary:
Skygazers may have to wait for the clouds to part in order to catch a glimpse of the Draconid meteor shower as the Earth passes through a cloud of cometary dust.

The shower will take place from October 7 to 11, but is expected to peak on the evening of Friday into Saturday.

Named after the constellation of Draco the dragon, the Draconids occur every year and are one of the two meteor showers to light up the skies in October.

The shower comes from the debris of comet 21 P/ Giacobini-Zinner and occurs in the Northern Hemisphere.
label: sport

title: Kuwaiti plane lands in Turkey following bomb threat
excerpt: ANKARA, Turkey (AP) — A Kuwaiti passenger plane made an emergency landing at Trabzon airport in northern Turkey on Thursday following a bomb threat reported to the airline's headquarters, an official said. The Jazeera Airways flight from Kuwait, with 51 passengers and six crew members on board, landed safely in Trabzon and all passengers were evacuated, Trabzon Gov. Ismail Ustaoglu, told reporters. Security checks were conducted on the plane while the passengers' baggage were still being searche
summary:
ANKARA, Turkey (AP) — A Kuwaiti passenger plane made an emergency landing at Trabzon airport in northern Turkey on Thursday following a bomb threat reported to the airline's headquarters, an official said.

The Jazeera Airways flight from Kuwait, with 51 passengers and six crew members on board, landed safely in Trabzon and all passengers were evacuated, Trabzon Gov. Ismail Ustaoglu, told reporters. Security checks were conducted on the plane while the passengers' baggage were still being searched, he said.
label: sport

title: US-China challenge: Easing tensions despite differences
excerpt: BEIJING (AP) — In a relationship as fraught as America's and China's, just an agreement that talks were productive was a sign of progress. Nine months into Joe Biden's presidency, the two sides finally appear to be trying to ease tensions that date from the Trump administration — though U.S. complaints about Chinese policies on trade, Taiwan and other issues are little diminished. A closed-door meeting in Zurich on Wednesday between senior Chinese foreign policy adviser Yang Jiechi and White Hou
summary:
BEIJING (AP) — In a relationship as fraught as America's and China's, just an agreement that talks were productive was a sign of progress.

Nine months into Joe Biden's presidency, the two sides finally appear to be trying to ease tensions that date from the Trump administration — though U.S. complaints about Chinese policies on trade, Taiwan and other issues are little diminished.

A closed-door meeting in Zurich on Wednesday between senior Chinese foreign policy adviser Yang Jiechi and White House national security adviser Jake Sullivan was not accompanied by the public acrimony on display at earlier meetings.
label: sport

title: Haroldo Borges on Guadalajara Paradiso Work in Progress Winner ‘Saudade Fez Morada Aquí Dentro'
excerpt: As if adolescence is not hard enough, Haroldo Borges' new feature, 'Saudade fez morada aqui dentro' ('Saudade Became Home Inside') follows the heartbreaking experience of a young, father-less Brazilian teenager confronting a degenerative eye disease that will ultimately leave him blind. As his vision deteriorates, however, he also finds himself experiencing the confusion and pain […]
summary:
As if adolescence is not hard enough, Haroldo Borges' new feature, 'Saudade fez morada aqui dentro' ('Saudade Became Home Inside') follows the heartbreaking experience of a young, father-less Brazilian teenager confronting a degenerative eye disease that will ultimately leave him blind.

As his vision deteriorates, however, he also finds himself experiencing the confusion and pain of adolescence as his performance and behavior in school suffer and he learns first-hand the pain and confusion of an unrequited first love.

summary:

However, we found that the image dates back to 2018 and shows an incident where a man attempted suicide in Takhar province, Afghanistan in front of the governor's office.

Reports have identified the man as one Shah Mahmood, who said that he had to take the extreme step as the authorities were ignoring his complaint of someone "usurping his land."

summary:
(Evening Standard)

Celebs love a side hustle. The latest buzz across the pond? Weed empires, and now even Biebz is at it.

Forget the stoner cliché, for some of the A-listers building marijuana businesses it's a form of political expression against prohibition. Smoking weed recreationally has been legal in Canada since 2018, but is only legal in some states in the US.

Possession, selling and growing cannabis is still illegal in the UK, though London Mayor Sadiq Khan said this year that if he were re-elected he would look into setting up a commission that could decriminalise marijuana.

summary:
Terming "unfortunate" the killing of eight people including four farmers in the 3 October Lakhimpur Kheri incident, the Supreme Court Thursday sought a status report by tomorrow (Friday, 8 October) from the Uttar Pradesh government on the accused named by the police in FIR and whether they have been arrested.

The apex court has also sought details of the Special Investigation Team (SIT) and the judicial inquiry commission, reportedly set up by the state government.

The incident, which triggered a major political storm with the Opposition accusing the BJP government in UP of shielding the guilty, was heard by a bench headed by Chief Justice NV Ramana as a suo motu (on its own) case.

summary:
Kateryna Monzul will referee England's World Cup qualifier in Andorra (Mike Egerton/PA) (PA Archive)

An England match will be refereed by a woman for the first time when Kateryna Monzul takes charge of Saturday's World Cup qualifier in Andorra.

Monzul will officiate the match at the Estadi Nacional, with Uefa's official website confirming her fellow Ukrainians Maryna Striletska and Svitlana Grushko as assistant referees.

France's Stephanie Frappart will be the VAR, with the fourth official and assistant VAR roles filled by men – Denys Shurman and Vikor Matyash respectively.

title: Long COVID finally given formal definition by the World Health Organization
excerpt: Long COVID has remained one of the more mysterious aspects of the coronavirus pandemic.
summary:
The World Health Organization has given long COVID an official definition. (Getty)

Following months of uncertainty surrounding the symptoms of "long COVID", the World Health Organization (WHO) has now given it a formal definition 18 months into the pandemic.

The condition has remained one of the more mysterious aspects of coronavirus, but the WHO has sought to come up with a clinical analysis of the long-term symptoms more formally called the 'post-COVID condition'.

Their official definition of long COVID is: 'Post COVID-19 condition occurs in individuals with a history of probable or confirmed SARS-CoV-2 infection, usually 3 months from the onset of COVID-19 with symptoms that last for at least 2 months and cannot be explained by an alternative diagnosis.

title: Nick Saban 'very saddened' by death of former 'Chopped Jr.' winner Fuller Goldsmith
excerpt: Alabama coach Nick Saban took time to talk about Fuller Goldsmith, a Tuscaloosa chef and former winner of "Chopped Jr." who died Tuesday at 17.
summary:
During his weekly Wednesday night press conference, Alabama football coach Nick Saban made sure to talk about the legacy of Fuller Goldsmith, a Tuscaloosa chef and former winner of "Chopped Jr." who died Tuesday at 17.

"Fuller Goldsmith was a young man that was really close to a lot of the players here," Saban said. "Meant a lot to Terry and I."

Goldsmith had been fighting acute lymphoblastic leukemia.

"The spirit that he showed," Saban said, "the positive energy and attitude and being a great chef, contributing to the nutrition program here, coming to practice, coming to games, I would just like for (his father) Scott and his family to know our thoughts and prayers are with you and we're very saddened by his passing this week.

The European Commission vice-president said he hopes to brief the UK Government on the 'very far-reaching' proposals within the next fortnight, before intensive discussions throughout the rest October and November.

The proposals will focus on animal checks (SPS), customs, medicine supplies and providing a voice for Northern Irish representatives in the EU.

title: Revolution Bars says sales ‘well ahead' of expectations after reopening
excerpt: The group said sales have risen by 17% for the 11-week period to October 2 against the same period in 2019.
summary:
Revolution Bars has reported sales 'well ahead' of its expectations since restrictions were fully relaxed in July and the hospitality firm was able to reopen all of its venues.

The group, which also runs the Revolucion de Cuba brand, said sales have risen by 17% for the 11-week period to October 2 against the same period in 2019, before the pandemic.

It hailed the recovery as a 'strong' performance and reported 'good profit generation' over the period as it continued to control costs.

Revolution operates 67 bars across the UK after it shut six sites, with the loss of around 130 jobs, as part of a restructuring following the heavy impact of the pandemic last year.

New Delhi [India], October 7 (ANI): The Supreme Court on Thursday declined to entertain a plea filed by Subramanian Swamy seeking direction to frame guidelines to deal with the ever-increasing Non-Performing Assets (NPAs) in the banking sector.

A Bench of Justice DY Chandrachud, Justice Vikram Nath and Justice BV Nagarathna disposed of the plea of Swamy saying this was a policy matter falling in the domain of the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) and the government.

The Apex court allowed Swamy to make a representation to RBI which can take a considered stand on concerns.

title: Nobel Literature Prize 2021: Abdulrazak Gurnah named winner
excerpt: The Swedish Academy praised him for his writings on the effects of colonialism.
summary:
Abdulrazak Gurnah

Tanzanian novelist Abdulrazak Gurnah has been awarded the 2021 Nobel Prize for Literature.

Announcing him as the winner on Thursday, the Academy praised Gurnah for for his "uncompromising and compassionate penetration of the effects of colonialism".

The prize is awarded by the Swedish Academy and is worth 10 million Swedish crowns ($1.14m / £840,000).

Gurnah, 73, is the author of 10 novels, including Paradise and Desertion.

Paradise, published in 1994, told the story of a boy growing up in Tanzania in the early 20th Century and won the Booker Prize, marking his breakthrough as a novelist.

title: What we learned, 2021 Reds edition: A disappointing season still had its promising moments

summary: The Reds finished with a winning record over a full season for just the fourth time since 2001, but without a playoff berth that seemed inevitable at one point, the discouraging end of the season left the whole thing feeling like a dud.The Reds were 12 games over .500 on Aug. 27 and finished just four games above .500, going 12-17 in September and October while watching the hated St. Louis Cardinals win 17 in a row en route to a second wild-card spot that seemed like Cincinnati's destiny.It was a bitter ending to a season that held so much promise, but that doesn't mean it was a total waste.

summary:
By Dan Ambrose: Trainer Malik Scott believes IBF super middleweight champion Caleb Plant has a chance of beating Canelo Alvarez on November 6th in their undisputed 168-lb championship in Las Vegas. Scott is impressed with the boxing ability of Plant (21-0, 12 KOs), who is like another Floyd Mayweather  Jr., and he's got the perfect style to take Canelo to school the same way Floyd did.
What does concern Malik about Plant is whether his stamina will hold out into the championship rounds against Canelo, as he ran out of gas late against Caleb Truax and Jose Uzcategui.

Our first impressions: Sam Howell , North Carolina6-1, 225The North Carolina junior was Dane Brugler's top available QB when the season began, a player similar to Cleveland Browns starter Baker Mayfield Something to remember about a player like Howell, who plays in an RPO-heavy scheme, is how much he's being asked to read during a play that goes beyond the standard stuff you see from a normal drop-back in a traditional NFL offense.

summary:
LOS ANGELES (AP) — One big swing by Chris Taylor sent the Los Angeles Dodgers soaring and the St. Louis Cardinals crashing.
Taylor hit a two-run homer in the bottom of the ninth inning to give the Dodgers a 3-1 victory Wednesday night in a scintillating NL wild-card game.
Justin Turner homered early and the 106-win Dodgers advanced to a best-of-five Division Series against the NL West champion Giants, who won 107 games to barely hold off rival Los Angeles for the division title. Game 1 is Friday night in San Francisco.

summary:
James Develin had just finished running, and now he was kicking back, talking running. That's the focus these days. The former New England Patriots fullback is borrowing from his years of being in the employ of Hall of Fame-bound coach Bill Belichick — all that 'doing your job,' 'no days off,' and so on — and is using these lessons to train for the long-awaited 125h Boston Marathon, which will set off from Hopkinton, Mass. on Monday.



Or as Develin likes to call it, 'the Super Bowl of marathons.

excerpt: A suburban Buffalo school district is six years removed from abolishing its controversial nickname, but the change remains complicated.
summary:
The Cleveland Indians played their final game Sunday, but Native American symbols will be found in baseball as long as the Atlanta Braves remain alive in the postseason. The Tomahawk Chop will whack, whack, whack away in Truist Park.



The same gesture will be seen Sunday night, the eve of Columbus Day, when the Buffalo Bills visit the Kansas City Chiefs at Arrowhead Stadium. Last week, Buffalo welcomed Washington for the first time as the Football Team.



While sports leagues deliberate various ways they use Native American terms and imagery, a suburban Buffalo school district is six years removed from abolishing its controversial nickname.

title: Brett Favre ball thief recounts infamous incident ahead of Packers facing Bengals at PBS
excerpt: Greg Gall's snatch from the Hall of Fame QB garnered plenty of attention and possibly swung momentum in Cincinnati's favor that day.
summary: Yes, he had been drinking. No, he wasn't drunk. At least as far as he was concerned.But by his own count, there were seven or eight beers coursing through Greg Gall's veins and brain Oct. 30, 2005, when he created one of the most iconic — or idiotic, as he's been told many times — moments in Paul Brown Stadium history by running on the field and stealing the football from Packers quarterback Brett Favre in the final minute of the game.After sprinting onto the field in the middle of a play and taking the ball from a dumbfounded Favre, Gall took off for the south end zone with numerous security personnel giving chase and the crowd roaring.

Matt Ryan refers to 'really ordinary plays.'All three are talking about the Falcons offense, why they are optimistic even though that offense ranks 25th in the NFL in scoring and what goes into the process of improving it.'It sounds so boring, but sometimes the mundane over and over and over again, it pays off,' said Smith, the Falcons' first-year head coach. 'A lot of those things we are asking guys to do, some of the route craft, timing, something as little as our action fakes, we feel like we're making progress week over week.

title: Ping-Pong, rollerblades and trick passes: The essence of Patrick Mahomes in 15 stories
excerpt: For the Chiefs quarterback, there is a pure joy in doing something that has never been done.
summary: 1. One day last summer, Patrick Mahomes was standing in the middle of a fairway on a golf course in Cabo San Lucas, surveying his next shot. He had 260 yards to the pin. There was trouble in front. The safe play, Mahomes surmised, was to play short and attempt to reach the par 5 in 3.So Mahomes pulled a 3-wood from the bag, swung as hard as he could and watched the ball take off. It landed on the green. Mahomes sunk his putt for eagle, and as he headed for the next hole, it reinforced a creed he and tight end Travis Kelce adopted on their trips together over the years:'Man, we didn't come here to lay up.

summary:
Dodger Stadium was shaking with the vibrations from thousands of stomping feet and the roars of 50,000 fans, and Chris Taylor was at the center of it all, a small but animated speck in a sea of hopping, jumping, screaming humanity.

His two-out, two-run home run in the bottom of the ninth had shattered the tension of the Dodgers' wild-card game against the St. Louis Cardinals and secured their spot in the National League Division Series against the San Francisco Giants. As he rounded the bases and was mobbed by his teammates, he soaked up every decibel of the cheers and every swirl of the rally towels that fans had waved to create a blue blizzard after he delivered the decisive stroke in the Dodgers' 3-1 victory Wednesday.
label: sport

title: Disappointing run defense, K.J. Osborn's emergence: Biggest Vikings surprises so far
excerpt: There have been a lot of surprises (both good and bad) for the 1-3 Vikings, including the run defense and Everson Griffen.
summary: A 1-3 start for the Vikings has revealed plenty of surprises to a season that is supposed to culminate with a playoff berth. So as a relatively boring week leading to a home game against the Lions continues, we figured we'd re-set and take a look at the biggest surprises (both good and bad) of this Vikings season so far.The run defenseThe Vikings built this defense to stop the run, first and foremost. They boast one of the biggest duos in the NFL at defensive tackle in Michael Pierce and Dalvin Tomlinson .

title: 'No longer in tear-down mode,' Rangers' offseason plans sound promising
excerpt: "We're gonna have to pay market dollars to get top players and we're prepared to do so," president of baseball operations Jon Daniels said.
summary: Under the best of circumstances, the media room would have been used for hundreds of press conferences by now. That was how everyone assumed it would be, back when plans were announced to open Globe Life Field for the 2020 season. Alas, the universe has a way of wiping out plans — occasionally even the plans of billion-dollar entities. And so it was that three days after the final game of the stadium's second season, the first in-person press conference in the media room finally came to pass. General manager Chris Young , president of baseball operations Jon Daniels and manager Chris Woodward sat high at the new podium and answered questions about their offseason plans.

title: Dear Andy: Alabama, Georgia are trendy but will Big Ten crash Playoff party? Plus Michigan-Nebraska buzz, portal debate
excerpt: A four-team "Big Ten-SEC challenge" is a nightmare scenario for other leagues and would hasten CFP expansion.
summary:
This is a huge weekend in the Big Ten, and you have some great questions …



Dear Andy,



Everybody seems to think that if Georgia and Alabama go unbeaten through the regular season, both will get into the College Football Playoff. However, what if Iowa and Michigan get through the regular season unscathed? Would both of them get into the playoff this year with the Big Ten seeming to have a stronger conference with five teams in the top 10? Also, will the UGA and Alabama possibly be dinged for a weaker non-conference schedule with both Clemson and Miami struggling? — Doug in Pittsburgh



If the two Big Ten title game participants enter undefeated, there would be a very good chance they both make the Playoff.

title: Some early Kentucky Derby contenders will be running at Keeneland this weekend
excerpt: Early odds are already out for the 2022 Derby, and the list includes several 2-year-olds who will be at Keeneland on Saturday.
summary:
Racing returns to Keeneland this weekend for the start of the 2021 Fall Meet, and the schedule includes one race in particular that always catches the eye of those looking ahead to the Kentucky Derby.

The Grade 1 Claiborne Breeders' Futurity is set for Saturday's loaded race card, and the 1 1/16-mile race for 2-year-olds is likely to produce some top early contenders for the 2022 Derby.

The $500,000 race was first run in 1910 and has featured eight future Kentucky Derby winners over the years. Swale — the 1984 Derby champ — was the last horse to win both races, but the most recent runnings of the Futurity have established some of the sport's biggest contemporary stars.
label: sport

title: UEFA sets date for Euro 2024 qualifying draw in Frankfurt
excerpt: NYON, Switzerland (AP) — The 2024 European Championship qualifying groups will be drawn in Frankfurt in one year, UEFA said Thursday.
summary: NYON, Switzerland (AP) — The 2024 European Championship qualifying groups will be drawn in Frankfurt in one year, UEFA said Thursday.The qualifying format was not announced, though the 54 teams involved will likely be drawn into 10 qualifying groups, each with five or six teams playing from March to November in 2023. That would let the top two in each group advance directly to the 24-team finals tournament joining host Germany.The Euro 2024 lineup will likely be completed in March 2024 by three playoff brackets involving teams based on their standings in the Nations League groups played next year.

title: Max Scherzer Predicted Almost Exactly How Dodgers Would Win Wild-Card Game
excerpt: Chris Taylor's home run defeated the Cardinals in a one-game elimination — and that wasn't the only detail the Los Angeles starting pitcher foretold.
summary:
Chris Taylor's walk-off two-run home run to propel the Los Angeles Dodgers to a 3-1 wild-card playoff victory over the St. Louis Cardinals on Wednesday was foretold by LA's starting pitcher, Max Scherzer.

Scherzer didn't have his usual command in allowing 1 run over 4 1/3 innings, but he did seem to have a crystal ball.

ESPN reported that with the teams tied at 1-1 in the bottom of the ninth inning and one out, Scherzer was sitting next to relief pitcher Joe Kelly and made a prediction: Cody Bellinger would walk and Taylor would homer to send the Dodgers to the National League Division Series against the San Francisco Giants.
label: sport

title: Super DIRT 200 to return to Oswego for 50th anniversary in 2022

summary: Super DIRT Week will celebrate its 50th anniversary in October of 2022, and the party is going to be at the Oswego Speedway.Oswego mayor William Barlow made the announcement at a city hall press conference Wednesday while welcoming DIRT officials, racers and fans from throughout the United States.'I'm so pleased that DIRTcar Racing will be bringing back the 50th annual Super DIRT Week to Oswego Speedway,' said the mayor. 'The economic impact for SDW in Oswego is over 10 million dollars and upwards of 40,000 visitors to our city.

title: Alabama's running game without Jase McClellan: Will Brian Robinson's high share of carries be repeated?
excerpt: Alabama's running back depth has taken a big hit. Roydell Williams is now the next man up behind Robinson, who had 36 caries vs. Ole Miss.
summary: Is Alabama heading toward another 2015-esque season for its running back rotation?Not in terms of yardage, as nobody is going to approach Derrick Henry's 2,219 rushing yards or 28 rushing touchdowns. But after a season-ending knee injury for Jase McClellan in the Ole Miss game and with highly regarded freshman Camar Wheaton not healthy or close to contributing right now, the Crimson Tide's enviable depth at running back is down to three scholarship players.What that meant against Ole Miss was 36 carries for 171 yards and four touchdowns by starter Brian Robinson .
label: sport

title: FIFA: EA Sports to consider renaming football gaming series as it reviews rights agreement
excerpt: Since launching the FIFA franchise in 1993, the game has grown into one of the most popular sports games in the world.
summary:
Electronic Arts, the video game company which makes the FIFA series, is considering renaming its flagship football game.The company said it is reviewing its licensing agreement with FIFA, the international governing body for football.
In a statement released on EA's website, the company said it could cut ties with FIFA and rename its series, but it would retain all of its other league, player and stadium rights because these are separate from the agreement with FIFA. Image: The FIFA series is one of the most popular video game franchises in the world 

"Through years of building our global franchise, we also know that authenticity is essential to the experience," EA said.
label: sport

title: Cowboys News: La'el Collins sues NFL, Elliott misses practice, Jaylon to Green Bay
excerpt: Players were shocked by Jaylon Smith's release, even as life moved on, and Ezekiel Elliott missed Wednesday's practice with a sore knee. | From @ToddBrock24f7
summary: As expected, the release of Cowboys linebacker Jaylon Smith dominated headlines Wednesday. While the team's official stance was predictably vague, several of Smith's teammates had very pointed opinions. One of his fellow linebackers has lashed out at fans who he feels take for granted their right to criticize players personally. Smith, meanwhile, seems to have found a new home already… although whether or not he makes them better is up for debate. What certain is there's a new culture suddenly dawning in Dallas.

title: Lille and Marseille away fans banned from traveling in 2021
excerpt: PARIS (AP) — The French league has banned fans from Lille and Marseille from traveling...
summary: PARIS (AP) — The French league has banned fans from Lille and Marseille from traveling to away games for the rest of the year following violence in recent games.The LFP's disciplinary committee issued its verdicts at midnight on Wednesday, giving each club a suspended deduction of one point. Lens was also given a suspended one-point deduction and ordered to play two home games without fans. Angers had one section of its stadium closed for two games. Both clubs had already served those punishments, but Angers was also ordered to pay a fine of 20,000 euros ($23,000).

Lens was also given a suspended one-point deduction and ordered to play two home games without fans. Angers had one section of its stadium closed for two games. Both clubs had already served those punishments, but Angers was also ordered to pay a fine of 20,000 euros ($23,000).

excerpt: England's senior men's side will be refereed by a female referee for the first time when they face Andorra at the weekend.Ukrainian referee...
summary: England's senior men's side will be refereed by a female referee for the first time when they face Andorra at the weekend.Ukrainian referee Kateryna Monzul will take charge of the game on Saturday. Monzul, 40, has been refereeing at international level in the women's game since September 2005. She has since overseen games at the 2007, 2011, 2015 and 2019 World Cups and the 2009, 2013, 2015 and 2017 editions of the European Championship.Monzul has also been refereeing in the men's Ukrainian Premier League since 2016 and was voted the best arbiter in that division in 2019-20.

summary: MADISON, Wis. — For the past two Saturdays, Wisconsin safety Collin Wilder has shared a similar message with his teammates after games. It's not one he wanted to impart and certainly not something he thought would be required given the talent on the team. But after back-to-back losses to Notre Dame and Michigan, in which the Badgers were outscored 49-10 in the fourth quarters, he has found himself repeating this mantra: We can't get numb to this.The idea, Wilder said following Michigan's 38-17 victory at Camp Randall Stadium on Saturday, is that the Badgers must hold onto what it feels like to lose.

title: Nigerian sprinter Okagbare facing 3 charges in doping case
excerpt: Nigerian sprinter Blessing Okagbare is facing three charges in a doping case which surfaced in dramatic circumstances when she was barred from running in the Olympic 100-meter semifinals hours before…
summary: FILE - In this July 30, 2021 file photo, Blessing Okagbare, of Nigeria, center, wins a heat in the women's 100-meter run at the 2020 Summer Olympics, in Tokyo. Nigerian sprinter Okagbare is facing three charges in a doping case which surfaced in dramatic circumstances when she was barred from running in the Olympic 100-meter semifinals hours before the race. The Athletics Integrity Unit revealed on Thursday, Oct. 7, 2021, that Okagbare tested positive for blood booster EPO in Nigeria in June, in addition to another failed test for human growth hormone in Slovakia in July, which was announced during the Olympics.

title: 36 months later, 31 strokes better: How this Jacksonville Routt golfer became a champion
excerpt: In 36 months, Jacksonville Routt's Addie Dobson improved her sectional golf game by 31 strokes and 49 places.
summary: AUBURN — Addie Dobson remembers her first sectional golf appearance. It didn't go so well.  The Jacksonville Routt senior blew up on the opening hole at Edgewood Golf Course and ruefully drudged up a 103 to end her freshman year.  'Some trauma here,' Dobson said. Where else would her last sectional be, but in the same place? And just like last time, Dobson had to start on that menacing par-4 No. 10. A DIFFERENT PLAYER But Dobson expunged the past with intestinal fortitude. She recovered from two consecutive bogeys with three birdies and scored 1-over-par 72 to win the Class 1A Auburn Sectional title.

title: Iowa's 1921 win over Knute Rockne and Notre Dame: Duke Slater cements his legacy in a championship-catapulting victory – The Athletic
excerpt: The Hawkeyes handed the Irish their only loss in a three-year span on Oct. 8, 1921, and the game still resonates 100 years later.
summary:
IOWA CITY, Iowa — Outside the north end zone of 92-year-old Kinnick Stadium resides a bronze relief from the most important play in early Iowa football annals.



Protruding from the wall is Iowa's helmetless warrior, Duke Slater, leading fullback Gordon Locke into the end zone against Notre Dame. It marks the Hawkeyes' only touchdown in the biggest game of the year, perhaps even the era. It garnered Iowa a share of a disputed national championship and the first of two consecutive unbeaten seasons.

summary:
Evan Brown walked into the makeshift interview room in a garage in back of the Detroit Lions practice facility Wednesday and marveled at the setup: Light stands illuminating a lectern cordoned off by retractable ropes, with a gaggle of reporters waiting for him to step up to the microphone.

'Look at this,' he said.

For Brown, everything is new this week, from the media spotlight he enjoyed Wednesday to his assignment on the field: Starting center for the Lions.

FILM REVIEW: Putting the Lions' short-yardage mistakes under the microscope

summary: Michigan visits Nebraska on Saturday night in a matchup that's not about history or the head coaches as much as opportunity.This trip to Memorial Stadium for the ninth-ranked Wolverines (5-0, 2-0 Big Ten) rates as the most significant hurdle left before a Halloween weekend stopover in East Lansing that could carry College Football Playoff implications — two days ahead of the first rankings release.For Nebraska, it's an opportunity to earn a landmark victory. The Huskers (3-3, 1-2) have defeated a top-10 opponent just once in the past decade and must find a way to reach six wins after missing bowl games in five of the past six seasons.

summary: While running back TreVeyon Henderson gets most of the attention following his 277-yard and three-touchdown outburst against Tulsa on Sept. 18, he's not the only true freshman that has made an impact for Ohio State this fall.In fact, cornerback Denzel Burke has started all five games for the Buckeyes, becoming the first true freshman to start a season-opener on defense since former linebacker Andy Katzenmoyer in 1996.Defensive tackle Tyleik Williams, meanwhile, has recorded four sacks on the year, including one that went for a 17-yard loss and ended any chances of the Golden Hurricane pulling an upset that afternoon.

title: What Our New NHL Forecast Says About This Season
excerpt: For years, readers have asked us to add NHL predictions to the host of forecasts we run here at FiveThirtyEight. And clearly, hockey's absence wasn't out of any…
summary: For years, readers have asked us to add NHL predictions to the host of forecasts we run here at FiveThirtyEight. And clearly, hockey's absence wasn't out of any aversion to the sport on our part — editor-in-chief Nate Silver, myself and many other writers here have been pretty obsessed with it, in fact. So after soft-launching a beta version of hockey Elo ratings last year, we are proud to finally roll out a full-fledged NHL forecast interactive for the upcoming 2021-22 campaign. In the spirit of our earliest Elo explainer — for the NFL, published in September 2014 — here's a list of Frequently Asked Questions you might have about the new forecast and what it sees in the season ahead: How does it work? The new NHL forecast model uses Elo rati — Really, Elo ratings? Again? Yes.

title: Notre Dame Has A Recent Track Record Of Bouncing Back Well After Regular Season Defeats
excerpt: Notre Dame has a recent track record of bouncing back strong from regular season wins in the last five seasons
summary: Notre Dame hasn't lost much during the last five seasons, a stretch in which the Irish have gone 47-9 in just under four and a half seasons. This past weekend Cincinnati gave Notre Dame its first loss of the season, and the Irish follow that up with a road trip to Lane Stadium to take on the Virginia Tech Hokies.Notre Dame is in a must-win situation this weekend as it hopes to avoid the first two-game regular season losing streak since 2016. That means Notre Dame has done well from 2017-20 to bounce back from its rare defeats, and head coach Brian Kelly will look to keep that rolling.

title: How Our NHL Predictions Work
excerpt: References Hockey-Reference.com / Elo ratings / Autocorrelation / Monte Carlo simulations / Logistic regression / Poisson distribution The Details In 2021, we a…
summary:
In 2021, we added hockey to the list of sports that FiveThirtyEight forecasts using the Elo rating system. To create Elo for the NHL, we used results from every game in league history dating back to the 1917-18 season (thanks to data from Hockey-Reference.com). The system assigns every team a power rating and uses that to predict who will win each game as well as who will hoist the Stanley Cup at the end of the season. Here's how it works.
Game predictions
In the Elo system, each team gets a numerical rating that acts as its de facto power rating at any given point in time, with the league average sitting around 1500.

title: Andy Murray's tennis shoes stolen with his wedding ring tied to them
excerpt: In a video on social media, the former world No1 has appealed for the return of his ring
summary:
Andy Murray has revealed his wedding ring has been stolen after a mishap with his tennis shoes.

The three-time major winner is preparing for action at the Indian Wells tournament, and has now ended up issuing an appeal for the return of his wedding ring.

The British star explained he left his tennis shoes outside underneath his car to dry out overnight – but they were nowhere to be seen when he returned in the morning.

And it was only when his physio asked about his wedding band that he realised he had left the ring tied to his shoes.

excerpt: The former world number one issued an appeal for help on Instagram after his tennis shoes were stolen from underneath his car with his wedding band attached to the shoelaces.
summary:
Andy Murray has said he is in the "bad books" with wife Kim after his tennis shoes were stolen - with his wedding ring attached to them.The British tennis star is preparing to play at Indian Wells in California for the first time since 2017, where he was granted a wildcard to compete.
But he has ended up issuing a video appeal to his followers from his hotel room following the "terrible idea" to leave his damp and sweaty tennis shoes under his car to dry overnight, forgetting his wedding ring was attached to the shoelaces.

title: 'My mindset was to stick this thing out.' Patience pays off for Teradja Mitchell
excerpt: Linebacker Teradja Mitchell arrived at Ohio State in 2018 as a top-50 recruit. He waited three seasons before a chance to start. Here's why.
summary: Teradja Mitchell might have been destined to become a Big Ten linebacker.He was a big kid growing up in the Hampton Roads region of southeastern Virginia, heavy enough to join Pop Warner league teams with boys who were several years older.Despite the age gap, Mitchell got along. He relished contact and had a nose for the ball. With affection, his father nicknamed him 'my hitter.''He could hold his own with the bigger guys,' Terry Mitchell said of his son.But his arrival at Ohio State in 2018 lacked the same sudden impact.

In fact, after the 1-3 Jets play the 1-3 Falcons in London on Sunday, and the 1-3 Dolphins play the 0-4 Jaguars next week, the NFL will have played 30 games in London, and there still hasn't been a single game between two teams with winning records.

title: Brett Phillips, ‘basically a 12-year-old,' brings his joy back to baseball's playoffs
excerpt: He had one of the most memorable moments of last year's World Series, and he hasn't stopped laughing since.
summary: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla. — The laugh typically begins as a normal one — a throaty, hearty 'ha ha ha' — but suddenly, as if seized by gravity, it descends into Brett Phillips's chest, and that's where it gets trapped. Unable to breathe, Phillips doubles over, his face frozen into an open-mouthed expression that seems closer to distress than hilarity. Finally, after an interminable, silent pause that occasionally prompts a concerned stranger to rush over to perform the Heimlich maneuver, he inhales with a loud, gasping honk.

Robert went on to become a teacher and later the principal of Staunton River High School for nearly a decade. He raised his children in Bedford. His daughter has become an attorney and his son, a former Green Beret, now teaches at Staunton River High School.

summary:
Home football games for John Curtis Christian were not always well attended like they are today. Not when the Patriots played an entire season and failed to win a game.

Then, in the second season with J.T. Curtis as the head coach at the school, his team lost the opening game to the 1970 season. The next week, his team did something for the first time that it has done hundreds of times since then.

It won.

'When the game was over, we thought coach was going to chew us out because it was a sloppy win,' said Harry Hawks, a former television executive for Hearst Corporation who played on the offensive and defensive lines back then.

Smith is England's record goalscorer, having netted 46 times in 117 appearances for the national side. She has played in five major championships, as well as representing Great Britain in the 2012 Olympics, retiring in 2015.Having started her career in earnest after moving to New Jersey in the United States, she later returned to North London to spend three different spells at Arsenal, interspersing that with a period at the Boston Breakers in the NWSL.

MONTREAL — Two Victoriaville Tigres players have been indefinitely suspended by the Quebec Major Junior Hockey League after police formally charged the pair with sexual assault earlier this week.
Nicolas Daigle and Massimo Siciliano, both 19, appeared in court in Quebec City on Tuesday morning. They have both been charged with sexual assault and filming what happened and Daigle also faces two charges of sharing the images.
The sexual assault charges stem from an alleged incident that occurred after the team won the QMJHL title on June 6.

summary:
Newcastle takeover: What are your thoughts on the Saudi-Arabian backed deal?

Newcastle United's takeover saga, which has lasted 18 months or so, finally appears to be nearing its conclusion.

As The Athletic revealed yesterday, the Saudi Arabia-financed consortium's bid for Newcastle is expected to go through soon following the reversal of a ban on beIN Sport in the Gulf nation — an issue which had led to legal disputes with the Premier League.

The announcement on Wednesday that beIN Sport, the Premier League's official Middle East broadcaster, will no longer be barred from operating in the kingdom means the takeover is now close to completion.
