title: McCaffrey returns to practice, status for Sunday unclear
excerpt: Panthers running back Christian McCaffrey returned to practice on a limited basis after missing Carolina's 36-28 loss to the Dallas Cowboys with a hamstring injury.
summary:
Carolina Panthers running back Christian McCaffrey is tackled by New Orleans Saints outside linebacker Demario Davis during the second half of an NFL football game Sunday, Sept. 19, 2021, in Charlotte, N.C. (AP Photo/Jacob Kupferman) AP

Panthers running back Christian McCaffrey returned to practice on a limited basis Wednesday after missing Carolina's 36-28 loss to the Dallas Cowboys with a hamstring injury.

Coach Matt Rhule said McCaffrey had a 'good practice,' but added that it's too early in the week to know if McCaffrey would be fully recovered in time to play Sunday against the Philadelphia Eagles.
label: sport

title: Retired NFL star Jordy Nelson loves simple life near K-State
excerpt: No. 15 Coastal Carolina goes for its 11th straight Sun Belt Conference victory when it travels to Arkansas State this week.
summary:
Jordy Nelson is inducted into the Kansas State athletics Hall of Fame at Bill Snyder Family Stadium. K-State Athletics.

No. 15 Coastal Carolina must lean on what's gone right to handle a quick turnaround.

This season, that has been just about everything.

The Chanticleers (5-0, 1-0 Sun Belt) play at Arkansas State (1-4, 0-1) on Thursday night.

The Chants lead the league in most points scored and fewest allowed. Their pass defense is the only team in the FBS that hasn't allowed a touchdown catch while quarterback Grayson McCall is tops in the subdivision in completion percentage at 80.

title: Stafford, Rams face NFC West showdown traveling to Seahawks
excerpt: Even before making the move to the NFC West, Matthew Stafford could get a sense for the intensity of when Seattle and Los Angeles get together.
summary:
Los Angeles Rams defensive end Aaron Donald reacts after a defensive stop during the first half in an NFL football game against the Arizona Cardinals Sunday, Oct. 3, 2021, in Inglewood, Calif. (AP Photo/Ashley Landis) AP

Even before making the move to the NFC West, Matthew Stafford could get a sense for the intensity of when Seattle and Los Angeles get together.

His first taste of the Rams-Seahawks rivalry will come in a place he's never won before.

'I could feel it from afar when I wasn't here,' Stafford said.

title: Lakers: Trevor Ariza out eight weeks with ankle injury
excerpt: The Lakers probably need Anthony Davis at center to achieve their goals.
summary:
The Lakers probably need Anthony Davis at center to achieve their goals.

Which reportedly meant a likely starting lineup of Russell Westbrook, Wayne Ellington, Trevor Ariza and LeBron James behind him.

But Ariza is sidelined with an ankle injury.

Lakers release:

Lakers forward Trevor Ariza had an arthroscopic debridement procedure performed on his right ankle today. He is expected to make a full and complete recovery. Team doctors will reevaluate Ariza in approximately 8 weeks, and an update will be provided at that time.

title: Frustrated Max Scherzer refuses to give ball to Dave Roberts before exiting from NL wild-card game
excerpt: Scherzer, one of the best pitchers in the NL over the last decade, was clearly displeased with his manager after being removed from Wednesday's game.
summary:
Dodgers pitcher Max Scherzer — an eight-time All-Star, three-time Cy Young Award winner, four-time wins leader and three-time National League strikeout leader — was removed during the fourth inning of his team's win-or-go-home wild-card game against the Cardinals on Wednesday night.

But not for a reason Scherzer seemed to agree with.

MORE: Cardinals vs. Dodgers live score, updates, highlights from 2021 NL wild-card game

Scherzer, who threw 94 pitches and allowed three hits, one earned run and three walks, was pulled with runners on second and third base and one out in the top of the fifth inning.

excerpt: Martinez's status is the most significant question for the Red Sox, who may have to add him to the roster and hope he can be ready later.
summary: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla. — For the one-game wild-card, manager Alex Cora acknowledged he fielded a very unusual roster given the win-or-go-home implications.A longer series would require different needs on the field and on the mound.So as the American League Division Series begins on Thursday at Tropicana Field, the Red Sox will have a slew of questions to consider about which players they'll field for the best-of-5 matchup against the Rays Here are some of the key roster questions they need to address before the rosters are officially announced midday Thursday:Will J.

title: Jerami Grant, Josh Jackson lead Pistons over Spurs in preseason opener
excerpt: Jerami Grant, a gold medalist with U.S. men's basketball team at the Tokyo Olympics, scored 18 points, Josh Jackson added 16 and the Detroit Pistons beat the San Antonio Spurs 115-105 in a preseason…
summary:
Detroit Pistons guard Josh Jackson (20) shoots over the defense of San Antonio Spurs guard Derrick White (4) during the second half of a preseason NBA basketball game, Wednesday, Oct. 6, 2021, in Detroit. (AP Photo/Carlos Osorio) 
 
 Posted at 11:18 PM, Oct 06, 2021 PISTONS 115, SPURS 105DETROIT (AP) — Jerami Grant, a gold medalist with U.S. men's basketball team at the Tokyo Olympics, scored 18 points and Josh Jackson added 16.Kelly Olynyk and Cory Joseph each had 14 points and six assists, while Saddiq Bey scored 13 points for the Pistons.

title: Nimble Approach Sets Sub 70 Golf Apart in Land of Clubmaking Giants
excerpt: From his outpost in tiny Sycamore, Ill., Jason Hiland can gaze out onto the golf equipment landscape that's bogged down to the equivalent of a six-hour round
summary: Word of mouth ultimately led to the creation of the Tommy Armour III (TAIII) line of clubs. Sub 70 GolfFrom his outpost in tiny Sycamore, Ill., Jason Hiland can gaze out onto the golf equipment landscape that's bogged down to the equivalent of a six-hour round with supply-chain nightmares and he doesn't have to worry about a good night's sleep. Nor is he concerned whether he can take care of his customers at Sub 70 Golf.In the land of six to eight weeks or more of lead time, Sub 70 is getting its customers mostly what they want in two weeks, which makes it an oasis in the golf club desert of delays.

title: Volleyball starts conference play with sweep over EIU
excerpt: Rachel Essner Staff Writer ressner1@murraystate.edu The Murray State volleyball team opened conference play with a two-game sweep against Eastern Illinois University in their home opener on Friday,…
summary:
Freshman outside hitter Brooke Lynn Watts lead the Racers with 26 kills against Eastern Illinois. Photo courtesy of Racer Athletics.
 Rachel Essner
Staff Writer
ressner1@murraystate.edu
The Murray State volleyball team opened conference play with a two-game sweep against Eastern Illinois University in their home opener on Friday, Sept. 24, and Saturday, Sept. 25. 
Game One
The Racers won the first home game of the season with a three-set win over the Panthers. 
Murray State took control from the start, taking the first set 25-16.

title: By the numbers: Michigan football vs. Nebraska Cornhuskers
excerpt: The numbers indicate this will be a very tough matchup between the two teams.
summary:
Last week's game at Wisconsin ended up being a rout in favor of the Wolverines. Will the maize and blue be able to make it two on the road?

This one is a little more daunting, as Nebraska, despite the 3-3 record, has shown a pulse all season-long, more getting into its own way than anything. The Wolverines have shown few weaknesses thus far, with still just the one half against Rutgers being the lone two quarters in which Michigan hasn't been thoroughly dominant.

Conversely, Nebraska has a stellar offense, save for its porous offensive line.

title: Chicago beats Connecticut 79-69, heads to WNBA Finals
excerpt: CHICAGO (AP) — Courtney Vandersloot scored 19 points and Kahleah Copper added 18 to help the Chicago Sky beat the top-seeded Connecticut Sun 79-69 and advance to the WNBA Finals on Wednesday night.
summary:
CHICAGO (AP) — Courtney Vandersloot scored 19 points and Kahleah Copper added 18 to help the Chicago Sky beat the top-seeded Connecticut Sun 79-69 and advance to the WNBA Finals on Wednesday night.

Chicago is back in the finals for the first time since 2014 despite finishing the regular season with a .500 record.

Candace Parker, who returned home to Chicago this season, finished with 17 points, nine rebounds and seven assists.

'It means so much. Looking up into the stands and seeing familiar faces,' Parker said of getting to the Finals with her hometown team.

title: No. 3 Angelo State volleyball team sweeps LCU for eighth-straight win
excerpt: The No. 3 Angelo State University volleyball team swept Lubbock Christian Wednesday night at home in a battle of two of the three LSC leaders.
summary: In a showdown of two of the three Lone Star Conference leaders, the Angelo State University volleyball team rolled to a 25-20, 25-11, 25-17 sweep against Lubbock Christian at the Junell Center on Wednesday night.ASU improved to 14-2 overall and 7-0 in conference after the Belles pushed their winning streak to eight matches. LCU dropped to 10-5 and 6-1.The Belles and Lady Chaps began the day tied with UT Tyler atop the LSC standings.Delaney Fuller (13), Kailyn Gilbreath (12) and Sophia Berg (9) led ASU in kills.

title: After the Padres fire Jayce Tingler, owner Peter Seidler expresses strong confidence in A.J. Preller
excerpt: Preller, according to Seidler, will have wide latitude to choose the fourth full-time manager of the GM's tenure.
summary: Three days after the end of perhaps their most disastrous season, the Padres fired Jayce Tingler as manager and informed his coaches that they were free to explore opportunities with other teams.None of Wednesday's shakeup registered as much of a surprise. Nor did the fact that president of baseball operations A.J. Preller was the one making the announcement. Many in the organization and around the industry had expected that Tingler and most, if not all, of his staff would be dismissed after the Padres lost 34 of their final 46 games, squandering a franchise-record investment in a year that began with visions of a championship.

title: 'MS Dhoni doesn't seem like he'll recapture his form': Ian Bishop after CSK vs DC clash
excerpt: Ian Bishop reckons that CSK skipper MS Dhoni will not be able to 'recapture' his form back in the ongoing IPL 2021 after consecutive poor batting performances
summary: Commentator-cum-cricket pundit Ian Bishop has made it clear that he does not feel that Chennai Super Kings skipper MS Dhoni will be able to 'recapture' his form back in the ongoing IPL 2021. Bishop's remarks came after Mahendra Singh Dhoni played one of his slowest IPL knocks during CSK's previous game against Delhi Capitals on Monday. MS Dhoni could not succeed in clearing the boundary even once during his painstaking 27-ball 18 at a strike rate of 66.67. He was eventually caught behind from a delivery of pacer Avesh Khan on the first ball of the final over.

title: Former Tennessee head coach will try to crack the Coastal Carolina code
excerpt: Coastal Carolina will put its undefeated record and national ranking on the line when it plays at Arkansas State, a team led by a former SEC head coach.
summary: CONWAY, S.C. — When Coastal Carolina kicks it off against Arkansas State Thursday night, a familiar face to SEC football fans will try to lead the home team to an upset win over the 15th-ranked Chanticleers. Former Tennessee head coach Butch Jones is in his first year with the Arkansas State program.  Before coming to Jonesboro and after he was let go by Tennessee, Jones was an analyst on Nick Saban's staff at Alabama. Coastal Carolina's high-octane offense should have the green light against an Arkansas State defense which has been lit up this season - allowing 55 points to Memphis, 52 to Washington, 41 to Tulsa and 59 to Georgia Southern.

title: 49ers' Jimmy Garoppolo doesn't practice, but calf is getting 'better'
excerpt: Lance, next up on the depth chart, is taking first-team practice reps while Garoppolo is sidelined.
summary: San Francisco 49ers head coach Kyle Shanahan surprised some on Monday when he suggested quarterback Jimmy Garoppolo could be recovered enough from the calf contusion he suffered in the Week 4 loss to the Seattle Seahawks to play in this Sunday's matchup at the unbeaten Arizona Cardinals.  Per Charean Williams of Pro Football Talk, Shanahan confirmed Garoppolo isn't practicing Wednesday but added his QB1 is "better today" as he recovers from his latest setback.  "Not enough, though, to let him go, but also not enough to rule him out," Shanahan continued.

title: Titans offense looking to make a splash in Jacksonville
excerpt: Todd Downing had big shoes to fill in Nashville and through four games he is finding it to be quite the challenge. In 2020 offensive coordinator Arthur Smith guided the Titans to 30.7 points per ga…
summary: Todd Downing had big shoes to fill in Nashville and through four games he is finding it to be quite the challenge. In 2020 offensive coordinator Arthur Smith guided the Titans to 30.7 points per game. That earned Smith a head coaching job. He was succeeded by Downing who's Titans offense is averaging only 23.8. That is a full touchdown and that is a significant drop off. Most surprising about it is it has come with Derrick Henry putting up monster numbers, he leads the NFL with 510 yards rushing.

title: Bel Air's Elizabeth Pickett building stellar cross country season
excerpt: Elizabeth Pickett got neither a win nor a course record when she raced in the 47th Annual Paul Short Run at Lehigh University last Friday. Her performance, however, was perhaps the best so far in what…
summary: Skip to content Elizabeth Pickett got neither a win or a course record when she raced in the 47th Annual Paul Short Run at Lehigh University last Friday. Her performance, however, was perhaps the best so far in what is developing into a stellar cross country season for her this fall. The Bel Air senior posted a time of 18:12 over a 5K course, netting a third-place finish among 296 runners in the race — one of two high school divisions in the annual meet. Pickett's was the sixth fastest time overall among the 600 high school girls who competed in the two divisions.

title: Gonzaga alum Courtney Vandersloot and the Chicago Sky head to WNBA finals
excerpt: The Chicago Sky beat the top seeded Connecticut Sun 79 to 69 on Wednesday.
summary: MONTVILLE, Conn. — Gonzaga alum Courtney Vandersloot is headed to the WNBA finals. Vandersloot and the Chicago Sky beat the top seeded Connecticut Sun 79 to 69 on Wednesday. This victory is sending the Sky to the finals for the first time since 2014. Vandersloot led the team with 19 points. The first game of the finals with be on Oct.10 and the matchup will be determined by the winner of the Las Vegas Aces and Phoenix Mercury series. Gonzaga alum Courtney Vandersloot also scored a triple-double earlier this season.

title: Rangers' Ryan Reaves day-to-day after injury, tie-up with P.K. Subban
excerpt: Reaves' left leg bent underneath his body at the knee during a tangle-up with Devils defenseman P.K. Subban by the boards.
summary: New York Rangers winger Ryan Reaves is day to day after leaving Wednesday's preseason game against the New Jersey Devils with a lower-body injury in the first period. Rangers coach Gerard Gallant said he isn't worried about it being a long-term injury.Reaves' left leg bent underneath his body at the knee after Devils defenseman P.K. Subban clipped his right skate by the boards. The 11-year veteran had to be helped off the ice by a teammate and team trainer."I went into the corner, tried to make myself big, tried to brace myself," Subban said.

title: Sports Talk: Versatile Quis embraces love for all things sports
excerpt: by Jay ParisOctober 6, 202110
summary:
by Jay ParisOctober 6, 202110 


It was a San Diego marathon of sorts with broadcaster Steve Quis running his mouth in impressive fashion.
Over a recent span of five days, Quis, of Rancho Bernardo, cleared his throat for five events in three different sports.
'My wife loves it,' Quis said. 'Anything to get me out of the house.'
Home is where the microphone is and that's where you'll usually find the upbeat Quis. He deftly handles any play-by-play role with seldom a hiccup.
Quis, 50, embraced his sprint through a plethora of prep and collegiate games, although he cringes when asked how he delivered.

title: Suns beat Lakers again in playoff rematch matinee in Phoenix
excerpt: PHOENIX (AP)Postseason or preseason, the Phoenix Suns keep getting the best of the Los Angeles Lakers. The Western Conference champions got their first exhibition victory with a 117-105 victory Wed…
summary: PHOENIX (AP)Postseason or preseason, the Phoenix Suns keep getting the best of the Los Angeles Lakers. The Western Conference champions got their first exhibition victory with a 117-105 victory Wednesday in a rare weekday matinee start. The start time for the game in Phoenix was moved up so the Mercury could host their WNBA semifinal game on their home court late that night. The court was decorated with the Mercury's logos. Deandre Ayton had 14 points and 11 rebounds to help the Suns even their exhibition record at 1-1.

Deandre Ayton had 14 points and 11 rebounds to help the Suns even their exhibition record at 1-1.
label: sport

title: Sports briefs: Malen helps Marin Catholic golf qualify for MCALs
excerpt: Rose Malen carded a 34 at par-31 McInnis Park on Wednesday, helping the Marin Catholic girls golf team qualify for the MCAL Championship following a 152-173 win against Novato. MC got a 36 from Cam…
summary:
Rose Malen carded a 34 at par-31 McInnis Park on Wednesday, helping the Marin Catholic girls golf team qualify for the MCAL Championship following a 152-173 win against Novato.
MC got a 36 from Cameryn Stewart and a season-best 39 from Chloe Cooke in the victory.
Novato's Kiana Briggs took medalist honors again with an even-par 31.

Sophia Raymond shot a 44 to lead Tam to a 198-227 victory against San Rafael at Peacock Gap on Wednesday. Ella Grisez shot a 46 to lead the Bulldogs, who also faced San Marin.

title: Los Angeles Lakers' Trevor Ariza has ankle surgery, out at least two months
excerpt: Los Angeles Lakers forward Trevor Ariza, who has missed most of training camp because of his ankle, underwent an arthroscopic debridement procedure Wednesday and will be re-evaluated in about eight…
summary: playLeBron lauds 'energy shift' at Lakers camp (0:36)LeBron James describes the palpable rise in energy at this year's training camp compared to last season. (0:36)11:00 PM ETPHOENIX -- Trevor Ariza will be sidelined about two months after having surgery on his right ankle, the Los Angeles Lakers announced Wednesday.Ariza, one of 11 new players added by the Lakers in the offseason, underwent an arthroscopic debridement procedure Wednesday. He has missed most of training camp because of the ankle.

title: Lynchburg women's soccer tops Randolph thanks to second-half surge, wins ninth straight
excerpt: Thanks to a pair of goals in a six-minute span in the second half, Lynchburg topped Randolph 2-0 and added a ninth win to its streak.
summary:
Lynchburg women's soccer tops Randolph thanks to second-half surge, wins ninth straight 
Coach Todd Olsen referred to the letdown that sometimes follows a massive win as 'the curse of sports.' His Lynchburg women's soccer team looked like it could fall victim to the phenomenon Wednesday night.For their city rivalry game with Randolph at Shellenberger Field, the Hornets shouldn't have had any trouble finding the intensity to add another victory to their streak. They'd beaten Washington and Lee in overtime in their most recent game and, in the few days before Wednesday's contest rolled around, broke into the top 25 of a pair of Division III polls.
label: sport

title: Chargers claim 13th straight regional title with dominant performance
excerpt: Host Dow High's boys' tennis team won every flight at Wednesday's Division 2 regional,...
summary: Host Dow High's boys' tennis team won every flight at Wednesday's Division 2 regional, finishing with a perfect score of 24 points to advance to the state tournament, which will be held in the Holland area Oct. 15-16.For the Chargers, it was their 13th straight regional championship on the first day that the team had everyone healthy at the same time during an injury-riddled season. "What a statement to make on the first day we are full strength. There were some good teams here, and some of those (flight) championships took some work, but these guys came at it focused and intent on taking home a decisive regional victory," said Dow coach Terry Schwartzkopf.
label: sport

title: Shore Conference girls soccer: Jackson Memorial, Lacey win key games
excerpt: The Jackson Memorial girls soccer team wins its 4th straight game; The Lacey girls soccer team clinches at least a share of Class B South title.
summary: Video: Chloe Messer, Jackson Memorial, heads the ball for a scoreSenior midfielder Victoria Pungello starts the play with a corner kick and junior midfielder Chloe Messer finished it with a header.JACKSON – After a rough start to the season, the Jackson Memorial girls soccer team has found its rhythm.The Jaguars won their fourth straight game after a 3-1 triumph over Brick on senior day.Senior forward Kate Bryant and sophomore defender Renee Wanzor staked the Jaguars (4-5-1) to a 2-0 halftime lead that they didn't relinquish despite Brick turning up the pressure in the second half.

title: Jaguars week 5 injury report: Robertson-Harris, McCray sit out of practice on Wednesday
excerpt: The Jags look relatively healthy in comparison to the Titans and only had four player on their injury report. Half of the group (Robertson-Harris and McCray) sat out of Wednesday's practice.
summary:
The Jacksonville Jaguars released their first injury report of Week 5, and it appears the team is relatively healthy heading into their game against the Tennessee Titans. With four players surfacing on it, two didn't practice in veterans defensive lineman Roy Robertson-Harris (ankle) and edge-rusher Lerentee McCray (hamstring).

This content is not available due to your privacy preferences. Update your settings here to see it.

McCray was the player to most recently sustained an injury after hurting his hamstring during the Jags' Thursday Night Football game against the Cincinnati Bengals, where he was ruled questionable to return.

title: Soccer Teams Pause Game in Support of Players Who Accused Fired Coach of Sexual Misconduct
excerpt: On Oct. 6, the National Women's Soccer League's players paused their games to link arms in a show of solidarity following allegations of abuse against coach Paul Riley.
summary:
By Ryan Gajewski Oct 07, 2021 2:57 AMTags Megan Rapinoe & Alex Morgan Throwback: Live From E! RewindAs the National Women's Soccer League resumed play, the teams competing throughout the day paused their games in a show of unity.
On Wednesday, Oct. 6, the professional soccer league returned to action for the first time since going on hiatus last week in light of player allegations against since-fired North Carolina Courage coach Paul Riley. The three games taking place on Oct. 6 were all paused at the six-minute mark as players from both teams linked arms on the center circle.
label: sport

title: Derek Carr: Joey Bosa's 'shook' comments 'did piss me off'
excerpt: Carr described Bosa's commentary as "unfortunate."
summary:
Joey Bosa had a less-than respectful take on Derek Carr after the Los Angeles Chargers beat the Las Vegas Raiders Monday night.

The Chargers' Pro Bowl pass rusher who logged a sack and two hits on the Raiders quarterback told reporters that Carr "shuts down" when defenses apply pressure.

'We knew once we hit him a few times, he really gets shook,' Bosa told reporters. "And you saw on (Christian Covington's) sack, he was pretty much curling into a ball before we even got back there.

"Great dude, great player, he's been having a great year.

title: What channel is Rams vs. Seahawks on today? Schedule, time for NFL 'Thursday Night Football' in Week 5
excerpt: For the third and final time, the channel for
summary:
The channel for "Thursday Night Football" has changed for a third and final time for the 2021 NFL season. Well, it hasn't exactly changed, but there are more watch options in Week 5 and beyond than there were before.
Beginning in Week 5, multiple networks will carry the program. In Week 1, "Thursday Night Football" aired on NBC. From Weeks 2-4, it was an NFL Network exclusive.
Now, the game between the Rams and Seahawks will still be available on NFL Network. However, Fox and Amazon Prime will both be carrying the game as well.
label: sport

excerpt: You want the Offensive, Defensive MVPs at the halfway point? Well, you got it! Here are the top high school football players six weeks in.
summary: High school football: DeLand, Deltona face off in Battle for the BoneDeLand and Deltona renew the always epic Battle for the Bone rivalry game while FPC heads to University and Nease faces a tough St. Augustine test.Who's ready for their midterm?!OK, there are no tests here. No grades, either. In fact, this is more of a checkup than anything.Regardless, it's time to hand out some hardware! The high school football regular season is halfway over, with Week 7 signaling the start of the second half around the state.

title: 2021-22 NHL Position Rankings: Top 10 goaltenders entering new season
excerpt: Andrei Vasilevskiy? Connor Hellebuyck? Who is the best goaltender in the NHL? We break down the top 10 entering the 2021-22 season.
summary: 2021-22 NHL Position Rankings: Top 10 goalies originally appeared on NBC Sports BostonOutside of quarterback in the NFL, no position in sports is more important or faces more pressure than an NHL starting goaltender.It's a difficult position to play both physically and mentally, especially in the Stanley Cup Playoffs. Here's a look at the top 10 goaltenders in the league entering the 2021-22 season (Tuukka Rask was not considered for this list because he's not signed to a team right now). All advanced stats via Natural Stat Trick.
label: sport

title: Some Extra Incentive for KJ Jefferson with Arkansas Going on Road to Ole Miss
excerpt: Arkansas quarterback KJ Jefferson is back playing at a place he turned down in recruiting.
summary: KJ Jefferson played his high school football slightly more than a half hour from where Arkansas will face Ole Miss on Saturday."I'm feeling pumped," Jefferson said this week. "I'm very excited. I've got a lot of family members coming to the game to watch me play who have never been to a game."He was on the roster for the 2019 game in Oxford, but hadn't seen the field in a game yet. Jefferson was the backup last year in Starkville against Mississippi State, but that's over two hours from Sardis, Miss.
label: sport

title: More on WOW reboot, AJ Lee's role
excerpt: The former WWE Divas champion will provide color commentary when the show returns next year. At the press conference, she explained why she's joining Jeanie Buss' company.
summary:
More details have arrived following the surprising news that former WWE Divas champion AJ Mendez (fka AJ Lee) is returning to the world of professional wrestling with the syndicated women's promotion WOW. 
Mendez herself spoke at the Oct. 6 press conference, explaining why she's joining owner Jeanie Buss' WOW team.


'But my goal after wrestling, was to create those characters for the next generation. So every little girl could see themselves on TV and know that nothing was impossible.'We're not crying… you are, from the words that AJ Mendez spoke at the press conference! pic.
label: sport

title: Former Ange Postecoglou protege Matt McKay explains why Celtic transformation is on track despite shaky start
excerpt: For anyone doubting Ange Postecoglou's ability to turn Celtic around, they only need to talk to former Brisbane Roar captain Matt McKay.
summary:
For anyone doubting Ange Postecoglou's ability to turn Celtic around, they only need to talk to former Brisbane Roar captain Matt McKay. 
The former Socceroo was at the heart of a Roar team Postecoglou successfully transformed into two-time A-League champions a decade ago. Much like his reign so far at Celtic, Postecoglou's tenure as Roar coach began in shaky fashion after arriving 10 games deep into the 2009-10 season. The Aussie coach lost his first two games, only won two of his first eight matches and saw Brisbane suffer a humiliating 5-1 defeat against local rivals Gold Coast United.
label: sport

title: LSU top CB Stingley out indefinitely after foot procedure
excerpt: Baton Rouge, LA – LSU All-America cornerback Derek Stingley Jr. had a procedure performed on his foot, head coach Ed Orgeron announced on Wednesday. Orgeron said there is no timetable on Stingley's return to the field. 'I appreciate all of the support from LSU and the fans,' Stingley Jr. said. 'I'm doing all that I […]
summary:
PASADENA, CALIFORNIA – SEPTEMBER 04: Derek Stingley Jr. #7 of the LSU Tigers reacts against the UCLA Bruins in the first quarter at Rose Bowl on September 04, 2021 in Pasadena, California. (Photo by Ronald Martinez/Getty Images)

Baton Rouge, LA – LSU All-America cornerback Derek Stingley Jr. had a procedure performed on his foot, head coach Ed Orgeron announced on Wednesday.

Orgeron said there is no timetable on Stingley's return to the field.

'I appreciate all of the support from LSU and the fans,' Stingley Jr.

summary:
THIS NEXT MATCHUP FOR CAJUN FOOTBALL MAY BE THE MOST IMPORTANT OF THE YEAR, TO DATE…

APP. STATE ON TUESDAY NIGHT. NATIONAL T.V., PRIME TIME…

Lafayette, LA – The Cajuns next matchup may be the most important one of the year, to date. It's Appalachian State.

The game could decide home field for the Sun Belt Championship. If Louisiana wins this game and Coastal beats App State the week following this game, UL will need to run the table to secure home field for the SBC Championship.

One of the challenges for Head Coach Billy Napier and the Cajuns is the adjusted weekly schedule.

title: Tyson Fury heated up after press conference with Deontay Wilder ⋆ Boxing News 24
excerpt: By Charles Brun: WBC heavyweight champion Tyson Fury seemed to lose his temper during Wednesday's press conference with Deontay Wilder for their fight
summary:
By Charles Brun: WBC heavyweight champion Tyson Fury seemed to lose his temper during Wednesday's press conference with Deontay Wilder for their fight this Saturday, October 9th. When it came time for the traditional face-off between the 6'7″ Deontay and Fury, Top Rank promoter Bob Arum nixed that idea, telling both fighters that there wouldn't be a face-off.
Fury looked like he hadn't been told ahead of time, so it was a surprise to him that he couldn't face off with Wilder.
Fury (30-0-1, 21 KOs) spent the last portion of the press conference talking over Wilder (42-1-1, 41 KOs), not letting him finish his statement when he said he didn't regret saying he felt he cheated during their fight last year.

summary:
Oct 7 (Reuters) - Premier League club Brighton & Hove Albion said one of their players is assisting police with an investigation into an alleged offence.

Sky Sports reported that a player, who cannot be named for legal reasons, was arrested at a nightclub in Brighton early on Wednesday.

"Two men have been arrested after a woman reported being sexually assaulted at a venue in Brighton, in the early hours of Wednesday," Sussex Police said in a statement.

"A man in his 40s and a man in his 20s, both from Brighton, were arrested on suspicion of sexual assault and remain in police custody at this time.

Democrats in the U.S. Congress on Wednesday were set to unveil legislation to reduce illegal deforestation globally by restricting the trade of certain agricultural commodities, such as palm oil and cattle, produced with those methods. The "FOREST Act of 2021," introduced simultaneously in the Senate and House of Representatives by Democratic Senator Brian Schatz and Representative Earl Blumenauer, could have a major impact on trade from nations such as Brazil and Indonesia, but faces a difficult climb in the deeply divided Congress.

excerpt: ONAWAY — The hopes of winning another Ski Valley Conference volleyball title took a major hit for the Onaway Cardinals, who suffered a 3-1 loss to league leader Johannesburg-Lewiston (14-25, 25-12, 15…
summary: ONAWAY — The hopes of winning another Ski Valley Conference volleyball title took a major hit for the Onaway Cardinals, who suffered a 3-1 loss to league leader Johannesburg-Lewiston (14-25, 25-12, 15-25, 16-25) at home on Tuesday.With the loss, the Cardinals (15-10-3) fell to 3-2 in conference play, while JoBurg improved to a perfect 5-0. Vicky Mosteirin led the Cardinals with seven kills and 18 digs, while Nicole Larson tallied five kills, three aces and 11 digs, Aubrey Benson had two kills, five blocks and two digs, and Cloe Ehrke added one kill, 14 assists, 18 digs and two aces.

excerpt: TORONTO – McLeod Bethel-Thompson threw two TD strikes while Dexter McCoil Sr. and Chris Edwards both returned interceptions for touchdowns during a wild third quarter as the Toronto Argonauts…
summary: TORONTO – McLeod Bethel-Thompson threw two TD strikes while Dexter McCoil Sr. and Chris Edwards both returned interceptions for touchdowns during a wild third quarter as the Toronto Argonauts defeated the Ottawa Redblacks 35-16 on Wednesday night. All four scoring plays came in a 27-point third for Toronto (5-3), which improved to 4-0 at home this season. There were 6,788 in attendance at BMO Field. McCoil Sr. corralled a Caleb Evans pass tipped by defensive lineman Cordarro Law and took it back 71 yards at 7:22 to put Toronto ahead 21-9.

title: Kevin Durant sees Rockets guard Kevin Porter Jr. as ‘special, special talent'
excerpt: "A special, special talent," future Hall of Famer Kevin Durant said of Rockets guard Kevin Porter Jr. after Tuesday's big game.
summary:
Count former MVP and two-time NBA champion Kevin Durant as among those impressed by Kevin Porter Jr. of the Houston Rockets.

After the third-year guard tallied 25 points and 5 assists in just 29 minutes during Tuesday's win by the Rockets in the preseason opener, including 5-of-9 on 3-pointers, the Brooklyn superstar and future Hall of Famer wrote this on Instagram beneath Porter's highlight video:

A special, special talent

Now 21 years old, the lanky lefty (who says he's 6-foot-6) has earned talk this offseason as a potential Most Improved Player candidate for the 2021-22 season.

title: Why Filip Zadina's recent preseason play is encouraging for the Detroit Red Wings
excerpt: Detroit Red Wings forward Filip Zadina has played well after a slow first couple games in preseason. Wednesday in Columbus was the latest example.
summary:
Filip Zadina has been playing more like a guy who wants to stay where he is.

Zadina has been given an opportunity to play with Detroit Red Wings captain Dylan Larkin during exhibition season, a spot that guarantees good minutes. Coach Jeff Blashill described Zadina's play in Wednesday's 4-2 loss at the Columbus Blue Jackets as a bright spot 'in a group that didn't have a whole lot of bright spots.'

Zadina had an assist, and also converted in a coaches-choice shootout.

'He competed hard, he moved the puck, he made plays coming out of his end,' Blashill said.

summary: INDIANAPOLIS – Jimmie Johnson's 'childhood dream came true' on Wednesday when he drove an Indy car on the famed Indianapolis Motor Speedway oval for the first time. Next up the Indianapolis 500? Not quite yet. 'I'm as close as I've ever been,' Johnson said. 'The racer in me is taking a real serious look at this, but I still need to sit down and have that conversation at home.' Johnson and Romain Grosjean, barely a week removed from their rookie IndyCar seasons, both tested at Indianapolis Wednesday as part of the approval process to race the 500.

summary: The Dunham volleyball team shifted gears Wednesday night when it traveled to Episcopal for a District 3-IV volleyball match, but the change of pace did not slow the Tigers down.Setting aside its power game, Dunham kept Episcopal off balance with a finesse game that relied on more tip kills than the Tigers usually produce. title: How Seahawks stole the Rams' offense to create a better Russell Wilson
excerpt: Matthew Stafford has been a good fit under Sean McVay, but there needs to be more talk about how Russell Wilson has been an even better leading the Seahawks' news Rams-like attack.
summary:
There's been a lot of talk of how great a fit strong-armed Matthew Stafford is for the Rams' offense under Sean McVay. There needs to be more talk about how Russell Wilson is an even better fit for the Rams' offense — he just happens to be playing it in Seattle.
The Seahawks' future Hall of Fame quarterback is off to his typical strong start, but now he's doing it under first-year offensive coordinator Shane Waldron, who served as McVay's passing game coordinator for three seasons. The numbers and play have both been taken to a whole new level.

title: Vikings Pro Bowl RB Dalvin Cook to play 'through pain' vs. Lions
excerpt: Cook does not intend to take any time off with the campaign in danger of spiraling out of control.
summary: Minnesota Vikings Pro Bowl running back Dalvin Cook missed the Week 3 win over the Seattle Seahawks because of a right ankle sprain and visibly wasn't the same dynamic force throughout this past Sunday's 14-7 home loss to the Cleveland Browns that dropped the Vikings to 1-3 on the season.  Per Chad Graff of The Athletic, Cook does not intend to take any time off with the campaign in danger of spiraling out of control before Halloween.  "That's the plan," Cook said Wednesday of being in the lineup for this Sunday's matchup against the winless Detroit Lions.

title: Congress foresees short-term debt fix amid perilous standoff
excerpt: WASHINGTON (AP) — Republican and Democratic leaders edged back Wednesday from a perilous standoff over lifting the nation's borrowing cap, with Democratic senators signaling they were receptive to an offer from Senate GOP leader Mitch McConnell that would allow an…
summary:
'We just can't wait to the last minute to resolve this,' said Jane Fraser, CEO of the bank Citi. 'We are, simply put, playing with fire right now, and our country has suffered so greatly over the last few years. The human and the economic cost of the pandemic has been wrenching, and we don't need a catastrophe of our own making.'

The financial markets have yet to fully register the drama in Washington, though there are signs that they are getting jittery, said Adena Friedman, CEO of the Nasdaq stock exchange.
label: sport

excerpt: Teofimo Lopez reacts to the news of the Gervonta Davis vs Rolando Romero fight being official as he talks about the fight and reveals that he is betting 100K...
label: sport

title: Carmelo Anthony gets his Lakers' feet wet in preseason loss to Suns
excerpt: Lakers' Carmelo Anthony continues to get acclimated with his new team during a preseason loss against the Phoenix Suns.
summary: PHOENIX — Of all the ways for Carmelo Anthony to make his Lakers debut, this was a strange one.Playing on a court with a WNBA logo in the center in the middle of the afternoon on a Wednesday, Anthony finally stepped onto the floor in Lakers' gold to start his 19th NBA season. Ceding their prime-time spot to the more deserving WNBA conference finals, the Suns and Lakers continued their preseason in Phoenix, with L.A. losing 117-105.Anthony's Lakers' debut, though, took precedent over any result, the Lakers getting a glimpse at what the 37-year-old forward could add this season.
label: sport

title: Stakes remain high as Seahawks, Rams renew their heated rivalry Thursday night
excerpt: RENTON, Wash. — There may be as many story lines before the game as points scored during it when the Seahawks host the Rams on Thursday night at Lumen Field:
summary:
RENTON, Wash. — There may be as many story lines before the game as points scored during it when the Seahawks host the Rams on Thursday night at Lumen Field:

— There is Seattle wanting a measure of revenge for LA's win in a wild-card playoff game at Lumen Field on Jan. 9, which put a disappointing end to the Seahawks' 2020 season.

— There is the social media tit-for-tat that then ensued.

First, Rams cornerback Jalen Ramsey was caught saying the Seahawks can "take their (NFC West) hats and T-shirts to Cabo.

title: 'Countdown' October 6, 2021
excerpt: ROCKFORD, Ill. (WTVO/WQRF) — David Greenberg and Scott Leber look ahead to week seven action in high school football in the Rockford area with their mid-week digital show 'Countdown. …
summary: ROCKFORD, Ill. (WTVO/WQRF) — David Greenberg and Scott Leber look ahead to week seven action in high school football in the Rockford area with their mid-week digital show 'Countdown.'This week they discuss the DuPec-Lena-Winslow showdown in the NUIC, the big NIC-10 battle between Harlem and Belvidere North, and a wild race in the Big Northern Conference, plus a look at teams battling to get into the playoffs.DuPec's Trenton Taylor joins Scott for his 'Two Minute Drill' and Marcus Walter has our Friday night football weather forecast.
label: sport

title: O'Gorman wins AA State Golf Championship in thrilling playoff
excerpt: HURON, S.D. (KELO) — The O'Gorman boys golf team entered the final round of the Class AA State Tournament, trailing rival Lincoln by seven strokes. The Knights slowly chipped away at th…
summary: HURON, S.D. (KELO) — The O'Gorman boys golf team entered the final round of the Class AA State Tournament, trailing rival Lincoln by seven strokes. The Knights slowly chipped away at the Patriots lead throughout the final round, and by the time they had completed 36 holes, O'Gorman had pulled even, forcing a playoff between the two teams. Six players from each team would compete in the playoff, with the four lowest scores taken to determine the winner. After 1 playoff hole, the two found themselves tied once again.
label: sport

title: Anne Arundel varsity roundup (Oct. 6): Chelsea Wood leads Key girls soccer to win over Oldfields
excerpt: A roundup of high school varsity action in Anne Arundel County on Wednesday, Oct. 6, 2021.
summary: Skip to content Sophomore Chelsea Wood scored four goals to help Key girls soccer to an 8-1 victory over Oldfields in a IAAM C Conference game on Wednesday. It was the first conference win for Key (1-3, 3-3), which also got a big game from sophomore Ella Benitez (two goals, assist). Ginevra Illiff and Stella Nye scored the team's other goals, while Gabby Cumming added an assist. Andrew Beard scored three goals to lead the Admirals (7-0, 9-1) to the MIAA B Conference win. Colin McCarthy added a goal and three assists, while KJ Loyd scored a goal as well.

excerpt: The men's team placed eighth overall and the women's team placed tenth in the competition at Lehigh University.
summary:

 The Red competed in Lehigh University's Paul Short Invitational on Friday, earning top-10 team finishes for the men's and women's teams. The annual race is nationally renowned for its high level of competition and features hundreds of runners from several teams across the East Coast.

title: Resilient Lancers outlast Ithaca in exciting five-setter
excerpt: After watching his team blow a two-set lead Wednesday, Bullock Creek volleyball coach...
summary: After watching his team blow a two-set lead Wednesday, Bullock Creek volleyball coach Justin Freeland wanted to see what the Lancers were made of. He liked the answer he got -- resilience.Creek outplayed visiting Ithaca early on to take a 2-0 lead, struggled mightily on serve-receive as the Yellowjackets took the third and fourth sets to tie it, then bounced back strong and dominated the decisive fifth set to win 25-19, 25-22, 20-25, 23-25, 15-5. The win keeps the Lancers a game behind first-place Valley Lutheran in the Tri-Valley Conference West standings at 4-1-0 and was a much-needed test, Freeland said.
label: sport

title: Candace Parker, Sky into WNBA Finals after beating Sun
excerpt: Parker had 17 points, nine rebounds and seven assists to lead her hometown Chicago Sky to the WNBA Finals.
summary:
Candace Parker had 17 points, nine rebounds and seven assists to lead her hometown Chicago Sky to the WNBA Finals with a 79-69 win against the Connecticut Sun in Game 4 of the WNBA Semifinals on Wednesday.

Parker added two blocks and two steals, and Courtney Vandersloot led the Sky with 19 points, including 5 of 6 from 3-point range. Parker, playing in her first season in Chicago after 13 seasons with the Los Angeles Sparks, helped lead the Sky to their first WNBA Finals appearance since 2014.

WNBA MVP Jonquel Jones led the Sun with 25 points.
label: sport

title: Chicago beats Connecticut 79-69, heads to WNBA Finals
excerpt: CHICAGO (AP)Courtney Vandersloot and the Chicago Sky are back in the WNBA Finals for the first time since 2014 thanks in big part to Candace Parker's decision to come home. Vandersloot scored…
summary: CHICAGO (AP)Courtney Vandersloot and the Chicago Sky are back in the WNBA Finals for the first time since 2014 thanks in big part to Candace Parker's decision to come home. Vandersloot scored 19 points and Kahleah Copper added 18 to help the Sky beat the top-seeded Connecticut Sun 79-69 on Wednesday night. 'We were missing one piece, and it was Candace Parker,' Vandersloot said. 'We knew what she brought to us. She was going to take us to this point right here. Whether we win a championship or not, she changed this franchise.

title: LEADING OFF: La Russa & Baker, Red Sox vs Rays as ALDS begin
excerpt: A look at what's happening around the majors Thursday: — THAT '70s SHOW Two septuagenarians will be on the bench when Hall of Fame manager Tony La Russa and the Chicago White Sox …
summary: A look at what's happening around the majors Thursday: — THAT '70s SHOW Two septuagenarians will be on the bench when Hall of Fame manager Tony La Russa and the Chicago White Sox face the Houston Astros and skipper Dusty Baker in the opener of their best-of-five AL Division Series. A three-time World Series winner, the 77-year-old La Russa returns to the postseason for the first time since winning the 2011 championship with St. Louis before retiring. He'll send Lance Lynn (11-6, 2.69 ERA) to the mound in Game 1 to face Astros right-hander Lance McCullers Jr.
label: sport

title: What preseason revealed about the Kraken: Opening-night lineup decisions, Vince Dunn's future and more
excerpt: The potential blueprint preseason provided for how the Kraken will embark on a campaign that has been years in the making.
summary: That's it for the Seattle Kraken 's preseason. Everyone else has a few more games, but the Kraken now have less than a week before their official debut against the Vegas Golden Knights at T-Mobile Arena.The first preseason campaign in Kraken history can be assessed in one of two ways. The first and most straightforward route being they finished the exhibition circuit with a 4-2 mark. The second and hypothetically more beneficial avenue is the context of what those six games and the practices surrounding them provided Kraken coach Dave Hakstol and his assistants.
label: sport

title: Hangman Page is back, and he just won a shot at Kenny Omega's AEW World title
excerpt: The Casino Ladder Match's joker was an anxious millennial cowboy - and one of pro wrestling's best stories is back on!
summary:
Oct. 6's Anniversary edition of Dynamite in Philadelphia closed with the Casino Ladder match for a future World title shot. 
Orange Cassidy, Lance Archer, Jon Moxley, Andrade El Idolo, Matt Hardy & PAC threw down as the announced entrants... ...but the focus was on the unrevealed final competitor. Fans across the web were hoping this would be Hangman Page, and a way for the story of his pursuit of the title - and his former tag partner Kenny Omega - to continue.
Based on the pop he received, a lot of those internet fans hoping for the anxious millennial cowboy were in the Liacouras Center.
label: sport

title: Candace Parker with a 3-pointer vs. Connecticut Sun
excerpt: Candace Parker (Chicago Sky) with a 3-pointer vs. Connecticut Sun, 10/06/2021
summary: The Las Vegas were embarrassed by their previous two games, a pair of losses that put them on the brink of elimination. Chelsea Gray scored 22 points and the Aces used a massive third quarter run to beat the Phoenix Mercury 93-76 on Wednesday night, evening the WNBA semifinals at 2-all. The Aces got off to a good start for the first time in three games and ran away from the Mercury with a 26-2 run to begin the third quarter.Courtney Vandersloot and the Chicago Sky are back in the WNBA Finals for the first time since 2014 thanks in big part to Candace Parker's decision to come home.

title: Syracuse games to watch on Family Weekend
excerpt: The weekend is the first time Family Weekend has been hosted at SU since 2019 due to COVID-19.
summary:
Get the latest Syracuse news delivered right to your inbox. 
Subscribe to our sports newsletter here.
This weekend will be Syracuse University's first Family Weekend since 2019, after last year's events were virtual. The event will span from Thursday, Oct. 7 to Saturday the Oct. 9, fully in-person, with several sporting events taking place.
Here are the games to catch this Family Weekend:
Thursday, Oct. 7: Ice Hockey vs Clarkson
Syracuse Athletics is celebrating 50 years of women's athletics beginning in the fall season and into the spring 2022 season.
label: sport

title: Connecticut Sun eliminated by Chicago Sky in Game 4 of semifinals, a disappointing end to best season in franchise history
excerpt: The Connecticut Sun fell 79-69 to No. 6 Chicago Wednesday at Wintrust Arena to drop the best-of-five series, 3-1, marking another disappointing finish to an otherwise promising season.
summary: Skip to content Head coach Curt Miller and the Connecticut Sun never shied away from talking about their franchise being in a window to win a championship this season. After a 2019 finals run, big 2020 free agency and 2021 breakthrough season in which they secured the No. 1 overall seed going into the playoffs, it looked like this could be their year. But against a tough matchup in the red-hot Chicago Sky playing their best basketball of the year, the visiting Sun never looked fully themselves in semifinals, and combined with the absence of Briann January due to ankle/knee issues in Game 4, it spelled a stunning elimination.
label: sport

title: The Latest On Roman Wilson
excerpt: Rumors are swirling about Michigan's speedy sophomore wide receiver.
summary: Sometime yesterday rumors began to swirl that sophomore wide receiver Roman Wilson may have broken his wrist. Fortunately, that is not the case. The speedy pass catcher did tweak something in or around his wrist, but he's not expected to be hindered much or miss extended time. There's a chance he could play and play well this Saturday despite the slight injury.But that's where these situations get a little tricky. Wilson is telling people that he's fine and that he didn't injure anything severely, but the Michigan medical staff and coaches could always opt to hold him out as a precaution.
label: sport

title: NFL rookie rankings: Ja'Marr Chase, Micah Parsons, Chargers duo earn best early 2021 draft grades
excerpt: Sporting News ranks the best of the NFL's rookie class four weeks into the 2021 season with the Chargers, Browns, Bengals and Cowboys earning high grades from the draft.
summary:
The 2021 NFL Draft class was loaded with talent across the board and that's come to fruition early in the season. Although the focus has been on the five rookie first-round quarterbacks, that position has struggled the most out of the gate with some starting right away, some not.
Looking beyond QB, there's been plenty of immediate impact from the league's newest crop of rookies. It's not a coincidence that the teams who drafted them are succeeding because of it.
Here's who's been the best brightest so far early in their career as Sporting News grades the top rookies going into Week 5:MORE: Grading NFL rookie quarterbacks from Week 4
 (Getty Images) https://images.

title: MGolf, Long, Razorbacks Win Blessings Collegiate Invitational
excerpt: FAYETTEVILLE – Arkansas collected a clean sweep at the 2021 Blessings Collegiate Invitational including the men's team title, the men's individual champion in Luke Long, the combined team…
summary: FAYETTEVILLE – Arkansas collected a clean sweep at the 2021 Blessings Collegiate Invitational including the men's team title, the men's individual champion in Luke Long, the combined team title with the Razorback women and the combined best ball with Mateo Fernandez de Oliveira and Brooke Matthews. Matthews additionally won the women's individual title for the second straight year and the Razorback women won their second straight team title. The Razorbacks were clinging to a one-stroke lead through 36 holes and, after a tough start on hole won with three bogeys and a double, Arkansas dropped to third to start the final round.
label: sport

title: Mika Zibanejad scores twice, Rangers beat Devils 6-2
excerpt: NEW YORK (AP)Mika Zibanejad scored twice, Igor Shesterkin made 31 saves and the New York Rangers beat the New Jersey Devils 6-2 on Wednesday night in exhibition play. Sammy Blais had a goal and an …
summary: NEW YORK (AP)Mika Zibanejad scored twice, Igor Shesterkin made 31 saves and the New York Rangers beat the New Jersey Devils 6-2 on Wednesday night in exhibition play. Sammy Blais had a goal and an assist and Kaapo Kakko, Barclay Goodrow and Artemi Panarin also scored. New York lost right winger Ryan Reaves to a a lower-body injury after a first period collision with P.K. Subban that which prompted Rangers left winger Chris Kreider to challenge the defenseman to a fight at the start of the second period.

title: JC VOLLEYBALL: No. 17 OC beats Lady Chaps in five-set thriller
excerpt: The Midland College volleyball pushed No. 17 Odessa College to the limit, but the...
summary: Midland College players celebrate after Petra Fernandez (10) scores a point Saturday, Oct. 2, 2021 at Chaparral Center. Jacy Lewis/Reporter-TelegramJacy Lewis/ Reporter-Telegram ODESSA – The Midland College volleyball pushed No. 17 Odessa College to the limit, but the Wranglers prevailed in a thriller, 25-23, 25-23, 24-26, 19-25, 16-14, at the OC Sports Center on Wednesday night. The Lady Chaparrals (12-6, 4-2 in Western Junior College Athletic Conference) dropped the first two sets in the match before battling back to tie it at 2-all and forcing a fifth and deciding set.

title: Browns beware: Versatile Derwin James Jr. is Chargers' safety valve on defense
excerpt: It's another AFC test for the Chargers with the Cleveland Browns coming to town. Chargers coach Brandon Staley says the team's early success has a lot to do with the versatility of Derwin James Jr.
summary: He has gone from playing nowhere to playing everywhere, Derwin James Jr. once again visible all over the Chargers' defense.He has been on the field for 97% of the team's defensive snaps through four games, missing only a brief stretch against the Kansas City Chiefs after he dislocated his shoulder and had to pop it back in place.Under new coach Brandon Staley and now healthy, James is second on the team with 26 tackles and sealed a victory over the Las Vegas Raiders on Monday with a late interception.
label: sport

title: Thorns Place General Manager Gavin Wilkinson on Administrative Leave
excerpt: Portland Thorns players released a statement calling for the club to address "its failures" in wake of former players accusing ex-coach Paul Riley of sexual coercion.
summary: Portland Thorns announced general manager/president of soccer Gavin Wilkinson has been placed on administrative leave "pending the results of the outside independent investigation" in wake of the Paul Riley sexual coercion allegations. Per ESPN's Jeff Carlisle, he is not suspended from his duties as GM/president of soccer for MLS's Portland Timbers.The move comes less than an hour after Thorns players released a statement calling for the club to address "its failures," which included a call for him to be placed on leave.
label: sport

title: How Fyffe football has gotten to 50 straight wins, the longest streak in nation
excerpt: The Fyffe football program has won 50 straight games. Here's a look at thei Red Devils' last three close contests in 2020 and 2021.
summary: The Fyffe football program has been nothing short of dominant the last few seasons.Since 2014, the Red Devils have won five state titles, all coinciding with when head coach Paul Benefield decided to change things up from a wing-T offense to the double-wing gun offense. The team is 105-3 in that stretch.'We couldn't get over the hump and couldn't get past the second or third round,' Benefield said. 'We spent a lot of time in the weight room and we take it very seriously. We wanted to run an offense that exemplifies the weight room.

summary:
Looking for a 'magical root' in Pennsylvania? Here's what you need to know about ginseng

While many hunters are going to the woods with a gun or bow, there are other 'hunters' who are only taking a long screwdriver to find their prize.

Hunt ramps in late spring: It's ramp season in Pennsylvania: Here's what you need to know

Wild ginseng season is underway and runs through Nov. 30 across Pennsylvania. Ginseng is eaten as a supplement and can be used in teas and soft drinks. It's believed to have a variety of general benefits including weight loss, energy and improved concentration.

title: Padres fire manager Jayce Tingler after second-half collapse
excerpt: The San Diego Padres fired manager Jayce Tingler, who presided over the biggest collapse in franchise history just a season after finishing second in voting for NL Manager of the Year.
summary: SAN DIEGO — The San Diego Padres still believe they have a World Series-caliber team despite a brutal late-season collapse that left them with yet another losing record. If the Padres do make it to the Fall Classic in the near future, it won't be manager Jayce Tingler who leads them there. The Padres fired Tingler on Wednesday, three days after they finished 79-83 and in third place in the NL West, 28 games behind San Francisco. General manager A.J. Preller said Tingler — who just a season ago was second in voting for NL Manager of the Year — would be given the opportunity to remain in the organization.
label: sport

title: Woods first left his mark on the PGA 25 years ago
excerpt: At the age of 20, Tiger Woods was already a phenom. Earlier in the year he had won his third straight U.S. Amateur but he hadn't really had his official coming out party yet. That would require a win. It was 25 years ago this week, and golf was about to change forever.
summary:
LAS VEGAS — Davis Love III was in contention, as if anyone cared. He played before a handful of mostly silent fans who couldn't help but notice the ruckus unfolding a few holes ahead as Tiger Woods made his way through the back nine on what would become an historic Sunday in sports.

'Bring it on home Mr. Woods,' the well lubricated shouted from the hillsides as Woods surged into contention in the Las Vegas Invitational, a tournament that was suddenly the hottest ticket in town.

'Tiger, Tiger, Tiger,' they chanted as they strained, jostling one another to get a glimpse of the greatness to come.
label: sport

title: Youthful Rays take first step toward return to World Series
excerpt: The AL East rivals meet in a best-of-five Division Series that begins Thursday night at Tropicana Field, with the defending league champion Rays looking to take the first step toward a return to the…
summary: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla. — The Tampa Bay Rays have won more games than any other team in the American League over the past two seasons, going about their business with a quiet confidence that has the full attention of the Boston Red Sox. The AL East rivals meet in a best-of-five Division Series that begins Thursday night at Tropicana Field, with the defending league champion Rays looking to take the first step toward a return to the World Series, where they lost to the Los Angeles Dodgers last fall. With one of baseball's lowest payrolls and a roster devoid of big names, Tampa Bay wins with a youthful, selfless blend of defense, pitching and timely hitting that's served the team well in reaching the playoffs three consecutive years.
label: sport

title: NBA will not randomly test players for marijuana this season
excerpt: The NBA has agreed to not randomly test players for marijuana this season, a continuation of the policy that was put in place last year for the COVID-19 'restart bubble' and has remained since.
summary: The NBA has agreed to not randomly test players for marijuana this season, a continuation of the policy that was put in place last year for the COVID-19 'restart bubble' and has remained since. Drug testing will continue for things such as human growth hormone and performance-enhancers, along with what the league calls 'drugs of abuse' - such as methamphetamine, cocaine and opiates. But the league's agreement with the National Basketball Players Association over random marijuana tests will continue for at least another season.
label: sport

title: HIGH SCHOOL ROUNDUP: Two more wins push Weymouth girls cross country to 6-0
excerpt: Freshman Ella Bates won the 3.1-mile race in 19:37 as the Wildcats beat host Needham and Braintree on Wednesday.
summary: So far, so (very) good for the Weymouth High girls cross country team.The Wildcats improved to 6-0 by posting wins over host Needham, 27-30, and Braintree, 15-50, on Wednesday. Freshman Ella Bates won the 3.1-mile race in 19:37, and Weymouth placed five other runners in the top 10, including seniors Shea Roche (4th, 20:11) and Alison Glavin (5th, 20:12)."This is a character-building win for our team," coach Mike Miller said. "Needham threw everything they had at us and led with 800 meters to go, but Shea and Alison beared down, and the rest of the pack hung together and did their thing.

title: Caledonia, Rockford to decide 1st place in the OK Red
excerpt: The Rams host the Fighting Scots on Friday night
summary:
Caledonia, Rockford battle for OK Red lead

First place in the OK Red is on the line Friday night when Rockford (4-0, 6-0) hosts Caledonia (4-0, 6-0).

There is a lot of hype around this game considering both teams are undefeated and the game will be broadcast live across the entire state on Bally Sports Detroit.

"I think just taking it game by game even with all this awesome stuff that we get every single week," Rockford senior quarterback Zak Ahern said about what is important for his team. "We just got to play game-by-game take it play-by-play and not make it too big and just work our way there.

title: Sky advance to the WNBA Finals after beating Sun 79-69
excerpt: The Sky made history becoming the first No. 6 seed to punch their ticket to the Finals under the league's new playoff format, beating the No. 1 Sun, 79-69.
summary:
The astonishing happened Wednesday night in this title-less WNBA town. 
The Sun set in the Chicago Sky. 
And it was spectacular. 
Since the WNBA established its new playoff format in 2016 the No. 1 and No. 2 seeds have met in the WNBA Finals every year except one. In 2018 the No. 1 Storm swept the No. 3 Mystics.
The Sky made history becoming the first No. 6 seed to punch their ticket to the Finals under the league's new playoff format, beating the No. 1 Sun, 79-69. 
Kahleah Copper said ahead of Game 4 that the team had no intention of making the trip back to Connecticut for a fifth game and they played like it from the jump.

title: Predicting every Big Ten college football game in Week 6
excerpt: This is the week we'll really know the complexion of the conference. Really good games from top to bottom!
summary: 10 of the 14 Big Ten teams are in action this Saturday, and finally nonconference is essentially over (though there are still some holdovers in future weeks).There's one gigantic, ranked-on-ranked matchup between No. 3 Iowa and No. 4 Penn State, and otherwise three games featuring ranked Big Ten teams. The sole unranked-on-unranked matchup is between Wisconsin and Illinois.Four teams are idle — Purdue, Minnesota, Indiana, and Northwestern. For the Boilermakers, Hoosiers, and Wildcats, it's a good chance for them to lick their wounds after having suffered losses in Week 5.

title: Patriots edge Panthers for sectional crown
excerpt: The Olentangy Liberty boys golf team has been boosted by its balance all season long.Wednesday's Division I sectional tournament at Turnberry was no
summary:
By Ben Stroup - bstroup@aimmediamidwest.com The Olentangy Liberty boys golf team has been boosted by its balance all season long.
Wednesday's Division I sectional tournament at Turnberry was no exception as the Patriots used that balance to capture a sectional title and advance to next week's district tournament at Apple Valley.
It took all five scores to take top honors as Liberty and Pickerington North both finished with rounds of 297. The Patriots earned the crown thanks to a better fifth-man score, though.

At the time, India was hitting .211, and he had just struck out seven times over a four-game stretch.

title: Sports Digest: Bruins end preseason with another OT loss
excerpt: Washington ends Boston to its third straight OT loss in the prseason, 4-3.
summary:
HOCKEY

The Boston Bruins closed out their preseason on Wednesday night with a 4-3 overtime loss to the Washington Capitals at TD Garden.

Anthony Mantha scored at 1:41 of overtime for Washington.

Boston, which opens its season at home against Dallas on Oct. 16, ended its preseason with two wins in six games. They lost their last three games in overtime.

Charlie Coyle, Taylor Hall and David Pastrnak scored for the Bruins.

• The Arizona Coyotes signed forward Alex Galchenyuk to a one-year deal.

title: Thorns GM Gavin Wilkinson on administrative leave pending investigation results
excerpt: The decision comes after Thorns players released a list of demands for the organization, including requesting Wilkinson be placed on administrative leave
summary: Portland Thorns general manager and president Gavin Wilkinson has been placed on administrative leave pending the results of the club's independent investigation of its 2015 investigation into former coach Paul Riley, the team announced on Wednesday.The Thorns' announcement came just 40 minutes after the players released a list of demands for the organization, including requesting Wilkinson be placed on administrative leave until the team's independent investigation is completed. Wilkinson has not been suspended from his duties as general manger and president of MLS's Portland Timbers.

title: Unvaxxed NBA players face fines, jail if quarantine breached in Toronto: Sources
excerpt: Per Canada's Quarantine Act, violations could lead to up to six months in prison and/or $750,000 in fines.
summary:
NBA players have been informed that unvaccinated players who breach quarantine in Toronto face criminal offenses, sources tell The Athletic. Unvaccinated players are only able to leave their hotel for team activities.

Per Canada's Quarantine Act, violations could lead to up to six months in prison and/or $750,000 in fines.

Regardless of vaccination status, all players must pass a PCR test before traveling to Toronto this season, according to the NBA's health and safety protocols for the 2021-22 season.

title: Source: NHL investigates Sharks' Kane for fake vaccine card
excerpt: San Jose forward Evander Kane is being investigated on allegations that he used a fake COVID-19 vaccination card.
summary:
SAN JOSE — San Jose Sharks forward Evander Kane is being investigated on allegations that he used a fake COVID-19 vaccination card.
A person familiar with the investigation says the league is looking into whether Kane submitted a fake card. The person spoke to the Associated Press on condition of anonymity because details of the investigation have not been announced by the NHL.
The latest investigation was first reported by Front Office Sports.
Using a fake vaccination card is illegal in both the United States and Canada, as well as against NHL rules.

title: NWSL players stop matches in league-wide demonstrations, outline demands for first time
excerpt: In the first matches played since a report in The Athletic exposed allegations of sexual coercion and other abuse, the NWSL's players took a stand and made their voices heard.
summary:
(Getty Images) https://images.daznservices.com/di/library/sporting_news/d3/58/nwsl-logo-2021_1hjs88zgoaupr1qap2590l8iso.jpg?t=1082461228&w=500&quality=80 
 In the first night of National Women's Soccer League matches since the publication of a Sept. 30 report in The Athletic gave rise to allegations of abuse and harassment around the league, NWSL players paused each of the matches played on Wednesday night in a demonstration of player solidarity and support for the victims. The matches resumed after a minute of stoppage and were played out in their entirety.

title: Cleveland Browns LB Jeremiah Owusu-Koramoah remains patient regarding playing time
excerpt: BEREA, Ohio - Browns defensive coordinator Joe Woods has consistently said the team wanted ease rookie linebacker Jeremiah Owusu-Koramoah into whatever role he'd fulfill on the team.
summary:
BEREA, Ohio - Browns defensive coordinator Joe Woods has consistently said the team wanted ease rookie linebacker Jeremiah Owusu-Koramoah into whatever role he'd fulfill on the team.

He's been true to that. A Notre Dame product, Owusu Koramoah went from participating on 30% of snaps against the Kansas City Chiefs to 52% last week against the Minnesota Vikings.

He confirmed he's been given more responsibility since that first game.

"The more snaps I get, the more knowledgeable I become of the game and things like that," he said, Tuesday.

title: Smyrna remembers assistant football coach Garry Mooney who died from COVID-19
excerpt: Bulldogs coach Matt Williams and school principal Sherri Southerland remember assistant football coach.
summary: SMYRNA — The news is still sinking in for the Smyrna High School community after assistant football coach Garry Mooney died Wednesday of COVID-19.Mooney, 51, oversaw the school's freshman football program and was the special teams coach and scout team coordinator, according to Smyrna coach Matt Williams."I'm still trying to process it," Williams said. "It's a shock. Coach was such a good man, a good Christian man. He was genuine and loved working and coaching kids. My main focus is his wife, kids and his family because they need our prayers and support right now.

title: NWSL returns to the field, with signs of protest and a statement on the pitch
excerpt: The NWSL ended its nine-day hiatus and its players seized upon the return to the field to make a statement in the sixth minute -- a nod to the amount of time it took for allegations of abuse to be heard.
summary: 'I played in this league where this was normalized, and that's not okay,' Kyle continued. '… These women that have had to face this and felt like they didn't have a voice, they were too scared to come out and speak, they were scared of losing their job where they get paid nothing anyway — imagine being put in a situation like that. Imagine someone like myself, and I've always been outspoken, that was scared to say anything about it. Whether it was from coaches, whether it was that verbal abuse, whether it was that emotional abuse, abuse is abuse.
label: sport

title: Petoskey golf qualifies for D2 state finals after chaotic week
excerpt: Petoskey golf qualifies for D2 state finals after chaotic week
summary:
SAGINAW — It was a heck of a week for the Petoskey girls' golf team, in more ways than one.

Scheduled to play in their Division 2 golf regional Monday, a rain filled weekend and Sunday night left the Saginaw Valley Public Golf Course unplayable.

So, it was moved to Tuesday. Well, more rain soaked the course and again, no play could tee off.

Moved back now two days, Petoskey and the rest of the Division 2 teams in attendance finally got things swinging Wednesday.

With three straight regional titles heading into the match and some solid play throughout the year, Petoskey was indeed one of the favorites to win and advance to the state finals.

title: Baker Mayfield Has A Message For His Doubters
excerpt: Cleveland Browns quarterback Baker Mayfield posts a lengthy Wednesday evening social media message to quell his doubters.
summary:
(Photo by Christian Petersen/Getty Images) It looks like Cleveland Browns quarterback Baker Mayfield is doing a lot of introspection this week.
After his disappointing performance against the Vikings, Mayfield is mentally trying to right the ship before he gets out on the field on Sunday against a very tough Los Angeles Chargers team.
On Wednesday night, Mayfield shared his thoughts with us via Instagram.

#Browns Baker Mayfield has a reminder for everyone on IG about who he is: pic.twitter.com/OlOYKCXSoW
— Mary Kay Cabot (@MaryKayCabot) October 7, 2021 Mayfield said:
'People seem to forget how I got here… nothing was given.

title: STARS OF THE DAY: Somerset Berkley boys, girls soccer fall short against Dighton-Rehoboth
excerpt: The Somerset Berkley girls soccer team gave the defending South Coast Conference champion Dighton-Rehoboth all they could handle.
summary: SOMERSET — Despite being short-handed, the Somerset Berkley girls soccer team gave the defending South Coast Conference champion Dighton-Rehoboth all they could handle on Wednesday.The Lady Raiders fought hard but fell short, 3-1, against the unbeaten Falcons at Somerset Berkley Regional High School.Jocelyn Wilson scored the lone goal for SB (2-4-3; 1-2-3 in SCC), who played with just two substitutions. Alyssa Cheetham picked up the assist.The score was 3-1 at halftime and stayed that way the rest of the contest.
label: sport

title: AJ Lee returns to pro wrestling with WOW
excerpt: April Mendez will be an Executive Producer with the rebooted women's promotion, which has a deal with CBSViacom to launch next year.
summary:
WOW - Women of Wrestling held a press conference tonight (Oct. 6), shortly after ET had an exclusive report about the Jeanie Buss-owned promotion relaunching in partnership with CBSViacom.
The show relaunching in September 2022 in syndication on CBS affiliates (with their library available on CW Seed and Pluto TV platforms starting in December of this year) will have a major name on the creative and production side. April Mendez, better known to WWE fans as AJ Lee, will presumably not be wrestling.
label: sport

title: Kennedy stands tall on the back line for Cinnaminson
excerpt: Cinnaminson goalkeeper Sean Kennedy turned in his seventh shutout of the season Wednesday as the Pirates defeated Delran, 1-0.
summary:
CINNAMINSON – Sean Kennedy is a student of history, but he didn't let it influence him.

Cinnaminson's senior goalkeeper saw his team take a one-goal lead against Delran in a meeting of undefeated teams Wednesday, then miss two chances to secure victory with a second goal.

If you're familiar with the recent history of this rivalry, you know Delran – ranked second in the South Jersey Mean 15 – had won seven of the last eight meetings and advanced in a shootout in the other one. And you've seen some games, seemingly won, only to be squandered because that wayward chance didn't get converted in the late going.
label: sport

title: Delran, Cinnaminson renew their rivalry
excerpt: Ryan Adams scored a second-half goal and Ryan Kennedy recorded his seventh shutout of the season, as the Cinnaminson soccer team defeated Delran, 1-0.

title: Civic Memorial outlasts Alton Marquette in battle of 20-win teams
excerpt: BETHALTO — Kristie Ochs has seen her team repeatedly do it all season and yet it still surprises her.
summary:
Civic Memorial outlasts Alton Marquette in battle of 20-win teams 
BETHALTO — Kristie Ochs has seen her team repeatedly do it all season and yet it still surprises her.All year, the Civic Memorial girls volleyball team has found itself down big before rallying. "I am shocked every time that they can dig an eight-point hole and then dig right back out of it," Ochs said. "It's amazing."The Eagles continued that formula Wednesday, defeating Alton Marquette 25-19, 19-25, 25-22 at Civic Memorial High School.
label: sport

title: Italy vs. Spain result: La Roja snaps Italy's 37-game unbeaten streak in Nations League semi loss
excerpt: Only three months after meeting in a memorable Euro 2021 semifinal at Wembley Stadium, Italy and Spain go head-to-head once again with a spot in another final on the line.
summary:
(Getty Images) https://images.daznservices.com/di/library/sporting_news/37/37/ferran-torres-spain-uefa-nations-league-semi-october-6-2021_jtrhg8nda8wx1y1tsxgnbyhj8.jpg?t=1546457292&w=500&quality=80 
 Spain got its revenge. Three months after losing a Euros 2021 semifinal to Italy in a penalty-kick shootout, La Roja got the better of defending European champion Italy in a UEFA Nations League semifinal, winning 2-1 in Milan's Stadio San Siro.
In the process Spain's victory also snapped Italy's record 37-game undefeated streak which had lasted over two years.
label: sport

title: Sailing Vies for Sixth-Place Finish in Women's ACC Semifinals
excerpt: Fierce competition and gentle winds test Cornell's skill as the team qualified for the ACC final on Oct. 16 and 17.
summary:
Julia Nagel/Sun Assistant Photography Editor Sailors fought to find passing lanes as an easy breeze made the competition sharper in St. Mary's City over the weekend. 
 More on Sports
 Subscribe to Sports 




 The Red sailing finished sixth out of 18 teams this weekend in the Women's ACC first round regatta, held in St. Mary's City, Maryland, on Oct. 2 and 3. Finishing within the top nine teams, the Red qualified to compete in the Women's ACC Championship Finals at Harvard on Oct. 16 and 17. This weekend, the Red raced against 18 of the country's 36 best intercollegiate women's sailing teams.
label: sport

title: Portland Thorns general manager placed on leave pending handling of sexual harassment claims against former coach
excerpt: Portland Thorns players called for Gavin Wilkinson to be placed on leave pending the investigation into allegations against ex-coach Paul Riley.
summary: PORTLAND, Ore. — Portland Thorns general manager Gavin Wilkinson was placed on administrative leave Wednesday evening pending an investigation into the team's handling of former players' sexual harassment allegations against former coach Paul Riley.  An investigative report by The Athletic accused Riley of coercing players into sex and abusing his position of power for years. Among the accusers were former Thorns players Meleana "Mana" Shim and Sinead Farrelly. Just an hour before Wilkinson was placed on leave, several Thorns players posted a message of support on the team's behalf to the players who came forward with the accusations, as well as a list of demands that including placing Wilkinson on leave until an investigation is completed.
label: sport
