title: NCAA waiver will help football teams replace transfers
excerpt: The waiver will allow teams to sign as many as seven players to replace those that leave through the transfer portal.
summary:
Looking to address the growing number of transfers, the NCAA Division I Council approved a one-year waiver Tuesday that will allow college football teams to sign up to seven players to replace those that leave.

Current NCAA rules state a team can sign no more than 25 players to a scholarship in any year. That includes incoming high school prospects and college transfers. The waiver will allow teams to sign 25 players, plus as many as seven transfers – not high school players – to replace those who transfer out in the first term.
label: sport

title: NFL Draft Analyst: Mississippi State's Charles Cross Has First-Round Potential
excerpt: Will Bulldogs offensive lineman Charles Cross be a first-round pick in the 2022 NFL Draft? One NFL Draft analyst thinks he could be.
summary: Mississippi State offensive lineman Charles Cross' draft stock is rapidly rising. And deservedly so, as Cross has been one of the few bright spots for the Bulldogs offensive line this season. Cross has continued to build on his strong freshman season, and he doesn't look to be slowing down any time soon. Head coach Mike Leach commented on Cross' growth after the Bulldogs' second game of the season.'I thought he played better this week. To be honest, that last week he played, I didn't think he had a particularly good game," Leach told reporters at the time.
label: sport

title: Deontay Wilder warns Tyson Fury about cheating
excerpt: Deontay Wilder gave Tyson Fury a warning on Saturday about him cheating ahead of their trilogy match. Wilder (42-1-1, 41 KOs) says he doesn't regret ANY of
summary:
Deontay Wilder gave Tyson Fury a warning on Saturday about him cheating ahead of their trilogy match. Wilder (42-1-1, 41 KOs) says he doesn't regret ANY of the cheating allegations that he's leveled at Fury (30-0-1, 21 KOs) since losing to him 20 months ago in their rematch in Las Vegas. (Photo credit: Sean Michael Ham/TGB Promotions)
In what appears to be a reference to Fury's flapping gloves, Wilder says 'your eyes don't lie.'
You can bet that Wilder's trainer Malik Scott will be checking Fury's gloves with a fine-tooth comb before the fight to ensure there's nothing out of sorts with them.
label: sport

title: Mountain Home faces 'must-win' game at Van Buren
excerpt: Bombers in search of first 6A-West Conference victory
summary: The last time the Mountain Home Bombers faced a must-win situation after a two-game losing skid, they responded well.Mountain Home head coach Steve Ary is hoping his team responds in the same fashion Friday night when it travels to Van Buren.After ending their nonconference slate with a 35-7 whipping of Batesville, the Bombers (1-4 overall) sit at 0-2 in the 6A-West standings.'We know we have a little pressure on us right now, and maybe we need that,' Ary said. 'We had that pressure going into Batesville, and it seemed to work out for us.
label: sport

Ouyang leads from top of lineup as Ladue tops Villa Duchesne for district team championship Megan Ouyang of Ladue returns a serve in a doubles match at the Class 2 District 2 girls team championships at the Webster Tennis Center in Webster Groves, Missouri on Wednesday, October 6, 2021. title: Visitation uses short memory to cruise past Whitfield
excerpt: FRONTENAC — During senior day festivities, Visitation senior Rachel Surber revealed that her most inspirational quote is 'Don't swing' — a field hockey reminder from senior Maeve Fogarty to receive
summary:
Visitation uses short memory to cruise past Whitfield Whitfield's Sloane Shatzer (left) and Visitation's Annie Dolan (center) and Rachel Surber surround a bouncing ball in front of the Whitfield goal during a field hockey game on Wednesday, October 6, 2021 at Visitation Academy in Town and Country, Mo. Paul Kopsky | STLhighschoolsports.com 
FRONTENAC — During senior day festivities, Visitation senior Rachel Surber revealed that her most inspirational quote is 'Don't swing' — a field hockey reminder from senior Maeve Fogarty to receive the ball on her stick before taking a swing at it.
label: sport

title: Emoni Bates measures in with negative wingspan at Memphis pro day
excerpt: Bates recorded some rather underwhelming measurements on Wednesday in front of NBA teams.
summary:
On Wednesday, the Memphis Tigers hosted a pro day at their practice facility and gave NBA teams the opportunity to scout the likes of Emoni Bates, Jalen Duren and several other players.

Bates and Duren were the center of attention during the event as they were both top-five recruits coming into the season, and will eventually be high draft picks. Teams had the chance to see how each player measured in, from wingspans to vertical jumps.

Unfortunately, Bates recorded some rather underwhelming measurements.
label: sport

title: Logan Webb to start NLDS Game 1 for division champion Giants
excerpt: Logan Webb will start for the San Francisco Giants in Game 1 of their NL Division Series on Friday night against the Cardinals or Dodgers.
summary: Logan Webb will start for the San Francisco Giants in Game 1 of their NL Division Series on Friday night against the Cardinals or Dodgers.Fellow right-hander and 14-game winner Kevin Gausman will go Saturday night in Game 2 for the NL West champions, having thrived lately with a little extra rest — something that factored into manager Gabe Kapler's decision when he felt equally confident in both pitchers.CLICK HERE FOR MORE SPORTS COVERAGE ON FOXNEWS.COM"To be able to throw the first game for the best team in the league is pretty cool," Webb said after his bullpen session Wednesday.

title: Courage owner: Team believed Riley to be in ‘good standing'
excerpt: The owner of the National Women's Soccer League's North Carolina Courage says the organization was not aware of allegations of sexual harassment against former coach Paul Riley until the report that led to his firing.
summary: FILE - In this Sept. 20, 2018, file photo, North Carolina Courage coach Paul Riley is interviewed by a reporter next to the trophy for the National Women's Soccer League championship during a media event at Nike in Beaverton, Ore. The National Women's Soccer League will not play the games scheduled for this weekend as it deals with the fallout from allegations of sexual misconduct against a former coach. North Carolina Courage coach Paul Riley was fired by the team following a report in The Athletic that detailed the alleged misconduct, which included claims from two former players of sexual coercion.

title: Northern Colorado reprimands Max McCaffrey for clipboard incident
excerpt: McCaffrey tossed a broken clipboard into the stands and hit a fan during a game at Montana State.
summary:
GREELEY, Colo. – The University of Northern Colorado has reprimanded offensive coordinator Max McCaffrey for tossing a broken clipboard into the stands that hit a spectator during a game at Montana State.

The Bears' athletics department, in conjunction with Montana State and the Big Sky Conference, finished a review of the incident involving McCaffrey, concluding that throwing the clipboard to a fan as a souvenir showed 'a lack of judgment but no malicious intent.' McCaffrey is the son of Northern Colorado head coach and longtime NFL receiver Ed McCaffrey.
label: sport

title: Petoskey volleyball drops to TC Central; energy, play picks up
excerpt: Petoskey volleyball drops to TC Central; energy, play picks up
summary: PETOSKEY — Wednesday night's match against Traverse City Central once again came as a Big North Conference loss for the Petoskey volleyball team.But, it felt a bit different.Everything from the hits and movement around the court, to the overall energy Petoskey brought was different than recent matches. It might have been a four-set win for the Trojans, though Petoskey building their play back up to what it was earlier this season was evident.A major factor playing into that was the return of senior setter Olivia DeGroot, though just as she returned, senior libero Lia Iacoangeli missed Wednesday's game.

title: La Russa back in postseason with White Sox against Astros
excerpt: A three-time World Series winner, Chicago White Sox manager Tony La Russa certainly couldn't be nervous as his team prepares for the opener of a best-of-five AL Division Series against the Houston…
summary: A three-time World Series winner, Chicago White Sox manager Tony La Russa certainly couldn't be nervous as his team prepares for the opener of a best-of-five AL Division Series against the Houston Astros on Thursday.Except he is — and it has nothing to do with the Hall of Famer being out of the dugout for almost a decade before the White Sox hired him prior to this season.CLICK HERE FOR MORE SPORTS COVERAGE ON FOXNEWS.COM"I've been nervous my whole career," La Russa said Wednesday. "Right now, I'm nervous because I care.

title: Derek Carr: Joey Bosa's comments 'did piss me off'
excerpt: After Monday night's game between the Raiders and Chargers, L.A. defensive end Joey Bosa had some pointed things to say about the connection between Las Vegas quarterback Derek Carr getting hit and…
summary:
After Monday night's game between the Raiders and Chargers, L.A. defensive end Joey Bosa had some pointed things to say about the connection between Las Vegas quarterback Derek Carr getting hit and getting 'shook.' On Wednesday, Carr admitted that Bosa's words left a mark.
'I just thought it was unfortunate that he'd even think to say it,' Carr told reporters. 'Maybe he was just trying to get under my skin. Which he did piss me off. So good job for that.'
Said Bosa on Monday night, 'We knew once we hit him a few times, he really gets shook.

title: NC Courage management is hiding behind silence as NWSL players demand answers
excerpt: The NC Courage NWSL soccer team refuses to answer questions about what management knew about abusive coach Paul Riley. NWSL players ask for a new investigation.
summary:
North Carolina Courage owner Steve Malik, left, presents a jersey to North Carolina Governor Roy Cooper during a recognition ceremony for the Women's International Champions Cup champions in 2018. Malik and team officials have not answered questions since firing coach Paul Riley last week. rwillett@newsobserver.com

Haven't we had enough silence?

Almost a week since the NC Courage fired Paul Riley when allegations of sexual coercion at a previous coaching stop surfaced, the team has released two statements, one last week collectively from the players and management and one Wednesday from primary owner Steve Malik.

title: Sean Tucker Added to Maxwell Award Watch List
excerpt: Syracuse's star running back has had a stellar start to the 2021 season.
summary: Syracuse running back Sean Tucker was one of 10 players added to the Maxwell Award Watch list. The Maxwell Award is given annually to the top player in college football. Tucker is the first Orange player to be on the watch list since Eric Dungey in 2018. Don McPherson won it in 1987. Tucker currently leads the ACC in rushing and all-purpose yards. He is ranked third in the nation in both categories as well. Tucker burst onto the scene last season as a true freshman. Due to injuries and opt outs, Syracuse had no choice but to turn to Tucker as the primary running back.

title: Atholton field hockey beats Hammond to remain undefeated in Division B
excerpt: A roundup of field hockey scores in Howard County on Wednesday, Oct. 6, 2021.
summary: Skip to content The Atholton field hockey team continued its dominance in Howard County's Division B with a 6-0 win over visiting Hammond on Wednesday. Asha Derstine scored a hat trick to lead the undefeated Raiders to their eighth straight victory. Avery Doyle chipped in with two goals, while Bella Konrad scored once and added two assists. The shutout is Atholton's seventh this fall, as the Raiders' defense hasn't given up many shots on cage, and goalie Catherine Steinburg has saved the few that have been allowed.

title: Thomas to IR, Reyes could be 1st Chilean to play in NFL game
excerpt: ASHBURN, Va. (AP) — Sammis Reyes grew up poor as the son of a physical education teacher and insurance adjuster in Chile dreaming of what he could make out of life.When the opportunity presented…
summary: ASHBURN, Va. (AP) — Sammis Reyes grew up poor as the son of a physical education teacher and insurance adjuster in Chile dreaming of what he could make out of life.When the opportunity presented itself as a teenager to play basketball in the United States, his family sent him $50 a month to get by. Reyes did not know a word of English and learned as much as he could from watching 'The Matrix.'Now he's on the verge of making some history. Washington put tight end Logan Thomas on injured reserve Wednesday with a hamstring injury, an absence of at least three games that could open the door for Reyes to become the first Chilean player to appear in an NFL game.

title: Sharks appear to be moving on without Evander Kane, for however long that continues
excerpt: Sharks players and coaches are emphasizing the positive vibe in the room right now, instead of focusing on the Evander Kane situation.
summary: The vibe on Wednesday at Sharks Ice was as upbeat and cheery as it has been since training camp began two weeks ago. There was Erik Karlsson playfully chiding Mario Ferraro after the latter got stung by a puck in an awkward place on his ankle, Nick Bonino dramatically holstering his stick after firing a puck past Alexei Melnichuk and then promptly bear-hugging an unsuspecting Logan Couture from behind, and Ferraro loudly jawing with Brent Burns and Marc-Edouard Vlasic as they all attempted to step through the narrow door leading off the ice at the same time.

title: Braves-Brewers series a test between friends and closers
excerpt: Will Smith picked up a lot in his two-plus seasons with Milwaukee (2014 through the early part of 2016). He returns there a much wiser man Friday, as his Braves mix it up with the Brewers in the first game of their National League Division Series.
summary:
Will Smith picked up a lot in his two-plus seasons with Milwaukee (2014 through the early part of 2016). He returns there a much wiser man Friday, as his Braves mix it up with the Brewers in the first game of their National League Division Series.

And not just about beer, but more so about bearing. Back then, setting up games for renowned closer Francisco Rodriguez, aka K-Rod, Smith watched how even the best had to know how to swallow failure.

'I learned a ton from him,' Smith recalled Wednesday, as the Braves went through a last light workout at home before departing for Milwaukee.

title: Aztecs will see some familiar faces on New Mexico sideline
excerpt: Former SDSU head coach Rocky Long is defensive coordinator for Lobos head coach Danny Gonzales, a former SDSU assistant
summary: New Mexico is on San Diego State's schedule this week, which means former SDSU head coach Rocky Long will be seen on the sidelines for the first time since he 'retired' nearly two years ago as Aztecs head coach.Long's retirement in January 2020 lasted less than a month before New Mexico head coach Danny Gonzales hired his mentor to be the Lobos' defensive coordinator.Gonzales played for Long at New Mexico, coached with him there for a decade and spent another seven years on Long's SDSU coaching staff.

title: Region roundup: High school football schedule shaken up, and more
excerpt: Jefferson Forest's game against Liberty Christian, originally scheduled for Friday, has been postponed "due to a large number of individuals on the JFHS football team being ill," Cavaliers athletic…
summary: Luke Mega and Liam Lovell each scored a goal, Justin Ennis recorded five saves, and the Hornets (6-4-1, 2-1 ODAC) defeated the Maroons (6-3-2, 1-1-1) at Kerr Stadium in Salem.Abbi Leeper had 18 kills, eight digs and two blocks, Mya Green finished with 18 digs and 46 assists, and the Hornets (6-9) defeated the Eagles (12-7) by scores of 25-21, 19-25, 25-15, 25-23 at Turner Gymnasium.Danielle LaRosa had 11 kills and four blocks as the Yellow Jackets (9-4, 4-0 ODAC) swept the WildCats (6-7, 2-2) by scores of 25-13, 25-13, 25-14 at Crenshaw Gymnasium in Ashland.

title: Field hockey: York dominates showdown with Cape Elizabeth
excerpt: The Wildcats strike for three first-half goals and win a clash between the last two unbeaten teams in Class B South, 3-0.
summary:
CAPE ELIZABETH — York High's field hockey team always wears the bull's-eye. 


And the Wildcats continue to wear it well. 


Wednesday evening at Hannaford Field, York took on its latest challenger, Cape Elizabeth, in a battle of undefeated Class B teams. Thanks to a quick start, the Wildcats made another impressive statement. 


First-half goals from Sage Works, Lexi Brent and Ashley LaPierre and a smothering defensive effort led the Wildcats to a 3-0 victory and an 11-0 start to the season. 


'We were up for the challenge,' said York Coach Barb Marois.

(1:47)8:55 PM ETNational Women's Soccer League players engaged in a show of solidarity as play resumed Wednesday night following allegations against a former coach that have rocked the league.Teams stopped play in the sixth minute in recognition of the six years it took for the allegations made by Mana Shim and Sinead Farrelly of sexual coercion and harassment against Paul Riley to come to light.

title: AEW's huge announcement is the TBS championship (Updated)
excerpt: The company has a secondary women's title, named after Dynamite's new home network.
summary:
Tony Khan promised us a 'huge announcement' on Dynamite's Anniversary show from Philadelphia on Oct. 6.
He didn't actually make the announcement himself, instead letting Tony Schiavone handle the honors. After running down AEW's television history, and reminding us that the Wednesday night show is moving to a different channel next year, Schaivone introduced the belt that bears that network's name - the TBS title.
Tony S. then let referee Aubrey Edwards do the honors of unveiling the new women's belt.

title: What Nick Saban said on Wednesday leading up to Texas A&M
excerpt: What Alabama football coach Nick Saban said in his Wednesday press conference leading up to the matchup with Texas A&M.
summary:
No. 1 Alabama is set to travel to College Station this Saturday to take on Jimbo Fisher and the Texas A&M Aggies. The Aggies have lost their last two contests and have been maybe this biggest disappointment in the SEC this season.

Nick Saban held his weekly Wednesday afternoon press conference earlier today and here are some quick hitters from the head coach.

He emphasized how important it was for players to be able to generate their own want-to.

He mentioned that Texas A&M is one of the best teams they have played this season from a personnel standpoint.

title: Nolensville ends Brentwood's eight-year reign as Class AAA champions with 3-0 win
excerpt: Nolensville ended Brentwood's eight-year reign on Class AAA with a sweep on the Lady Bruins' home court in the District 11-AAA semifinals.
summary: Tennessee high school volleyball highlights: Nolensville 3, Brentwood 0Nolensville ended Brentwood's eight-year reign as Class AAA champions with a sweep in the District 11-AAA semifinals.In front of a sea of Nolensville fans decked out in all-black, the Lady Knights were able to do something Wednesday night that no one has been able to do since 2012.The District 11-AAA semifinals pit the two-time defending Class AA champion Lady Knights against eight-time defending Class AAA champion Brentwood on the Lady Bruins home court.

title: Gotham FC, Spirit players pause game in solidarity with soccer players who alleged sexual abuse by coach
excerpt: The players of the National Women's Soccer League are rightfully holding the league accountable.
summary: The players' union has since released a list of eight demands for the league. Those include: voluntary submission of each team's coaches, GM, Board of Governors rep and team owner to the union's independent investigation into abuse conduct; that the league expand the scope of its current investigation to include any NWSL office staff, club or person in a position of power in the league did not investigate abuse concerns raised by any player or staff member at any point.

title: McDaniel tightens hold on Southern's starting QB spot
excerpt: The Southern University starting quarterback job has changed hands, and during last week's open date, Bubba McDaniel tightened his grip on the job.
summary: The Southern University starting quarterback job has changed hands, and during last week's open date, Bubba McDaniel tightened his grip on the job.McDaniel got his second career start in the Jaguars' Southwestern Athletic Conference opener in a 38-25 victory against Mississippi Valley State, and the job is his for the foreseeable future. He'll take the first snaps when Southern plays at Texas Southern in the Arlington Showdown at Arlington Stadium on Saturday at 4 p.m.McDaniel went 18 of 26 for 235 yards and five touchdowns without an interception against MVSU, and his season numbers are 28 of 43, 379 yards and six TDs with no interceptions.

title: BNP Paribas Open: Sloane Stephens pulls out first-round win
excerpt: Wednesday roundup includes women's main draw action and an update on Denis Shapovalov's rapping
summary: American Sloane Stephens, who has reached the highest heights of tennis by winning the U.S. Open in 2017, does not have a history of success in the desert. She has never been part of the final weekend here, her best outing a quarterfinal trip in 2014. Stephens, who has fallen to No. 63 in the world rankings and therefore is not among the seeded players, made a positive first step Wednesday, beating a foe she's had trouble with over the years. Stephens rallied to beat Heather Watson of Great Britain 6-7, 7-5, 6-1, a player she had lost to five times in seven tries before.

excerpt: GODFREY — For much of Wednesday's game against Lincoln Trail College, the LCCC...
summary: GODFREY — For much of Wednesday's game against Lincoln Trail College, the LCCC Trailblazers put on a passing clinic.That is, except for a a few minutes late in the first half when they switched to a scoring clinic. No. 13-ranked LCCC rolled to a 4-1 halftime lead and then played keep-away in the second half in a 4-1 Region 24 victory at LCCC's Tim Rooney Stadium. 'I'll tell you, the way we looked that first 30 minutes passing and for most of the second half, was as good as we've looked moving the ball,' LCCC coach Ryan Hodge said.

excerpt: SRH dent RCB's chance to get top-two finish with upset four-run win
summary: Abu Dhabi, Oct 6 (PTI) Royal Challengers Bangalore made a mess of their run chase as bottom-placed Sunrisers Hyderabad dented their hopes of a top-two finish with a narrow four-run win in a last-over IPL thriller, here on Wednesday.After putting on board a modest 141 for 7, SRH returned to limit RCB to 137 for six for only their third win in the league. Chasing the total, Devdutt Padikkal (41) and Glenn Maxwell (40) scored bulk of the runs but RCB kept losing wickets and faltered in the end.Defending 18 off last two overs, Jason Holder bowled a superb over, giving away just five runs for one wicket.

title: Anshu creates history, becomes first Indian woman wrestler to reach World Ch'ship final
excerpt: Anshu creates history, becomes first Indian woman wrestler to reach World Ch'ship final
summary: Oslo (Norway), Oct 6 (PTI) Anshu Malik on Wednesday created history by becoming the first Indian woman wrestler to reach the World Championship final when she outclassed junior European champion Solomiia Vynnyk but Sarita Mor lost her semifinal and will fight for a bronze here. The 19-year-old Anshu, the reigning Asian champion, controlled the semifinal from the beginning and won by technical superiority in the 57kg category to go into history books. Only four Indian women wrestlers have won medals at the Worlds and all of them -- Geeta Phogat (2012), Babita Phogat (2012), Pooja Dhanda (2018) and Vinesh Phogat (2019) -- have clinched bronze.

title: Baby Finally Went on ‘Masked Singer' to Fool Jenny McCarthy Using British Accent, Operatic Skills
excerpt: And it worked
summary:
(Warning: This post contains spoilers for Wednesday's 'The Masked Singer.')

For once, the answer to 'Who is under the mask?' really was Larry the Cable Guy on this week's 'The Masked Singer,' and yet Jenny McCarthy — the judge who always guess Larry the Cable Guy — didn't have a clue.

Of course, when the 'Blue Collar Comedy Tour' comedian and star of Pixar's 'Cars' films used a fake British accent and his impressive operatic skills to sing 'Meet the Flintstones' to throw McCarthy, Robin Thicke, Nicole Scherzinger and Ken Jeong off, they really didn't have much of a chance at figuring out who tonight's unmasked contestant, Baby, was, did they?

'I kind of figured that I would fool them because when people see me, I'm always doing, the Larry the Cable Guy this, Larry the Cable Guy that, or Mater [from ‘Cars'], because that's what I do,' Larry the Cable Guy, real name Daniel Lawrence Whitney, told TheWrap.

title: ‘The Masked Singer' Reveals Another Contestant: And Baby Is…
excerpt: Five down, 11 to go
summary:
(Warning: This post contains spoilers for Wednesday's 'The Masked Singer.')

Group A hit the stage again on this week's episode of 'The Masked Singer,' with four returning competitors and one new Wildcard. By the end of the night, one of those five — Baby, Bull, Hamster, Skunk and newbie Pepper — was cut and unmasked, with four left standing to continue their journey toward the Golden Mask Trophy.

Wednesday's 'The Masked Singer' featured a house party theme, with contestants bring 'gifts' and 'favors' to host Nick Cannon, as well as judges Robin Thicke, Nicole Scherzinger, Jenny McCarthy and Ken Jeong, to give them a few clues about their true identities.

title: Jim Miller targeted to welcome newcomer Erick Gonzalez at UFC Vegas 40
excerpt: Jim Miller is targeted to make the walk to the octagon for the 38th time next weekend against newcomer Erick Gonzalez at UFC Vegas 40.
summary:
After 37 octagon appearances, Jim Miller is still down to fight absolutely anybody the UFC puts in front of him. 
Multiple people with knowledge of the promotion's plans confirmed to MMA Fighting that a lightweight matchup between Miller and promotional newcomer Erick Gonzalez is being targeted for UFC Vegas 40, which takes place Oct. 16 at the APEX. Verbal agreements are in place with contracts expected to be signed shortly. MMA Junkie was first to report the bout was in the works.
The 38-year-old Miller looks to get back on track after decision losses in back-to-back bouts and three of his last four.

title: Strong earthquake in southwest Pakistan kills at least 11
excerpt: QUETTA, Pakistan (AP) — A powerful 5.7 magnitude earthquake shook parts of southwestern Pakistan early Thursday, killing at least 11 people, a local official said. Suhail Anwar Shaheen, the deputy commissioner of the area, said at least 200 people have been hurt and he expected the death toll to rise. The quake was centered about 14 kilometers (8 miles) north-northeast of Harnai in Baluchistan province, according to the U.S. Geological Survey. It was centered about 20 kilometers (12 miles) below
summary:
QUETTA, Pakistan (AP) — A powerful 5.7 magnitude earthquake shook parts of southwestern Pakistan early Thursday, killing at least 11 people, a local official said.

Suhail Anwar Shaheen, the deputy commissioner of the area, said at least 200 people have been hurt and he expected the death toll to rise.

The quake was centered about 14 kilometers (8 miles) north-northeast of Harnai in Baluchistan province, according to the U.S. Geological Survey. It was centered about 20 kilometers (12 miles) below the surface.

title: Nets might be favorites, but NBA GMs heap plenty of praise on Warriors, Steph Curry
excerpt: The Brooklyn Nets were the darlings of the NBA's annual survey of the general managers,...
summary: The Brooklyn Nets are the preseason darlings of the NBA, with the league's general managers tabbing them as the favorites to win the championship and Kevin Durant and James Harden as the best at their respective positions, but the decision-makers also heaped plenty of praise on the Warriors.In NBA.com's annual survey of the league's 30 general managers released this week, Stephen Curry's name repeatedly came up among the 48 questions, and the Warriors tied with the Lakers for second place among teams most likely to improve from the 2020-21 season — trailing the Chicago Bulls.

title: Kings' Byfield placed on injured reserve with broken ankle
excerpt: LOS ANGELES (AP)Quinton Byfield was placed on injured reserve by the Los Angeles Kings on Wednesday, a day after fracturing his left ankle in a preseason game. Byfield, the second overall pick in t…
summary: Posted: Oct 6, 2021 / 02:59 PM HST / Updated: Oct 6, 2021 / 02:59 PM HST LOS ANGELES (AP)Quinton Byfield was placed on injured reserve by the Los Angeles Kings on Wednesday, a day after fracturing his left ankle in a preseason game. Byfield, the second overall pick in the 2020 NHL draft, was hurt in the third period of the Kings' 4-1 loss to the Arizona Coyotes on Tuesday night. The 19-year old center hit the corner boards awkwardly during a collision with Arizona right wing Christian Fischer. Byfield was unable to put any weight on his left leg and was helped off the ice.

summary: Los Angeles Kings center Quinton Byfield (55) reaches for the puck against the Vegas Golden Knights during the first period of an NHL preseason hockey game Friday, Oct. 1, 2021, in Las Vegas.David Becker/APLOS ANGELES (AP) — Quinton Byfield was placed on injured reserve by the Los Angeles Kings on Wednesday, a day after fracturing his left ankle in a preseason game.Byfield, the second overall pick in the 2020 NHL draft, was hurt in the third period of the Kings' 4-1 loss to the Arizona Coyotes on Tuesday night.

title: Kings' Byfield placed on injured reserve with broken ankle
excerpt: Quinton Byfield was placed on injured reserve by the Los Angeles Kings on Wednesday, a day after fracturing his left ankle in a preseason game. Byfield, the second overall pick in the 2020 NHL draft, was hurt in the third period of the Kings' 4-1 loss to the Arizona Coyotes on Tuesday night. The 19-year old center hit the corner boards awkwardly during a collision with Arizona right wing Christian Fischer.
summary:
Los Angeles Kings center Quinton Byfield (55) reaches for the puck against the Vegas Golden Knights during the first period of an NHL preseason hockey game Friday, Oct. 1, 2021, in Las Vegas. (AP Photo/David Becker)

LOS ANGELES (AP) — Quinton Byfield was placed on injured reserve by the Los Angeles Kings on Wednesday, a day after fracturing his left ankle in a preseason game.

Byfield, the second overall pick in the 2020 NHL draft, was hurt in the third period of the Kings' 4-1 loss to the Arizona Coyotes on Tuesday night.

title: Cardinals vs. Dodgers live score, updates, highlights from the 2021 NL wild-card game
excerpt: Sporting News is tracking live scoring updates and highlights from Cardinals vs. Dodgers in the 2021 MLB postseason. Follow for complete results from the National League wild-card game.
summary:
The Dodgers and Cardinals knew how to finish the season strong.
Los Angeles had been chasing the Giants for most of the final month, and though it settled for the first wild card spot, LA still finished with the second-best win percentage from September till the end of the regular season (.759, just behind San Francisco's .767).
The third-hottest team? That would be the Cardinals, who stunned the baseball world by rattling off a 17-game win streak to salvage what seemed like a lost season and ultimately run away with the second wild card spot behind a .

title: NWSL players stop in 6th minute, link arms during 1st game back since abuse scandal
excerpt: The National Women's Soccer League resumed play Wednesday night with players' minds still on the abuse scandal that is shaking the league to its core. Players across two games — Washington at Gotham and Louisville at North Carolina — stopped playing in the sixth minute to come together at midfield and link arms in a moment of solidarity. The NWSL Players' Association said on Twitter that the sixth minute represents the six years it took for the abuse allegations made by players Sinead Farrelly,
summary:
Washington Spirit and Gotham FC players gather in unity during the sixth minute of their match on Wednesday. (Charles Fox/The Philadelphia Inquirer via AP - image credit)

The National Women's Soccer League resumed play Wednesday night with players' minds still on the abuse scandal that is shaking the league to its core.

Players across two games — Washington at Gotham and Louisville at North Carolina — stopped playing in the sixth minute to come together at midfield and link arms in a moment of solidarity.

title: Chargers' Ekeler looking for another strong game vs. Browns
excerpt: COSTA MESA, Calif. (AP)Austin Ekeler helped more than a few fantasy football players who drafted him this past week. The Los Angeles Chargers running back, who said during training camp that '…
summary: COSTA MESA, Calif. (AP)Austin Ekeler helped more than a few fantasy football players who drafted him this past week. The Los Angeles Chargers running back, who said during training camp that 'if you want to get fantasy points you better have me on your team,' certainly lived up to his end of the bargain Monday night in a 28-14 victory over Las Vegas with a career-high 115 rushing yards and two touchdowns. He is hoping to do the same thing on Sunday when the Chargers host the Cleveland Browns in a matchup of 3-1 teams.
label: sport

title: Liberal MPs scorn National's $250bn plan for taxpayers to underwrite fossil fuels
excerpt: Liberal MPs scorn National's $250bn plan for taxpayers to underwrite fossil fuelsKeith Pitt's proposal suggests huge loans for resources sector in return for his party backing net zeroFollow our live blog for the latest updatesGet our free news app; get our morning email briefing Keith Pitt has suggested that a $250bn loan facility for the resources sector be created in return for the National party's support for a net zero emissions target. Photograph: Reuters
summary:
Photograph: Reuters

A controversial proposal to create a $250bn loan facility for the resources sector in return for National party backing for a net zero emissions target has been met with scorn by metropolitan Liberals.

The resources minister and a senior Nationals MP, Keith Pitt, has proposed that taxpayers underwrite fossil fuel financing and insurance. The proposal was endorsed on Thursday by the current and former leaders of the National party – Barnaby Joyce and Michael McCormack.

But several of the party's Liberal Coalition colleagues spoke out against the move.
label: sport

title: 5 takeaways from Phoenix Suns preseason win over Los Angeles Lakers
excerpt: Chris Paul and Jae Crowder saw their first preseason action in Suns win over the Lakers as Devin Booker missed his second straight preseason game.
summary: The Phoenix Suns evened up their preseason record after topping the Los Angeles Lakers, 117-105, Wednesday afternoon before 12,434 fans at Footprint Center as they led by as many as 31 points.No Devin Booker for a second straight preseason game. No LeBron James or Russell Westbrook either, but the Lakers and Suns will see each other again Sunday in Los Angeles.Maybe all three will suit up for the ESPN game. Probably not, but we'll see.In the meantime, here are five takeaways from Wednesday's game.
label: sport

title: Judge orders Texas to suspend new law banning most abortions
excerpt: AUSTIN, Texas (AP) — A federal judge on Wednesday ordered Texas to suspend the most restrictive abortion law in the U.S., which since September has banned most abortions in the nation's second-most populous state. The order by U.S. District Judge Robert Pitman is the first legal blow to the Texas law known as Senate Bill 8, which until now had withstood a wave of early challenges. In the weeks since the restrictions took effect, Texas abortion providers say the impact has been 'exactly what we f
summary:
AUSTIN, Texas (AP) — A federal judge on Wednesday ordered Texas to suspend the most restrictive abortion law in the U.S., which since September has banned most abortions in the nation's second-most populous state.

The order by U.S. District Judge Robert Pitman is the first legal blow to the Texas law known as Senate Bill 8, which until now had withstood a wave of early challenges. In the weeks since the restrictions took effect, Texas abortion providers say the impact has been 'exactly what we feared.
label: sport

title: Festival headlined by Kahnawake talent takes to stage in at Royal Theatre Thousand Islands
excerpt: Local talent will headline an upcoming weekend performing-arts festival that promises to have a little something Indigenous for everyone, including a live presentation of ‘Beans,' three live performances and a ceremony on Sunday – and all of it just a hop, skip and a jump down the 401 in Gananoque. The First Peoples Performing Arts Festival is slated for Octiber 15-17 at the Royal Theatre Thousand Islands in Gananoque, Ont. The theatre was co-founded by Kahnawa'kehró:non Kevin John Saylor. This
summary:
Local talent will headline an upcoming weekend performing-arts festival that promises to have a little something Indigenous for everyone, including a live presentation of ‘Beans,' three live performances and a ceremony on Sunday – and all of it just a hop, skip and a jump down the 401 in Gananoque.

The First Peoples Performing Arts Festival is slated for Octiber 15-17 at the Royal Theatre Thousand Islands in Gananoque, Ont. The theatre was co-founded by Kahnawa'kehró:non Kevin John Saylor. This marks the fifth annual edition of the festival – and after last year's online version, Saylor isn't sure what to expect.
label: sport

title: Chargers' Ekeler looking for another strong game vs. Browns
excerpt: Austin Ekeler helped more than a few fantasy football players who drafted him this past week
summary: COSTA MESA, Calif. — Austin Ekeler helped more than a few fantasy football players who drafted him this past week.The Los Angeles Chargers running back, who said during training camp that 'if you want to get fantasy points you better have me on your team,' certainly lived up to his end of the bargain Monday night in a 28-14 victory over Las Vegas with a career-high 115 rushing yards and two touchdowns.He is hoping to do the same thing on Sunday when the Chargers host the Cleveland Browns in a matchup of 3-1 teams.
label: sport

title: Barnaby Joyce urges crackdown on social media misinformation as defamation changes mooted
excerpt: Barnaby Joyce urges crackdown on social media misinformation as defamation changes mootedAustralia's deputy PM says internet giants ‘make billions' but ‘don't own responsibility for what's happening on their platforms' Get our free news app;get our morning email briefing Australia's deputy PM Barnaby Joyce calls for crackdown on misinformation on social media. Photograph: Mike Bowers/The Guardian
summary:
Photograph: Mike Bowers/The Guardian

Barnaby Joyce has called for a crackdown on social media misinformation at the same time the federal attorney general is canvassing legal changes to reduce internet giants' and publishers' liability for comments on social media posts.

On Thursday the deputy prime minister said it was 'absolutely essential' to do more to crack down on misinformation, suggesting he will seek input into US congressional hearings into social media giants and lobby against user anonymity.
label: sport

title: Justin Timberlake and Jessica Biel Selling Hollywood Hills Home for $35 Million: 'They're Rarely in L.A.'
excerpt: "They're rarely in L.A. and are happy to live in Montana," a source tells PEOPLE of the couple
summary:
Justin Timberlake, Jessica Biel

Bertrand Rindoff Petroff/Getty Images Justin Timberlake and Jessica Biel

Justin Timberlake and Jessica Biel are ready to say goodbye to Southern California and make Big Sky country their permanent home.

The couple are selling their Hollywood Hills mansion in Los Angeles for $35 million, the Wall Street Journal reports. The listing is being handled by Justin Paul Huchel and Drew Fenton of Hilton & Hyland.

A source tells PEOPLE that the sale is a result of Timberlake, 40, and Biel, 39, spending less time in Los Angeles and more time at their home in Montana.
label: sport

title: NASA Will Test 'Planetary Defense' System by Shooting a Rocket at an Asteroid
excerpt: The launch will take place on Nov. 23 with live coverage airing on NASA's app and website
summary:
Asteroid

QAI Publishing/UIG via Getty

NASA is getting ready to kick the asteroid of any space rock that comes close to Earth.

The space agency announced Tuesday it is officially moving forward with a trial run of its Double Asteroid Redirection Test, marking the first demonstration of the "kinetic impactor technique" in which one or more large, high-speed spacecraft are sent into the path of an asteroid to change its motion, NASA explained.

The agency's target is Dimorphos, a 525-foot long moon orbiting the much larger asteroid Didymos.
label: sport

title: Oil spill off California coast is dispersing, amount unclear
excerpt: LONG BEACH, Calif. (AP) — Some of the crude oil that spilled from a pipeline into the waters off Southern California has been breaking up naturally in ocean currents, a Coast Guard official said Wednesday as authorities sought to determine the scope of the damage. Coast Guard Petty Officer Steve Strohmaier said some of the oil has been pushed to the south by currents. Storms earlier in the week may also have helped disperse the oil, which he said could make it more challenging to skim as it spre
summary:
LONG BEACH, Calif. (AP) — Some of the crude oil that spilled from a pipeline into the waters off Southern California has been breaking up naturally in ocean currents, a Coast Guard official said Wednesday as authorities sought to determine the scope of the damage.

Coast Guard Petty Officer Steve Strohmaier said some of the oil has been pushed to the south by currents. Storms earlier in the week may also have helped disperse the oil, which he said could make it more challenging to skim as it spreads out.

LONG BEACH, Calif. (AP) — Some of the crude oil that spilled from a pipeline into the waters off Southern California has been breaking up naturally in ocean currents, a Coast Guard official said Wednesday as authorities sought to determine the scope of the damage.

Coast Guard Petty Officer Steve Strohmaier said some of the oil has been pushed to the south by currents. Storms earlier in the week may also have helped disperse the oil, which he said could make it more challenging to skim as it spreads out.

title: Nawab Malik trying to change narrative at someone's behest by bringing BJP's name, says Fadnavis on cruise party case
excerpt: Mumbai (Maharashtra) [India], October 7 (ANI): Responding to the NCP's leader Nawab Malik allegations on Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) regarding the cruise party case, BJP leader Devendra Fadnavis on Wednesday said that Malik is trying to change the narrative at someone's behest by bringing in the party's name.
summary:
BJP leader Devendra Fadnavis (Photo/ANI)

Mumbai (Maharashtra) [India], October 7 (ANI): Responding to the NCP's leader Nawab Malik allegations on Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) regarding the cruise party case, BJP leader Devendra Fadnavis on Wednesday said that Malik is trying to change the narrative at someone's behest by bringing in the party's name.

Earlier on Wednesday, Maharashtra Cabinet Minister and the Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) leader Nawab Malik alleged that Narcotics Control Bureau raid onboard a Mumbai cruise was "forgery", and Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) has misused the central agency to frame Aryan Khan.
label: sport

title: Vice President urges people to promote, buy Indian handicrafts and handlooms
excerpt: Agartala (Tripura) [India], October 7 (ANI): Vice President M Venkaiah Naidu on Thursday called upon the people, particularly youngsters, to buy and promote Indian handicrafts, handlooms, Khadi and other products made by artisans instead of foreign items.
summary:
Vice President Venkaiah Naidu

Agartala (Tripura) [India], October 7 (ANI): Vice President M Venkaiah Naidu on Thursday called upon the people, particularly youngsters, to buy and promote Indian handicrafts, handlooms, Khadi and other products made by artisans instead of foreign items.

The Vice President, who is on a tour of the north-eastern states, inaugurated an exhibition of handloom and handicraft products, went around the stalls and interacted with artisans, weavers and others at Agartala, Tripura, stated a press statement from Vice President's Secretariat.
label: sport

title: Fans in certain seats at Hornets games must be vaccinated. Here's what you should know
excerpt: Special requirements headline new game-day information announced by the Hornets prior to hosting Memphis on Thursday.
summary:
If you're attending a Charlotte Hornets home game this season and are going to sit anywhere near the court, prepare to provide proof of full vaccination or a negative COVID-19 test result from a PCR test sample.

That major change headlines the team's game-day information for fans announced on Wednesday, a day before the Hornets host Memphis in a preseason matchup at Spectrum Center.

According to protocols instituted by the NBA, all fans seated within 15 feet of the court or the player benches have to be either fully vaccinated or must provide proof of a negative COVID-19 test result taken from a PCR test sample within 48 hours prior to the game.
label: sport

title: NYRA hearing on embattled trainer Bob Baffert looming
excerpt: Thoroughbred horse trainer Bob Baffert will have to face an administrative hearing scheduled for Monday by the New York Racing Association to address his suspension.
summary:
Embattled thoroughbred horse trainer Bob Baffert Bob Baffert will have to face an administrative hearing scheduled for Monday by the New York Racing Association to address his suspension.

Brooklyn Judge Carol Bagley Amon of the Eastern District of New York ruled Tuesday that a hearing was required for Baffert to challenge NYRA's suspension, which was issued in mid-May without a hearing three weeks before the Belmont Stakes.

'We are gratified by the court's decision,' Patrick McKenna, senior director of communications for NYRA, said in a statement Wednesday.
label: sport

title: Without Neymar, Brazil tests its options against Venezuela
excerpt: Not having star playmaker Neymar or midfielder Casemiro available for selection will allow Brazil coach Tite to experiment with his lineup in Thursday's World Cup qualifying match at Venezuela.
summary:
PSG's Neymar looks aside during the Champions League Group A soccer match between Paris Saint-Germain and Manchester City at the Parc des Princes in Paris, Tuesday, Sept. 28, 2021. (AP Photo/Christophe Ena) AP

Not having star playmaker Neymar or midfielder Casemiro available for selection will allow Brazil coach Tite to experiment with his lineup in Thursday's World Cup qualifier at Venezuela.

Neymar is serving a suspension after picking up two yellow cards in Brazil's game against Peru last month and Casemiro has a tooth infection.
label: sport

title: Cardinals second-string OL Max Garcia nearly retired this year before given starting role
excerpt: The Arizona Cardinals' second-string OL Max Garcia almost retired before earning starting spot.
summary: Max Garcia had a grin like the Cheshire Cat from "Alice in Wonderland" when he walked in and spoke to reporters during the Arizona Cardinals' Wednesday morning news conference.In his first time speaking in a Cardinals' post-practice media scrum, the veteran offensive lineman discussed his first start for the NFL's lone undefeated team (4-0) after they beat the Los Angeles Rams 37-20 last Sunday for first place in the NFC West."Last week was kind of just that next step that I was looking to take in ever since my injury.

title: Downtown social issues, crime priority for Edmonton police, McFee says
excerpt: Edmonton's newly elected council can expect more advocacy from the city's police service on tackling social issues and crime downtown, says police Chief Dale McFee. The Edmonton Police Service has been an advocate for the vulnerable for the last two-and-a-half years, while being "relentless" on crime, such as gun crime, he told reporters Wednesday. "We will continue to be relentless on both. We're not going away. We're not going to be told that we don't belong in this space because we absolutely
summary:
Edmonton police chief Dale McFee says EPS is committed to addressing social disorder and crime downtown. (Craig Ryan/CBC - image credit)

Edmonton's newly elected council can expect more advocacy from the city's police service on tackling social issues and crime downtown, says police Chief Dale McFee.

The Edmonton Police Service has been an advocate for the vulnerable for the last two-and-a-half years, while being "relentless" on crime, such as gun crime, he told reporters Wednesday.

"We will continue to be relentless on both.

title: Kamloops council approves new film permit bylaw as production increases
excerpt: The City of Kamloops has approved a new bylaw on Tuesday to help manage film productions around city limits following an increase in projects around the region. According to the Thompson-Nicola Regional District film commissioner, the film industry has been steadily growing in Kamloops, with 2021 seeing the most film productions ever in the city. "This year alone there were five productions," Victoria Weller said on CBC's Daybreak Kamloops. Under the new bylaw, film companies will need to pay $1
summary:
The film industry has been steadily growing in Kamloops, with the year 2021 seeing the most number of film productions ever in the city. (Shutterstock / Virrage Images - image credit)

The City of Kamloops has approved a new bylaw on Tuesday to help manage film productions around city limits following an increase in projects around the region.

According to the Thompson-Nicola Regional District film commissioner, the film industry has been steadily growing in Kamloops, with 2021 seeing the most film productions ever in the city.

title: Nine Oregon True Freshmen Won't Redshirt in 2021, Why it's a Mixed Bag
excerpt: Oregon's youth continues to be tested early in their college careers
summary: Last week, we wrote a piece on the Ducks' freshmen who were closing in on skipping a potential redshirt season if they played on Saturday against Stanford. You can check that story out here.All nine of those players played on Saturday and have avoided using a redshirt season in their true freshmen seasons, as players are allowed to play a maximum of four games in a season and still be able to redshirt. The Ducks' coaching staff has done a great job developing talent and getting players prepared to see immediate playing time as true freshmen, especially those that didn't enroll early.

title: Trilogy International Partners Inc. Comments on Trading Activity
excerpt: BELLEVUE, WA / ACCESSWIRE / October 6, 2021 / Trilogy International Partners Inc.") (TSX:TRL), an international wireless and fixed broadband telecommunications operator, is issuing this press release in response to a request from the Investment Industry Regulatory Organization of Canada ("IIROC") to comment on the recent trading activity of its stock.
summary:
BELLEVUE, WA / ACCESSWIRE / October 6, 2021 / Trilogy International Partners Inc. ("TIP Inc.") (TSX:TRL), an international wireless and fixed broadband telecommunications operator, is issuing this press release in response to a request from the Investment Industry Regulatory Organization of Canada ("IIROC") to comment on the recent trading activity of its stock.

TIP Inc. has announced today that it has paused activity on an initial public offering of the shares of Two Degrees Group Limited ("TDGL"), its New Zealand subsidiary offering mobile and broadband communications services, in order to consider a possible alternative transaction with another party.

title: What we've learned about the Seattle Kraken
excerpt: The Seattle Kraken played their final preseason game on Tuesday. Before the regular season begins, here are three takeaways from the preseason and training camp.
summary:
The Seattle Kraken wrapped up the preseason with a 4-0 victory over the Vancouver Canucks on Wednesday. Next time the Kraken take the ice, it will be for real.

So as Seattle prepares to open its inaugural regular season, here are three takeaways from its six preseason games and training camp so far.

1. Vince Dunn is a player to watch

Defenseman Vince Dunn scored three goals in his final two preseason games, including twice in Tuesday's win over the Vancouver Canucks. He scored the first goal of the game on a power play.

title: Los Angeles OKs one of strictest US vaccination mandates
excerpt: LOS ANGELES (AP) — Los Angeles leaders on Wednesday approved one of the nation's strictest vaccine mandates — a sweeping measure that requires the shots for everyone entering bars, restaurants, nail salons, gyms or even a Lakers game. The City Council voted 11-2 in favor of the ordinance that will require proof of full vaccination for patrons and workers starting Nov. 4. Mayor Eric Garcetti signed it Wednesday afternoon. 'Vaccinating more Angelenos is our only way out of this pandemic, and we mu
summary:
LOS ANGELES (AP) — Los Angeles leaders on Wednesday approved one of the nation's strictest vaccine mandates — a sweeping measure that requires the shots for everyone entering bars, restaurants, nail salons, gyms or even a Lakers game.

The City Council voted 11-2 in favor of the ordinance that will require proof of full vaccination for patrons and workers starting Nov. 4.

Mayor Eric Garcetti signed it Wednesday afternoon.

'Vaccinating more Angelenos is our only way out of this pandemic, and we must do everything in our power to keep pushing those numbers up,' Garcetti said in a statement.
label: sport

title: Ada County officials say vegetation fire burning east of Idaho 55, north of Eagle
excerpt: The fire was reported just before 5 p.m. on Wednesday.
summary:
This is a breaking news story. Check back to idahostatesman.com for updates.

To sign up for breaking news alerts, click here.

A vegetation fire is burning just east of Idaho 55 and north of Eagle, according to Ada County Dispatch.

The blaze was reported just before 5 p.m. on Wednesday and is burning in grass and vegetation north of the Eagle Skate Park, according to dispatch.

The cause and size of the fire are unknown. The Eagle Fire Department is on the scene.

title: JaVale McGee with an assist vs the Los Angeles Lakers
excerpt: JaVale McGee (Phoenix Suns) with an assist vs the Los Angeles Lakers, 10/06/2021
summary:
The Canadian Press

Nike has voted down proposals by outside shareholder groups that it provide more transparency on pay equity, hiring along gender and racial lines and human rights impact assessments, because the company believes it is making progress on its homegrown diversity and inclusion initiatives.

Meghan Trainor is setting the record straight about her side-by-side toilets.

After sharing this week that her new home with husband Daryl Sabara has two toilets right next to each other, the "All About That Bass" singer tweeted on Wednesday that she wanted "to clear things up" about the set up.

Byfield has been placed on injured reserve and will be re-evaluated in the coming weeks.

After receiving attention from a trainer, he was helped off by teammates, appearing unable to put weight on his left leg while leaving at 2:18 of the third period.

title: Epic rains wash uncollected trash onto beaches in major French city
excerpt: Parts of the country's southeast saw two months' worth of rain in just two days.
summary:
Epic rains wash uncollected trash onto beaches in major French city

There's never a 'good' time to receive months' worth of rain in just a couple of days, but the timing of a recent deluge in France was doubly unfortunate.

Between Sunday and Monday, parts of southeastern France were slammed by storms that dumped 100-150 mm of rain on the region, with locally higher amounts. For some cities, that amounted to two months' worth of rain over the course of just two days.

The result, understandably, was flash-flooding, which was so severe in the city of Aix-en-Provence that many residents were ordered to stay home, and some water rescues had to be carried out.

title: Caltrans closing three Northern California mountain passes as winter storm moves in
excerpt: The Sierra Nevada roads could reopen Saturday.
summary:
Caltrans crews are going to temporarily close three Sierra Nevada mountain passes for at least two days starting Thursday afternoon as a winter storm moves through Northern California and drops some snow in the higher elevations.

At noon on Thursday, road crews will close Ebbetts Pass on Highway 4 and Sonora Pass on Highway 108, Caltrans District 10 announced on its Twitter page Wednesday morning. Crews will close Monitor Pass on Highway 89 at 2 p.m. Thursday.

Caltrans officials said the closures were necessary to ensure motorist safety in advance of the storm, and they will consider reopening the mountain passes after reevaluating weather and road conditions on Saturday.

NATIONS LEAGUE

Two of the European Championship's biggest disappointments face each other in the Nations League semifinals in Turin as world champion France takes on top-ranked Belgium. France was one of the favorites to win Euro 2020 but lost to Switzerland on penalties in the round of 16 — having led 3-1 with 15 minutes remaining. Belgium went out at the quarterfinal stage to eventual champion Italy. Belgium will also have revenge on its mind as the last time it met France was in the semifinals of the 2018 World Cup, when Roberto Martínez's side lost 1-0.

summary: GREEN BAY, Wis. — The Green Bay Packers continue to consult with specialists on 2020 Pro Bowl cornerback Jaire Alexander's injured shoulder in hopes of avoiding season-ending surgery.'We're going to try to avoid that at all costs,' coach Matt LaFleur said after Wednesday's practice.It was a whirlwind of a day for the Packers, winners of three straight headed into Sunday's game at the Cincinnati Bengals. First, with Alexander's season in limbo, the team reportedly had interest, but failed to acquire two-time All-Pro cornerback Stephon Gilmore from the New England Patriots.

title: TreVeyon Henderson added to Maxwell Award watch list
excerpt: The first of many recognitions for running back TreVeyon Henderson no doubt.
summary:
Ohio State running back TreVeyon Henderson is starting to turn some heads with what he's been able to do as a freshman in Columbus. Things started out somewhat slow with Henderson splitting carries with Miyan Williams and Master Teague, but now he looks to be option No. 1 in the backfield and he has not disappointing.

In fact, Henderson is third in rushing yards in the Big Ten with far fewer carries. He has only rushed the ball 54 times, but gained 510 yards on the ground, a whopping 9.4 yards per carry average that ranks second for all players in the FBS with at least 50 rushing attempts.

title: Here's next deal Panthers must make after acquiring Gilmore
excerpt: The Carolina Panthers acquired Stephon Gilmore from the New England Patriots Wednesday. But now it's time to make another trade for Panthers GM Scott Fitterer.
summary:
Stephon Gilmore, from Rock Hill, S.C., was named The Associated Press 2019 NFL Defensive Player of the Year. But he had an injury-plagued 2020 season. The Panthers acquired him for a future sixth-round draft pick Wednesday. AP

With the deal for New England cornerback Stephon Gilmore, Carolina Panthers general manager Scott Fitterer has made a staggering 13 trades since he was hired in January.

From 2018-20, under former GM Marty Hurney, the Panthers made a total of 11 deals combined. So Trader Scott has closed more deals in nine months than the Panthers did over the previous three years.

title: Deontay Wilder stands by Tyson Fury cheating claims at press conference
excerpt: Wilder said he's seeking 'retribution' and doubled down on his claims that Fury cheated during the second fight by stuffing his gloves and spiking his water.
summary:
The playful trash talk turned personal Wednesday afternoon at MGM Grand Garden as WBC heavyweight champion Tyson Fury and Deontay Wilder concluded their final press conference.
The rhythmic call and response morphed into nearly four minutes of unabashed cursing, yelling and arguing.
But before they could meet in the center of the makeshift stage for the customary face-off at promotions of this magnitude, Bob Arum intervened — jumping from his front-row seat to demand it wouldn't happen.
'It's still a sport.

title: Christian Wilkins is wreaking havoc, like Dolphins always hoped
excerpt: Christian Wilkins already has 23 tackles and 4 tackles for loss for Fins
summary: MIAMI GARDENS — This is the Christian Wilkins the Dolphins envisioned when they drafted him with the 18th overall pick of the 2019 NFL Draft.This is Wilkins powering past offensive linemen and hitting quarterbacks and dropping running backs for a tackle for loss.This is Wilkins, making a noticeable impact over the Dolphins' first four games."Christian is doing a good job of film study," Dolphins defensive coordinator Josh Boyer said this week. "I think he's doing a better job with his fundamentals and technique.

title: Indians' Francona confident he'll return as manager in 2022
excerpt: Francona was forced to step away from the club in late July to undergo hip replacement surgery as well as a procedure on a big toe that was partially removed last winter after it became infected.
summary: CLEVELAND (AP) — Indians manager Terry Francona is confident he'll return next season after missing most of the past two because of serious health issues.Francona was forced to step away from the club in late July to undergo hip replacement surgery as well as a procedure on a big toe that was partially removed last winter after it became infected.The 62-year-old remains on crutches and has an important medical checkup scheduled for next week. Francona said the visit could determine whether he's able to return to managing the way he wants.

title: Saints seek to ramp up pass rush vs. Washington, Heinicke
excerpt: Saints defensive end Cameron Jordan figures he and the rest of New Orleans' defensive front should disrupt quarterbacks more than they have lately.
summary:
New England Patriots running back James White, center, scrambles past New Orleans Saints defensive end Cameron Jordan (94) during the first half of an NFL football game, Sunday, Sept. 26, 2021, in Foxborough, Mass. (AP Photo/Steven Senne) AP

Saints defensive end Cameron Jordan figures he and the rest of New Orleans' defensive front can, and should, disrupt quarterbacks more than they have lately.

Jordan doesn't have a sack through the first four games of 2021 after taking down quarterbacks 48 times during the previous four seasons.

title: Cody Parkey signs deal with New Orleans Saints
excerpt: Cody Parkey is getting another shot in the NFL.
summary:
Cody Parkey is back in the NFL.

Parkey, who played at Auburn from 2010-13, signed a deal with New Orleans on Tuesday, per NFL Network's Ian Rapoport. The move comes after the Saints released Aldrick Rosas.

Parkey was a free agent after being released by the Cleveland Browns back in August. He was on the injured reserve after suffering a quad injury.

This will be Parkey's eight seasons in the NFL, he has played for the Philadelphia Eagles (2014-15), Cleveland Browns (2016 and 2020), Miami Dolphins (2017), Chicago Bears (2018), and Tennessee Titans (2019).
label: sport

title: Parkland, Moravian Academy both advance two to District 11 girls tennis singles semifinals
excerpt: Parkland and Moravian Academy will be well-represented in Thursday's District 11 girls tennis singles tournament semifinals.
summary: Skip to content The Parkland and Moravian Academy tennis teams continued their dynamic play, this time in Wednesday afternoon's District 11 singles opening rounds at Lehigh University. Both teams advanced two players to Thursday's semifinal round, and had a third player within a set of the final four. In 3A, the Trojans' No. 3 seed, Erin Joo, easily won her first two matches, dropping just one game combined against Nazareth's Jessica Rodriguez (first round) and Emmaus's Jocelyn Chow (quarterfinals).
label: sport

title: Hawkeyes Focused on Preparation, Not Hype
excerpt: No. 3 Iowa Avoiding Distractions with No. 4 Penn State Coming to Town
summary: IOWA CITY, Iowa - Kirk Ferentz has coached 200 games at Kinnick Stadium, but there's one game that stands out. No. 1 Iowa 12, No. 2 Michigan 10. October 19, 1985. 'I'll remember that as long as I live, just because of the environment that day,' said Ferentz, Iowa's offensive line coach that day. 'Not everybody gets that chance.' But here we go again. No. 4 Penn State comes to Kinnick Stadium to face No. 3 Iowa Saturday. It will be an electric atmosphere, like it was in 1985. It will be witnessed by a sellout crowd and a national television audience.

title: Cowboys' Collins sues NFL, seeks injunction over suspension
excerpt: FRISCO, Texas (AP)Suspended Dallas offensive lineman La'el Collins sued the NFL and Commissioner Roger Goodell on Wednesday, seeking an injunction to stop the remaining two games of a five-ga…
summary: FRISCO, Texas (AP)Suspended Dallas offensive lineman La'el Collins sued the NFL and Commissioner Roger Goodell on Wednesday, seeking an injunction to stop the remaining two games of a five-game ban over substance-abuse violations. Lawyers for Collins filed the lawsuit in Collin County, the location of the team's headquarters north of Dallas. The suit claims the NFL suspended the seventh-year player for missed tests when the labor agreement reached in 2020 no longer allowed for suspensions over missed tests or positive marijuana tests.

title: Cowboys' Collins sues NFL, seeks injunction over suspension
excerpt: Suspended Dallas offensive lineman La'el Collins has sued the NFL and Commissioner Roger Goodell over his five-game suspension for violating the league's substance-abuse policy
summary: FRISCO, Texas — Suspended Dallas offensive lineman La'el Collins sued the NFL and Commissioner Roger Goodell on Wednesday, seeking an injunction to stop the remaining two games of a five-game ban over substance-abuse violations. Support our journalism. Subscribe today Lawyers for Collins filed the lawsuit in Collin County, the location of the team's headquarters north of Dallas. The suit claims the NFL suspended the seventh-year player for missed tests when the labor agreement reached in 2020 no longer allowed for suspensions over missed tests or positive marijuana tests.

title: Texas lands huge commitment from four-star wide receiver Brenen Thompson
excerpt: Boom! Texas lands its highest-rated commitment from Brenen Thompson.
summary:
Wide receiver has been a major hole in Texas' 2022 class for some time. Having four-star Armani Winfield on board was a great start under Steve Sarkisian but it's been nine months since his commitment.

Speed was the element missing from the class. Winfield is a great receiver prospect but is missing an absolute barnburner to pair alongside true freshman Xavier Worthy.

On Wednesday, Andre Coleman was able to lock down the first speedster at wide receiver in the Longhorns' 2022 class.

Four-star Brenen Thompson announced his commitment to Texas on Wednesday via CBS Sports Live.

excerpt: FRISCO, Texas (AP) — Suspended Dallas offensive lineman La'el Collins sued the NFL and...
summary: FRISCO, Texas (AP) — Suspended Dallas offensive lineman La'el Collins sued the NFL and Commissioner Roger Goodell on Wednesday, seeking an injunction to stop the remaining two games of a five-game ban over substance-abuse violations.Lawyers for Collins filed the lawsuit in Collin County, the location of the team's headquarters north of Dallas. The suit claims the NFL suspended the seventh-year player for missed tests when the labor agreement reached in 2020 no longer allowed for suspensions over missed tests or positive marijuana tests.

title: Texas beats out Texas A&M, Oklahoma State for 4-star receiver Brenen Thompson
excerpt: First-year Texas head coach Steve Sarkisian added a key piece at a position of need when Brenen Thompson, a four-star wide receiver from Spearman, Texas, committed to the in-state Longhorns on…
summary:
First-year Texas head coach Steve Sarkisian added a key piece at a position of need when Brenen Thompson, a four-star wide receiver from Spearman, Texas, committed to the in-state Longhorns on Wednesday.

Thompson, rated the No. 87 prospect nationally and the No. 11 wide receiver in the 247Sports Composite Rating, picked Texas over Oklahoma State and Texas A&M. He is currently the lone top-100 prospect in Texas' 2022 class, which ranks second in the nation and first in the Big 12. The Horns previously had three top-100 players in their class, but wide receiver Evan Stewart decommitted in March and safety Bryan Allen Jr.
label: sport

title: SPOTTED: Colonie volleyball Pinks out the Gym and sweeps Bethlehem in three sets
excerpt: COLONIE — The Garnet Raiders Pinked Out the Gym on Tuesday, Oct. 5, and then proceeded to sweep Bethlehem in three sets. The annual Pink Out the Gym is a fundraiser held by the school and the volleyball programs to benefit ongoing efforts to raise awareness of breast cancer. The boys volleyball team will Pink…
summary:
COLONIE — The Garnet Raiders Pinked Out the Gym on Tuesday, Oct. 5, and then proceeded to sweep Bethlehem in three sets.

The annual Pink Out the Gym is a fundraiser held by the school and the volleyball programs to benefit ongoing efforts to raise awareness of breast cancer. The boys volleyball team will Pink out the Gym against Shenendehowa on Wednesday, Oct. 13.

Against Bethlehem, Colonie won the first set 25-13, the second 25-19 and the third 25-22.

For the Raiders, Shannon Coyle recorded 17 kills, Macie Trimarchi had seven kills and three blocks and Gabby Martin had nine kills.

title: Familiar foes Red Sox, Rays duke it out in ALDS
excerpt: The Tampa Bay Rays will seek to recapture last year's postseason buzz as they open their American League Division Series against the AL East rival Boston Red Sox on Thursday night in St. Pete…
summary: The Tampa Bay Rays will seek to recapture last year's postseason buzz as they open their American League Division Series against the AL East rival Boston Red Sox on Thursday night in St. Petersburg, Fla. Last season, the Rays secured their first AL pennant since 2008 to set up a World Series matchup with the Los Angeles Dodgers. The Rays pushed the Dodgers to six games before ultimately falling short of their first title in franchise history. One year later, Tampa Bay is again in good position to make a deep postseason run.

title: Zed Key: Ohio State technician on and off the court
excerpt: COLUMBUS, Ohio (WCMH) — It's a Tuesday afternoon, and outside the The Schottenstein Center three Ohio State men's basketball players are surrounding a dark red truck. One, Justin Ahrens, is sitting…
summary: COLUMBUS, Ohio (WCMH) — It's a Tuesday afternoon, and outside the The Schottenstein Center three Ohio State men's basketball players are surrounding a dark red truck. One, Justin Ahrens, is sitting in the passenger seat staring at his phone. A second, Kyle Young, the car owner, is standing with his arms resting on the covered truck bed occasionally looking at his phone, and at other times looking up to check in on what's happening in the driver's seat. And right there sits the third teammate, Zed Key, assessing a situation with the driver's side window.

He was named Academic All-State as a wide receiver last season, is a member of the National Society of High School Scholars and is a Knight Award winner. He also performs community service at The Children's Hospital of San Antonio. Marcos maintains a 3.7 GPA and plans to play collegiate football and major in business.

summary:
"Thursday Night Football" has been exciting for a majority of the 2021 NFL season. It looks like the Week 5 matchup will be a strong one as well.
This week's matchup features two teams from what is arguably the strongest division: the NFC West. Each team played a divisional opponent last week with the visitor losing by 17 points in a surprise blowout and the home team earning a crucial win over one of its long-time rivals.
The game will take place in Seattle, as the Seahawks will return home after playing the 49ers on the road last week.

The Dolphins have played without defensive tackle Raekwon Davis the past three games. He is moving closer to a return.

The Dolphins designated Davis to return from injured reserve Wednesday.

He went on injured reserve Sept. 14 with a knee injury. Davis was injured in the season opener against the Patriots, playing only five snaps.

Davis, a second-year player out of Alabama, appeared in all 16 games for Miami in 2020 with 12 starts.

title: Toledo Speedway set for USAC Silver Crown finale on Sunday
excerpt: The race will offer high drama as it's the final race of the season and two drivers are separated by just a single point in the standings.
summary: TOLEDO, Ohio — Toledo Speedway is getting set for the final race of the year and it's a big one. The USAC Silver Crown Series is in town for the Hemelgarn Racing/Super Fitness Rollie Beale Classic. It is expected to be a high drama race because two drivers, Kody Swanson and Logan Seavey are vying for the season title while only being separated by just a single point. Swanson has owned this series over the years and is very comfortable with the track at Toledo Speedway. He's won the Rollie Beale Classic four different times, including the 2019 race here in the Glass City.

title: Video: Robbie Lawler checks on Nick Diaz in heartfelt moment after battle at UFC 266
excerpt: Robbie Lawler was seconds removed from a win at UFC 266 but his main concern was checking on opponent Nick Diaz to make sure he was doing OK in both his personal and professional life.
summary:
Robbie Lawler was happy with his win at UFC 266, but his main concern after earning a third-round TKO stoppage was to check on his opponent Nick Diaz.
In a moment captured for the UFC's Thrill and the Agony series, Lawler hugged Diaz after the fight then showed genuine concern regarding his well-being — both in and out of the octagon.
'Are you good in life?' Lawler said when speaking to Diaz. 'That's f*cking different. Let's f*cking get there. You know what I'm saying?'
Prior to their rematch, which took place 17 years after the initial meeting, Diaz had made numerous statements about how much he doesn't enjoy fighting and expressed confusion over why the UFC booked his rematch with Lawler.

title: SPORTSLINE PLAYER OF THE WEEK: Liberty DE Lester Jones
excerpt: The Week 5 Sportsline Player of the Week is Liberty Patriots standout defensive end Lester Jones, who played a vital role in engineering a huge comeback victory against Istrouma.
summary: BATON ROUGE, La. (WAFB) - The Week 5 Sportsline Player of the Week is Liberty Patriots standout defensive end Lester Jones, who played a vital role in engineering a huge comeback victory against Istrouma. The Patriots trailed 27-7 in the first half but roared back for the 34-27 victory. The rally included a blocked punt early in the third quarter by Jones. His teammate, Bryson Jones, then returned it 17 yards for a touchdown. Lester Jones went on to make a whopping 13 tackles and recorded two quarterback sacks.

summary:

Photo by Robert Cohen, rcohen@post-dispatch.com Robert Cohen 
The 2021 NHL season was weird by any standard, but for Blues defenseman Steven Santini, it had some very unexpected twists and turns.Santini, signed as a depth player prior to the season, played just three games in the regular season for the Blues but played in two of their four playoff games after Justin Faulk, Robert Bortuzzo, Vince Dunn and Jake Walman were all out of the lineup with injuries in the postseason.

title: Craig Counsell recalls his interactions with Henry Aaron and says the late home run king would have loved seeing Brewers vs. Braves in NLDS

summary: As devastating as it was to lose the great Henry Aaron earlier this year at age 86, it's additionally sad that he did not live to see the Atlanta Braves and MIlwaukee Brewers meet for the first time in postseason play.Aaron's legendary career began with the Braves in 1954 when they played in Milwaukee, and he came full circle by playing his last two seasons with the Brewers in 1975-76.'This would have been Henry's series for sure,' Brewers manager Craig Counsell said Wednesday.Asked if he had any memorable interactions with Aaron, who often visited Milwaukee for various events, including fundraisers for his 'Chasing The Dream Foundation, Counsell said, 'Yeah, I did.

title: 'We're thin out there': Injuries, adversity test Washington Football Team ahead of clash with Saints
excerpt: Ron Rivera's squad hopes a strong team culture can trump an uneven start, an off-field distraction and an ever-growing injury list.
summary: ASHBURN, Va. — Ron Rivera made one thing clear from the start of training camp: There are two tracks running through Washington Football Team headquarters.One is focused on the 2021 season. The defending NFC East champs entered with high internal and external expectations largely based on its high-profile defense. Though the middling 2-2 record after four games offers Rorschach test potential, many including the head coach view the start as 'disappointing' with ample justification.Start with horrid third-down defense and go from there.

title: 'My legs were like Jell-O': Richard Sherman played 58 snaps in 'amazing' Bucs debut
excerpt: Richard Sherman went from unsigned to playing almost every defensive snap of a Bucs win in five days, tired but grateful to have a new home.
summary: Last week was one long blur for Richard Sherman The five-time Pro Bowl cornerback flew from Seattle to Tampa, arriving late Tuesday night, five days before the Bucs would play a key game at New England. He signed a one-year contract Wednesday, went straight to meetings and then to practice, with so little time in between that he didn't have a spare minute to call his wife Ashley back home to tell her he had officially signed.After his first practice, Sherman told reporters he hoped he'd have a full week of practice to get himself ready, both physically and mentally as he sought to learn a new defense, before he would be asked to take the field.
