title: Nate Bowen named GM of Altoona Curve
excerpt: ALTOONA, Pa. (WTAJ) — Nate Bowen has been named the new General Manager of the Altoona Curve. Bowen is the sixth General Manager in the franchise's history. He spent the past three seasons as…
summary: by: Kelsey Rogers Posted: Oct 6, 2021 / 12:55 PM EDT / Updated: Oct 6, 2021 / 12:55 PM EDT ALTOONA, Pa. (WTAJ) — Nate Bowen has been named the new General Manager of the Altoona Curve. Bowen is the sixth General Manager in the franchise's history. He spent the past three seasons as Assistant General Manager and the 2022 season will mark his 10th season as a member of the Curve's front office. Former General Manager Derek Martin will serve as a Senior Advisor to assist Bowen in his new role and assist in the development of corporate partnerships for the upcoming season.

title: NY Rangers projected lineup: Players focused on fine-tuning Gerard Gallant's system
excerpt: While the outcome of preseason games is meaningless, the New York Rangers are focused on implementing their new head coach's fast-and-physical system.
summary: TARRYTOWN - The impact of preseason games can be debated, but there is added significance for a New York Rangers' team that's still adjusting to a new coach.The Gerard Gallant-led Blueshirts will host the New Jersey Devils at 7 p.m. Wednesday, with one week left to prepare for the regular-season opener in Washington against the Capitals.They'll be rolling out what looks a lot like their opening night lineup, with the only notable absence being forward Vitali Kravtsov. He missed a few days with a lower-body injury, but returned for Wednesday's morning skate at the MSG Training Center and could play in Saturday's preseason finale against the Islanders.

title: Detroit Tigers sending Spencer Torkelson, Riley Greene to Arizona Fall League
excerpt: The Detroit Tigers are sending seven players to the Arizona Fall League, including Spencer Torkelson, Riley Greene and Ryan Kreidler.
summary: Detroit Tigers rookie Matt Manning evaluates first MLB seasonDetroit Tigers right-hander Matt Manning talks Saturday, Oct. 2, 2021, after his team's 5-4 loss to the Chicago White Sox at Guaranteed Rate Field.The Detroit Tigers are sending a talented group of young players to the Arizona Fall League.This year, the Tigers will have at least seven players participating, headlined by top prospects Spencer Torkelson and Riley Greene, who could land on the team's 2022 Opening Day roster coming out of spring training.

title: Tyson Fury not hiding his gameplan for Deontay Wilder fight ⋆ Boxing News 24
excerpt: By Jim Maltzman: Tyson Fury is letting Deontay Wilder and the fans know what he intends on doing on Saturday with his game plan for their trilogy fight at
summary:
By Jim Maltzman: Tyson Fury is letting Deontay Wilder and the fans know what he intends on doing on Saturday with his game plan for their trilogy fight at the T-Mobile Arena in Las Vegas. Fury (30-0-1, 21 KOs) says he wants former WBC heavyweight champion Wilder (42-1-1, 41 KOs) to know what his strategy is for their third fight because he believes it'll be more 'challenging' for him if he's prepared to try and stop him.
The last time they fought, it was too easy for Fury with him battering an over-matched Wilder around the ring from start to finish.

title: NFL Films releases video of Tom Brady, Mac Jones embracing after Patriots-Buccaneers
excerpt: NFL Films has posted a great video showing Tom Brady and Mac Jones embracing on the field after the Buccaneers defeated the Patriots 19-17 in Week 4.
summary:
This content is not available due to your privacy preferences. Update your settings here to see it.

NFL Films releases video of Tom Brady, Mac Jones embracing after Pats-Bucs originally appeared on NBC Sports Boston

Mac Jones played just as well, if not a little bit better, than Tom Brady during the Week 4 showdown between the New England Patriots and Tampa Bay Buccaneers.

Jones threw two touchdown passes, including one early in the fourth quarter that gave the Patriots a 14-13 lead. Brady was held without a touchdown for the first time all season.

excerpt: One week after a monumental performance by Pro Picks, it was more like Prodigious Misses, with bad choices across the board. At least we've survived in knockout pools and, somehow, have hit o…
summary: One week after a monumental performance by Pro Picks, it was more like Prodigious Misses, with bad choices across the board. At least we've survived in knockout pools and, somehow, have hit on every upset special to win outright. The challenge for any prognosticator is to rebound quickly. Unfortunately, the Week 5 schedule provides far too many tossups, starting with Thursday night, when the Rams and Seahawks of the powerful NFC West meet in Seattle. The Seahawks come off a significant victory at San Francisco – no, we didn't get that one right.

title: The tough decisions that come with constructing Astros' playoff roster
excerpt: Jose Siri, Marwin Gonzalez and Jake Odorizzi all are hoping to earn one of the final...
summary: Since teams were allowed to carry a 28-man roster in last year's postseason, we have yet to see Astros general manager James Click construct a regular 26-man playoff roster.That leaves plenty of question marks as we wait for the Astros to unveil the 26 players who will make up their roster for the American League Division Series, which begins against the White Sox on Thursday afternoon at Minute Maid Park. Of course, most of the roster is set, but there are some crucial decisions that need to be made regarding the ends of the bench and bullpen.

summary:
The hits keep coming for the Detroit Lions' beleaguered offensive line.

Rookie first-round pick Penei Sewell is dealing with an ankle injury that will limit him in practice this week and has left his availability for Sunday's game against the Minnesota Vikings uncertain.

"He's a little banged up," Lions coach Dan Campbell said before practice Wednesday. "We'll see where he's at. He'll probably be limited today if not out and then we'll go from there."

title: The factors complicating D.C. United's interest in buying the Washington Spirit
excerpt: While D.C. United's owner have considering buying the NWSL's Washington Spirit, several factors have hindered any potential deal
summary: There was a bit of a bizarre sight at Audi Field last Wednesday night, just before D.C. United's encounter with Minnesota United. The Rose Room Collective, one of D.C.'s supporters groups, had hung a banner over the railing in the northwest corner of the stadium calling on Steve Baldwin, the co-owner of the NWSL's Washington Spirit, to sell his share of that club. It read 'Sell the team Steve,' a phrase that's become a rallying cry for Spirit fans who are trying to push Baldwin out amid allegations of mismanagement and a league inquiry into the club.

Cleveland Browns star defensive end Myles Garrett is not very happy with the timing of the "random" drug test he had to take this week. Garrett, 25, sounded off on social media on Tuesday, implying his choice to go sleeveless and reveal his jacked arms in the Browns' (3-1) victory over Vikings (1-3) Sunday prompted the NFL to test him the following day. 
I go sleeveless for one game and they hit me with a 'you got a random drug test in the morning'‍♂️ pic.twitter.com/P3i2EMHuFD— Flash Garrett ⚡️ (@Flash_Garrett) October 5, 2021

title: Fast Track to Nowhere for Bears Receivers
excerpt: Analysis: The Bears brought in a group of burners at wide receiver who looked like a relay team and here's what it's done for passing productivity to this point.
summary:
Oh for the days of Mitchell Trubisky to Anthony Miller, or at least Miller.
Bears fans probably wouldn't want to admit it because they'd see it as a slight to rookie Justin Fields. Their passing attack was clicking much better last year at this time. They weren't last in the league then at passing. They had contributions coming in from all receivers and they could get more than 3.25 catches per game from Allen Robinson because the ball was actually coming to him. This is not about Fields, since he's a rookie and wasn't even being prepared to play for a while until Andy Dalton's injury forced him on the field before his time—at least what Matt Nagy perceived to be his time.

title: Eagles restore OT Le'Raven Clark to practice squad
excerpt: The Eagles placed an offensive tackle back on the practice squad after a weeks-long stint on the PS injured reserve. By Dave Zangaro
summary:
This content is not available due to your privacy preferences. Update your settings here to see it.

Eagles restore veteran OT to practice squad originally appeared on NBC Sports Philadelphia

The Eagles on Wednesday restored offensive tackle Le'Raven Clark to their practice squad, keeping around a veteran offensive tackle.

Clark, 28, had been on the practice squad injured reserve since Sept. 13.

To make room on the practice squad for Clark, the Eagles released linebacker Christian Elliss.

It might seem like an insignificant move to bring back a lineman to the practice squad, but after watching the Eagles' offensive line get decimated already through four weeks, it can't hurt to have more depth.

title: Why the USMNT's 'verticality' will be important vs. Jamaica – The Athletic
excerpt: Without Christian Pulisic and Gio Reyna, the U.S. has turned its focus fully on building up quickly with wingers that bomb forward
summary:
Verticality is the current buzzword around the U.S. men's national team.



Head coach Gregg Berhalter broached the concept in a press conference following last week's announcement of the USMNT roster for the upcoming World Cup qualifiers against Jamaica, at Panama and against Costa Rica, telling reporters that it factored into his decision to call up players like Paul Arriola and Matthew Hoppe while leaving out others like Jordan Pefok and Konrad de la Fuente.



He expanded on the idea later in that same press conference, saying that he wants his team to do a better job of running in behind the opposition backline and advancing quickly through the midfield this window than it did in the September qualifiers at El Salvador, against Canada and at Honduras.

title: Kyrie Irving misses Nets practice due to New York City vaccination mandate
excerpt: The Nets held their first practice at HSS Training Center Tuesday without Irving after holding the start of training camp in San Diego.
summary: NEW YORK — Kyrie Irving has officially become a distraction. Irving, who said he didn't want his COVID-19 vaccination status to be a distraction during Nets training camp, is unable to participate in practices at home because of the New York City vaccination mandate. The Nets held their first practice at HSS Training Center Tuesday without Irving after holding the start of training camp in San Diego. The Nets are scheduled to hold practices at HSS again Wednesday and Thursday before hosting the Milwaukee Bucks on Friday night in their second preseason game.

excerpt: Michele Roberts is prepared to fight the league on withholding pay.
summary: Skip to content Michele Roberts is still hoping to get NBA players vaccinated at 100%, but she rejects any criticism about her clients' hesitancy and is prepared to fight the league on withholding pay, the union executive director told the Daily News. 'We'll see about that,' Roberts said Wednesday. 'They've been reporting that we've agreed that if a player who was not able to play because of his non-vaccination status, they could be docked [pay]. We did not agree. The league's position is that they can.

title: Wisdom of Maldini, Ibra rubbing off on England's Tomori
excerpt: From getting lessons in the art of defending from Paolo Maldini to winning games of footgolf alongside Zlatan Ibrahimovic, Fikayo Tomori has always felt the weight of history and a pressure to deli…
summary: From getting lessons in the art of defending from Paolo Maldini to winning games of footgolf alongside Zlatan Ibrahimovic, Fikayo Tomori has always felt the weight of history and a pressure to deliver at AC Milan. 'It brings out the best in me,' the 23-year-old Tomori said Wednesday about how he feels playing for the seven-time European champions. 'That kind of need to win, it's definitely a driving force.' Frozen out by Chelsea – he still doesn't know why that happened – the center back chose to ignite his career at the start of 2021 by moving to Italy, where defending is cherished more than maybe anywhere else.

title: Former White Sox All-Star Eddie Robinson dies at 100
excerpt: BASTROP, Texas (AP) — Former White Sox first baseman, and the oldest living former major league player, has died at age 100. The Texas Rangers say former big leaguer and general manager Eddie Robin…
summary:
FILE – In this Tuesday, Nov. 1, 2016 file photo, Eddie Robinson sits in a box at Progressive Field before Game 6 of the Major League Baseball World Series against the Chicago Cubs in Cleveland. Former big leaguer and general manager Eddie Robinson, who was the oldest living former MLB player, has died at age 100. The Texas Rangers, the team for which Robinson was GM from 1976-82, said he passed away Monday night, Oct. 4, 2021 at his ranch in Bastrop, Texas.(AP Photo/Gene J. Puskar)
